loans.name: Haidar

texts.en: Haidar is a 29-year-old, married man living with his wife and three young children. The children are attending school. He is the main source of income for the family. In 2009 he decided to start his own business, delivering bread to all the shops in his town. Due to his hard financial situation, Haidar is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay his children’s school fees. His purpose is to help them achieve high educational achievements.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.name: Gilma

texts.en:
Gilma is 39 years old and raises hogs for a living. She is from the community of Ormoc City in Leyte. Her business started eight years ago to support the needs of her four children, ages six to sixteen. 

Gilma is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed, so she can continue and expand her business to meet the needs of her family. She hopes to be more successful in her business and live a prosperous life with her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet lives in the village of Hayravank in Gegharkunik region. He has a nice family; he lives with his wife (she is a teacher at the village school), two sons, and a daughter (all of them are school-aged).

Hamlet graduated Sevan city’s agricultural college, and that knowledge now greatly helps him in his farming and agricultural activities. For several years, Hamlet worked as a social worker, but now, with his lovely wife, he runs a farm.

On his farm he has cows, calves, bulls, pigs, and sheep. On his plot of land he cultivates potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, and greens. So, his farm’s milk, cheese, meat, and vegetables he sells at the local wholesale market during the week.

He mentions that all his efforts and income from farming he uses for his children’s needs to provide them with all that is needed, so to see them always healthy and happy. He dreams of his farm enlargement, but it seems impossible because the income covers only the everyday needs of the family.

This loan will be helpful for Hamlet, since he will be able to buy one cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is 56 years old and he lives in the city of Gavar of the Gegharkunik region. For several years, Yurik worked at the meat combine, then he was seriously engaged in fishing, and for several years he also did different building jobs around his region. Now his only occupation is farming, with which his wife helps him. They have three sons; two of them live and work in Russian Federation and only their smallest son lives with them, and he is busy with construction work. 

Yurik has a cute farm where he wants to develop sheep breeding. Currently on his farm, he has two cows and 30 sheep. He mentions that the sale of meat, particularly mutton, from his farm is rather profitable for him and the only constant income for his family. Yurik requested this loan of 300,000 Armenian drams since his cattle lack fodder, and with this amount he will buy enough fodder until the pastures are filled with enough grass for the cattle.

loans.use: to buy enough fodder for his animals

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 20-year-old divorced woman living with her parents. Her father is the main income provider in the family. In 2013, she started her business by opening in her house a small room where she sells make-up, perfumes, and accessories, using her special selling skills and providing high quality products. She is well-known in her region with the unique objects that she offers, in addition to her friendly and adorable personality. 

Today, Malak is asking for a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., to increase her inventory to meet the needs of her clients. In the future, she hopes to open her own shop.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is 44 years old and he lives in Dilijan city with his wife and three children. He has a higher education. For many years he worked at the dairy-products factory, then at the bread factory. Several years he also worked as a fireman and now his only occupation is farming. 

With the help of his wife, Aram takes care of cows and calves on his farm. He sells milk, macun (a national dairy-product), cheese and meat to his neighbors and to his regular customers. 

Aram mentions that he has a lot of financial hardships in his family and he has an idea that may lighten it. With this Kiva loan he plans to start pig breeding and he will buy pigs for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to start pig breeding. He will buy pigs for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is a constructor. He is mainly involved in the internal renovation of houses and receives orders from local people.
 
Hayk lives with his wife and two sons. He feels very responsible to provide his family with good living conditions and works hard to achieve that goal.

He needs some financial support to invest in his work. Hayk has applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials needed for providing construction works. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed in his  construction business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tropical fruits such as passion fruit, mangoes, oranges, grapefruits and other vegetables

loans.name: Zhyparkul

texts.ru: Жыпаркул, 47 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, 20 лет занимается животноводством. У Жыпаркул в хозяйстве есть 5 коров. Благодаря упорному труду Жыпаркул и ее дружной семьи, бизнес приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере до 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для откорма и реализации. Увеличение поголовья позволит развить ее бизнес и увеличить доходы семьи. Доходы от кредита Жыпаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и обучение детей.
texts.en: Zhyparkul is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She has a secondary education. She has reared animals for the last 20 years for her family's main income. Zhyparkul has five cows. Thanks to the hard work of Zhyparkul and her close-knit family, the business fetches a monthly income of up to 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Zhyparkul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy ten sheep to fatten up and sell. The increase in her herd will allow her to develop her business and increase her family's income. Zhyparkul plans to invest the profits from the loan in further expanding her business and educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 52 years old and she hopes that her first loan with Kiva and Nor Horizon will be greatly profitable for her business and it will be a continuous cooperation. Anahit lives in Vanadzor, a city in Lori region, with her husband and two sons. 

Anahit graduated from college, the faculty of accountancy. Over 15 years she has been in the clothes trading business at the city’s wholesale market, where she rents a stall and sells men clothes. Her stall is popular and highly visited, since the clothes that she sells are very fashionable and stylish and are displayed very nicely. She brings the merchandise from Yerevan once a month. 

With this Kiva loan, Anahit wants to get ready for the coming summer season. She will buy a new assortment of men clothes suitable for warm weather.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of fashionable men's clothes for the coming warm weather

loans.name: Kelvin Samuel

texts.es:
Kelvin de 23 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor que está por finalizar su carrera de arquitectura, vive con su abuela, una tía y varios primos que también estudian.
		
Kelvin no es un joven cualquiera, su emprendedurismo lo caracteriza, él tiene un negocio de CiferCafe el cual inicio hace un par de años, decidió empezar este negocio porque le gusta la informática y porque donde vive no hay nadie mas que ofrezca dicho servicio.


Él necesita mucho de la ayuda de este crédito para comprar muebles de computadora para tener mejor equipado su ciber.

Él sueña con el día en que finalmente logre obtener su título de la carrera de arquitectura, pues han sido muchos años de esfuerzo y dedicación y confía en que pronto verá su recompensa.
texts.en:
Kelvin, age 23, is an enterprising young man who is about to finish his architecture degree. He lives with his grandmother, an aunt and some cousins who also study.  

Kelvin is not just any young man, his enterprising nature characterizes him.  He has a CiberCafe which he started a couple of years ago.  He decide to start this business because he likes computers and because where he lives, there is nobody else offering this service.

He really needs this loan to purchase furniture for the computers to have his café better equipped.  He dreams of the day that he graduates with his architecture degree, as it has been many years of effort and dedication.  He is confident that he will soon see the reward.

loans.use: to purchase computer furniture to better equip his CiberCafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chargers to charge customers' telephones

loans.name: Apophia

texts.en: Apophia is a 43-year-old married mother of five children. She operates a retail shop as her major source of income and has been in business for over nine years. She applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy sugar, salt, soda, tomatoes and other items to restock her shop. Apophia hopes that with the help of the loan, she will be able to boost her business and make more profit to meet her financial obligations. She appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items to sell

loans.name: Musalam

texts.ru: 57 летняя жительница города Душанбе Мусалам. У нее есть один единственный сын. Она живет вместе сыном, потому что она потеряла мужа. После смерти мужа Мусалам одна вырастила сына.  Мусалам у себя дома занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она 45 лет продвигает свою работу. Мусалам опытная и активная женщина. В швейном деле ей нравится сшить национальную женскую одежду. Ее доход от этой деятельности. У нее сейчас проблема  со здоровьями. Она хочет купить лекарство для лечения, но у нее нет денег, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Мусалама надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Musalam is a 57-year-old resident of the city of Dushanbe. She has one son. She lives with her son because she has lost her husband. After her husband's death, Musalam raised her son on her own. Musalam sews women's clothes to order at home. She has been doing this work for 45 years. Musalam is an experienced and active woman. What she likes about her sewing business is sewing women's national costume. Her income comes from this business. At the moment she has a health problem. She wants to buy medicine for treatment, but she has no money and so she has applied for a loan. Musalam hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her health.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de viva, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, posee 20 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los pueblos aledaños, gracias a sus ventas es como logra salir delante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos para el cultivo de maíz como fertilizantes, abonos controles de plagas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, etc. por mayor para poder mejorar el rendimiento de sus cultivos y asi tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 37 years old. She lives in her own home and works growing beans and rice. She has twenty years of farming experience. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the containers shown in this picture and later sells her product in the towns nearby. Her sales are what allow her to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies for her crops of corn. These include wholesale fertilizer, pest-control products, herbicides, etc. - which will allow her to improve her crops' performance in order for her to have better financial income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fertilizer, pest-control products, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 34 years old and raises hogs for a living. This has been her business for a year now.  She is married with three children ages 8, 9 and 10. 

Benita would like to improve her business, to make it bigger and raise healthier hogs. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feed and supplements. 

Benita is a responsible mother to her children. She will continue to work hard so that she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara sends her greetings from Kapan city. She is happy to have another chance to cooperate with Kiva and Nor Horizon. She is a widow, and now she lives with her youngest son’s family. Now the son is unemployed, and Tamara’s trading business is very important and the only source of income for her family. She started the business in 1997 and has continued it until today. She runs her clothes-trading business at the city wholesale market, renting a stall there. She sells there men's, women's and children's clothes and underwear. She is happy that, despite hardships, she has managed to keep her business going for 18 years, and she has not lost any of her regular customers. She brings her merchandise once per month from Yerevan city’s wholesale market.

Tamara will be so pleased if Kiva lenders help her with a loan amount once more. With this loan Tamara plans to buy a spring-summer season clothes collection, with the hope that she will have good and profitable sales from it.

loans.use: to buy a spring-summer season clothes collection, with hope that she will have good and profitable sales from it.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 48 years old, married and has three children, ages 9, 15, and 17. Her husband is a driver. To help the family, she raises chicks to be sold in 45 days. Chicken is in high demand from consumers and is very easy to sell in the market. Teresita finds this business profitable. She is asking for a loan to buy more chicks, feed and two sacks of rice. She is motivated to work hard for her children. Her income will cover school fees and business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, feed and two sacks of rice

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a sari-sari (variety) store owner from Ormoc City. She is married with three children ages 4, 6 and 8. Her small store opened two years ago. Marianita is proud of her business because this allows her to help her husband, who works as a driver and a carpenter. She is requesting a loan to buy beer, liquor, soft drinks, sugar, rice, coconuts, seasonings, condiments and spices.

Marianita dreams of having a bigger place to sell her commodities. In the future, she hope to make her business more successful so she could send her children to school to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy beer, liquor, soft drinks, sugar, rice, coconuts, seasonings, condiments and spices

loans.name: Young Heart Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Marthah, 65 years old and the mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 in order to benefit through the training in enterprise and financial management.

She does mixed farming to earn her living. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer to increase her production. She hopes this will enable her to increase her income and improve her living standards such as better health care and quality education.

Marthah is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer that will improve production, thus increasing more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, coffee and tea leaves, so as to be able to make tea and coffee for her customers

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is 48 years old and he lives in Dilijan city with his family. He is married and he has three children. Garik has always been a farmer  Now on his farm he has several cows and calves, which gives him a chance to sell milk, cheese and meat from his farm. 

Garik is worried since his family’s income is very little, compared with their needs and he thinks that with his farm’s enlargement that problem will be solved. With this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams, Garik plans to use it on the purchase of several calves and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of several calves and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Rehamni

texts.en:
Rehamni is a 60 year old, married woman and has been running a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has six children. Rehamni is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income.

loans.name: Ceaser

texts.en: Ceaser, 28 and single, is a new client who is applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. After earning a diploma in agriculture, he looked for a job but was unsuccessful. He then decided to start a business to earn a living. He now runs a food stall that sells tomatoes, pumpkins, onions, carrots, green peppers, and bananas, among other food items, in the central market. Through this business he has been able to support himself. His dream of expanding his business has been halted by limited working capital so he is seeking financial support from a financial institution. He hopes that with this loan, he will be able to expand his business and continue to support himself and his siblings. He thanks UGAFODE for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell

loans.name: Delicia

texts.en:
Delicia is 53 years old and she lives with her daughter in El Alto, where she pays rent.

Delicia needs a loan to buy clothes for her business. Delicia is making money as an itinerant saleswoman. She would like to have her own store some day, because she doesn't like to go to many places.  Delicia also travels a lot to find the clothes for men and women.  She has to compete with people that sell used clothes and that is a big problem for her, so she hopes you can help her.

Delicia is healthy and she works hard to support her daughter

loans.use: to buy stock for her itinerant clothes selling business

loans.name: Isagani

texts.en:
Isagani is a 27-year-old married father of two children, ages 1 and 3, and resides in Badian, Cebu. He and his wife work hard and rely on their eatery business for a living. In a table near his house, they sell home-cooked dishes such as buttered vegetables, fried fish, stewed meat and noodles. Isagani is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, soy sauce, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, flour, and pepper. 

In the future, he hope to see his business become more profitable and for it to flourish.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soy sauce, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, flour, and pepper.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta, from Vanadzor city of Lori region, greatly thanks the lenders for her first Kiva loan. She has one more idea, to cooperate once more. Marieta has a higher pedagogical education, and for many years until today she has been working at the school, as a teacher of mathematics and informatics. She also has a group of pupils, to whom she gives paid courses of informatics and mathematics at her home. Marieta mentions that she is happy with the choice of her profession and her everyday work with her pupils. Marieta is married and both her husband and her son are sportsmen, and very famous in the field of sport. This time Marieta asks for a Kiva loan because she would like to furnish the room where she is teaching her courses to the pupils. This loan will help her to buy a big round table and several chairs for working in comfortable conditions, both for her and her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a big round table and several chairs for working in comfortable conditions, both for her and her pupils.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 30-year-old woman from Ormoc City, Leyte.  She is married, with an eight year old daughter.  Nora is engaged in a sari-sari store business. In her store she sell shampoo, soy sauce, coffee, cooking oil, sugar and chips. Nora hope to be of help to her husband, who work as a welder. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks for her store, such as soft drinks, canned goods, candies, chips, coffee, milk and sugar. 

In the future, she hope to send her child to school until she graduate from College.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, candies, chips, coffee, milk and sugar for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa is a farmer, and she has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past several years. Specifically, she grows haricot, cucumber, potato and cabbage. Alisa organizes cultivation in her greenhouse, which is located near the house where Alisa and her son live. Her husband is a seasonal migrant worker, who left his country with the hope of finding a well-paid job and sustaining his family's living.

Alisa has applied for this loan to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. This is her second loan. Unfortunately her first loan, which she got from a local financial institution, was very difficult to return back, and Alisa faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during more recent times, she and her family have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, Alisa has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is 41 years old and he makes and sells ice cream to make some money.  He learned how to prepare ice cream when he was 22 years old.

Jorge needs a loan to pay for the repair of one of his ice cream machines. He needs your help because this business is the only thing that Jorge knows how to do.  Jorge is single and he doesn't have children but he takes care of his parents.  He hopes you can help him

loans.use: to pay for the repair to one of his ice cream machines

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is a 65-year old-woman residing in Tanauan, Leyte. She is married with four grown children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells basic commodities like biscuits, chips, condiments, and toiletries. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise for her store, like soft drinks, canned goods, and seasonings. These items will improve the content of her store and augment her income. Thus, she will be able to pay her obligations and start to do some expansion.

Candida hopes that she will be able to handle her business successfully for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her variety store

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlene is 51 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marlene has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Marlene has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
This nice and charming woman is a pedagogue, with higher education and her name is Lilit. She lives in Kapan city of Syunik region with her husband, who works at the Kapan city’s combine as a locksmith and their two children. 

Lilit works at the school now as a teacher of Armenian History. Her pedagogical experience is already 14 years and as she says, she likes her specialty year by year, more and more. She also gives paid private courses at her house and helps the pupils for the entrance exams. 

Lilit asks a loan of 600.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and also professional literature. She greatly needs both during her courses at her house, in order to make the courses more interesting and informative for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature for teaching.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald sells milk and he helps his mother with the business. He is living at his parent's house.  He needs a loan to buy his own milking cow.

Ronald also works as a mason and he receives help from his brother with the dairy business.  Ronald is single and he doesn't have children, but he supports his family. He also want to have his own house in the future and would like to have his own farm 

As you can see in the picture, the house where Ronald lives is very poor

loans.use: to buy his own milking cow

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 49-year-old married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married with two children, who are 15 and 18 years old. Nenita works hard to earn a living through hog raising. This is her way of helping her husband, who is a driver. This business provides her the income that she needs for their expenses. Aside from raising hogs, she also sells vegetables and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. 

Nenita is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy piglets, vegetables, canned goods, soft drinks and chips, candies, seasonings, and condiments. She believes that if she is provided support through loans, she will be able to improve her businesses to generate more revenue. Nenita dreams of seeing her family experiencing fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy piglets, vegetables, and items for her variety store

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of vegetables for her buy-and-sell vegetable business.

Monica has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from selling rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell through her business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Magdalena is 60 years old now.

Magdalena has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Magdalena has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María, de 57 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es madre soltera, se separó de su esposo desde hace 19 años, en ese matrimonio procreó 4 hijos, de los cuales solo uno de ellos vive con ella.

María, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 21 años de edad, antes ella trabajaba con el papá, pero cuando se casó, continúo trabajando con su esposo, pero después que se separaron ella siguió trabajando con sus hijos, para sacarlos adelante.- María, además de la agricultura también se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, ella compra los árboles de aguacate por cosecha y luego cuando ya hay fruto sale a vender aguacates.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para alquilar 12,000 metros cuadrados de terreno para cultivarlo y para comprar herbicidas, pesticidas y semilla de maíz, ya que está vez cultivará más que el año pasado.

Ella tiene mucha fé en Dios y espera que este año sea muy bueno, ya que el año pasado no le fue muy bien.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old and wasn't able to go to school. She and her husband separated nineteen years ago, but she has four children from that marriage. Only one of them lives with her.

María has been farming since she was 21 years old. She used to work with her father, but when she got married she continued working with her husband. After they separated she continued to work with her children in order to provide for them. Besides farming, María also works selling fruits and vegetables. She buys avocado trees by the crop and as soon as there is fruit to sell she goes out selling avocados.

She will use the loan she is requesting to rent 12,000 square meters of land to farm. She will also purchase herbicides, pesticides, and corn seed, since she will be growing more corn this year than last.

She has a lot of faith in God and hopes that this will be a very good year, since last year didn't go very well for her.

loans.use: to rent land and buy herbicides, pesticides, and corn seeds.

loans.name: Kinungi Baraka Women Group

texts.en:
Hannah, the lady raising a passbook in the photo, is a member of Kinungi Baraka Women Group. She is 49 years old, married and blessed with 6 children, who are all attending school.

Hannah is a mixed farmer; she farms potatoes, onions, kale, spinach and also has a cow that she milks.

She is borrowing a loan to buy animal feeds and certified seeds, which will enable her get more milk from the cow and improve her vegetable production.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and certified seeds, which will increase production of milk and vegetables to earn more income.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 65 years old, married and has 8 children. She joined Hand in Hand to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

She is a farmer growing spinach, cabbages, potatoes and keeps dairy cattle. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds, which will enable her to increase milk production, hence earn more income to meet her family's expenses.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds, which will enable her increase milk production hence earn more income to meet her family's expenses.

loans.name: Adoukoé

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 31 ans, Adoukoué est une femme mère de trois enfants. Adoukoué habite à Djidjolé et vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Adoukoué s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un  marché local. Pour commander des paniers de tomates, de piments et des légumes, Adoukoué demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Adoukoé, age 31, is married with three children. She lives in Djidjolé. She sells basic food products in her neighborhood to earn the income necessary to ensure her children’s well-being. 

To that end, Adoukoé stocks up twice a month at a local market. She is seeking this loan to buy baskets of tomatoes, peppers and vegetables. This revenue will allow Adoukoé to help her husband provide for their children’s education.

loans.use: to buy one basket of tomatoes, some peppers and some vegetables.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are going to school.  Nieves is a seamstress. Her husband travels a lot because of his work, so she practically takes care of her family alone.  

Nieves needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, because she has  a lot of work to do and she will hire an assistant. 

Nieves would like to have a bigger workshop in the future. She has her own house, but she has many expenses with her children, so she hopes you can help her

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for an assistant.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a 44-year-old sari-sari (variety) store owner from Villaba, Leyte. For quite some time, this store has been her livelihood in helping her husband, who is a fisherman, generate income. Their three children are all grown, and Paz wants them to support themselves from their own hard work.

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy merchandise such as canned goods, chips and soft drinks. It is Paz's dream to continue improving her inventory so that she can increase her business profitability and save for old age.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips and soft drinks

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell mud crabs business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of mud crabs to sell through her buy-and-sell mud crabs business.

Jeneth has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of mud crabs to sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Ann, fifty years old, married and blessed with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2014.

Ann is a maize, beans and poultry farmer. She is grateful to HiH EA for developing her entrepreneurship spirit through training and mentorship. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase chicken feed. This will enhance their production of eggs and quality meat for better customer satisfaction and hence higher profits. She hopes to use the profits to support her family needs such as food and education for her children.

Ann is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed that will help boost egg and meat production; thus profiting more to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 60 years old, She works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of fruits to sell for her buy and sell fruits business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits to sell

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods like cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, soap and condiments. She is a 47-year-old married woman with three dependents. Her youngest child is 15 years old. She has been running a sari-sari store for five years now.
 
She has requested a loan to buy assorted merchandise for the store. Replenishing her stock will augment her income and gradually increase her earnings. Thus, she will be able to handle her finances and able to provide the needs of her growing children. 

She is hoping that someday, with determination and courage, she will be able to improve her livelihood for better living.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita is 40 years old.

Nenita has a business selling sand and gravel in the Philippines. She requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sand and gravel to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is 56 years old and has four children. She is married now.

Veneranda is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Veneranda has been in this business for 26 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Veneranda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Sucita

texts.en:
Sucita is 37 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Sucita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Sucita has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Sucita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Neda

texts.en:
Neda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Neda requested a 14,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for making a boat like wood, nails, bamboo, etc.

Neda has been in this business for 20 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for making a boat like wood, nails, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Adilina

texts.en:
Adilina is 54 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Adilina works very hard to provide for them.

Adilina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Adilina has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Adilina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Teresita has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetable to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah works hard to support her family. Leah is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Leah has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Leah would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Norafe

texts.en:
Norafe is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Norafe is 26 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Norafe requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets, gasoline, etc.

Norafe has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Norafe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 24 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, personal product care and other groceries.

Gemma has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Angie Joy

texts.en:
Angie Joy works hard to support her family. Angie Joy has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of gasoline, bamboo and fishing net.

Angie Joy has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Angie Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of gasoline, bamboo and fishing nets

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 30 years old and married with one child, who is in school. Beatriz works very hard to provide for them.

Beatriz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Beatriz has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 43 years old, married with four children, who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell .

Annaliza has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna works hard to support her family. Anna is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Anna has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Anna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking woman and entrepreneur. She has six children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers. She supplements her farming income with earnings from her food vending.

Letecia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Rina is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and gasoline for her fishing business.

Rina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and gasoline

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn is 38 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Lalyn is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Geraline

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Geraline works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Geraline is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, rice, etc. for her food vending business. 

Geraline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ruth works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring shop in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising pigs. Ruth is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like linen, scissors, tailoring chalk and other items for her tailoring business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like linen, scissors, tailoring chalk, and other tools

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 62 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal "buy-and-sell" business in the Philippines and also earns an income from farming rice.

Divina has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She has been running the charcoal "buy-and-sell" for 25 years and aspires to build and expand her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has  had a buy and sell charcoal business for 4 years. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.  Mary Jane earns additional income from food vending.

She has  sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a  coconut and banana business for 11 years. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy bananas and coconuts.   Rebeca earns additional income from selling charcoal.

She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Noeurn's Group

texts.en:
Noeurn, 51, lives in the Battambang province. She is a mother of five children, and three of them still depend on her. Feeding pigs, growing rice and working for other farms have been the sources of income for her family for ages, and these activities earn her about 53,000 KHR per day.  

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. With her portion, she plans to buy pig feed to support her business. She hopes to earn more money and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 56 years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from savings mobilization and enterprise development training.

She practices poultry keeping and she is borrowing to buy more chicks which will, in the future, increase her stock of chicken birds and egg production to enable her to meet her customers' demands.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chicks which will, in the future, increase her stock of chicken birds and egg production to enable her to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira is a farmer and has been raising seasonal crops and vegetables for the past thirteen years. Specifically, Ira cultivates corn and tomatoes. She lives in Verin Dvin village with her son, who helps his mother selling the harvest in the local market.

To be able to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and pay for renovation of the tractor, Ira is asking lenders for financial support. As this is Ira's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Ira get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Ensuring responsible monthly payments of the loan, Ira and her son hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and for renovation of the tractor.

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
Hean is a  37-year-old married woman with 4 children, who lives with her family in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. Two children attend school.

She grows cassava and rice as the main source of income. She also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in her job for 17 years. 

This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she successfully repaid her previous loan. She leads a group of two to get this new loan  to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. She hopes that she can earn more income as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ana Daysee

texts.es: Ana de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene 30 años de experiencia en esa actividad, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, comercializa sus productos durante todo el año y ay tiene clientes establecidos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y para la preparación del suela y así poder tener una cosecha mas productiva.
texts.en:
Ana, 47 years of age, lives in her own house with her husband. 

She makes a living growing corn and beans. She has 30 years of experience in this business. When her harvest is already stored in the barns, shown in the photograph, she markets her products throughout the year, and already has established customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, etc., for the preparation of the soil, so that she can have a more productive harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 26 years old. She is married and has one daughter who is six years old. She and her family live in Villaba, Leyte. Rosario is engaged in selling fish in her neighborhood. Sometimes she will use a pail and carry it to sell on a house-to-house basis. She works hard because she wants her child to have a better future by her schooling. 

Rosario is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. Rosario is motivated to continue her business because this is also her way of helping her husband, who is a fisherman. In the future, she hopes to have another business by which she can earn a living.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 43 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Narcisa has been farming rice for five years and earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Erminda has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is a 55-year-old married woman with six children who works hard to provide for her family.

She has run a general store for 5 years and requests 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy  canned goods, chips, soap, shampoo, and eggs.

Ma. Lourdes has borrowed and repaid 13 previous loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips, soap, shampoo, and eggs.

loans.name: Marcedonia

texts.en:
Marcedonia is a married woman with nine children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business  and earns additional income from a general store.  Marcedonia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy fishing materials.

Marcedonia has  sustained her business through  3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 58 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of fertilizer for her farm.

Rowena has been farming rice for 15 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and supplements this income with earnings from raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to pay for  laborers' salaries and buy sacks of fertilizers.

Marivic dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries and buy sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Baraka Faith Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Lucy, 36 years old, married and blessed with three children. She is a dairy farmer. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 with an aspiration to be trained and be able to gain economic and social power. She used her first loan to buy animal feed. She is borrowing a second Kiva loan to buy more animal feed and add one calf to her herd. This will improve production and thus more income and profits to cater for family needs.

She is grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy a calf and animal feed to improve production.

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en:
Eang is a 43-year-old widow  living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She has seven children, six are dependent on her. 

She grows cassava as the main source of income and also works as a paid worker to supplement her family’s income. She has been involved in this job for 23 years and  earns 31,200 KHR per day. 

This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her previous loan. She leads a group of three to get a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. 

She hopes to earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
Sarat is a 49-year-old woman with seven children who lives in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province.  Six children attend school.

 She overcomes her family’s hardship by growing cassava as the main source of income. She also grows rice to sell. This is her seventh time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she repaid previous loans. As a group leader of two members, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers and pay for workers . 

She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer  and pay for workers.

loans.name: Srey Nou's Group

texts.en:
A resident of the Ou Reang Ov district of the Kampong Cham province, Srey Nou is 30 years old and a mother of three dependent children. She has been growing rice as her main source of income. She also works as a teacher to supplement her income. 

This is Srey Nou's her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of her two-member group, she will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 42 years old, married and living with her husband and three children, one of whom is still in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa and has undergone the training on enterprise development and financial management.

She practices mixed farming, where she grows spinach and kale and is also a poultry farmer. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy more chicks to add to her poultry stock so that in the future she can sell more eggs and meet her customers' demands; hence paying school fees for her child.

Margaret is happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to add to her poultry stock so that in the future she can sell more eggs and meet her customers' demands and pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Kimsan's Group

texts.en:
Kimsan is a grocery seller in a rural village located in Battambang province. She is the mother of four children, two of them are in school and the other two are too young to go to school. 

She has been involved in selling groceries for a long time and it has allowed her to have enough consumption for her family to use. Due to not having sufficient funds to expand her business, she decided to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy more grocery items for sale. 

She hopes that she can earn more money and have the ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for sale

loans.name: Hannan

texts.en:
Hannan is a 41-year-old lady who joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2011 to benefit from trainings. She is married and blessed with four children, two of whom are in school.

Her economic activity is vegetable farming and also selling used clothes to the local villagers in her neighborhood. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more used clothes to add stock to her clothes selling business to enable her to cater for her family expenses such as food and access to better medical care services.

Hannan is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to add stock for her clothes selling business to enable her to cater for her family expenses such as food and access to better medical care services.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a 55-year-old widow from Villaba, Leyte. She has six grown children. For 22 years, she has bought the fishermen’s catch to sell to other fish vendors. This business allows her to earn 10,000 PHP per month. Angelita is asking a loan as an additional capital to expand her business and buy more fish. Her income will afford her a healthy diet, savings, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Marlet

texts.en:
Marlet is a 26-year-old married woman from Villaba, Leyte. She has two children, ages five and seven. Her husband is a fisherman. From her husband's livelihood, Marlet learned to sell his catch. Aside from selling his catch, she also learned how to buy fish from other fishermen to sell in the community. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to resell. Her business has its peak during early morning and afternoon to evening. An additional capital will allow her to expand her business and earn more for her children. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school, so that they will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years now. 

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable and fruit business and  earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Rowena is borrowing  11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fruit and vegetables to sell..

Rowena has sustained her business  through  2 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Maricel has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Elizabeth, thirty-six years old and married with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

She does maize and potato farming. Financial management skills have been a core factor in managing her business well. She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as manure and pesticide. This will enable her to increase production, hence improving her income and thus being in a position to educate her children.

Elizabeth is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and manure that will help increase income to help provide her family needs with ease.

loans.name: Mak's Group

texts.en:
Mak is a rice and cassava farmer who lives in Battambang province.  She has six children. 

She has been involved in this business for twenty years and earns 69,000 KHR per day. Mak has been with VisionFund for four cycles  and has successfully repaid the loans. The previous loans help her to have a better house. 

She leads a group to take a new loan, and will use her portion to buy seeds and pay for plowing. She hopes to earn more money to buy farmland to expand.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene más de 15 años de experiencia en esa actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, cultiva en la época de lluvia en los meses de mayo a noviembre, y vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Juan está  solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y preparar la tierra para poder un buen cultivo y asi tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan is 60 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He works growing beans and corn. He has more than 15 years experience in this activity which he started with his own capital. He grows in the rainy season from May to November and sells his product in the area around where he lives. Juan is requesting a loan to buy herbicides, manure, fertilizer, pest control, etc. to prepare the land and have a good harvest. Then he will have greater profit for a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, manure, fertilizer, pest control, etc. to prepare the land.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, trabaja en esa actividad desde muy joven y gracias a su trabajo es como ha logrado salir adelante, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y ay tiene muchos clientes, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumo para su cultivo fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Juan is 63 years old and lives in hie own house with his son. He works growing corn and beans. He has worked in this business since he was quite young and thanks to his labor he has been able to get ahead. He sells his product in the areas surrounding his residence and has many clients. He is requesting a loan to buy inputs for his crops like fertilizer, manure, pest control and herbicides to improve the land shown in the photo. Then he can continue to work to obtain greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his crops like fertilizer, manure, pest control and herbicides to improve the land.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita lives in Villaba, Leyte. She owns a sari-sari store where she sell items like chips, candies, biscuits, toothpaste, soap, canned goods and noodles. Her business started nine years ago. She's happy because this allow her to earn an income of 3500 PHP. 

Conchita is asking for additional capital to buy feed, purified water, canned goods, candies, biscuits, chips, noodles and rice. She is determined to improve her inventory so she can earn better from her business
.
In the future,  she hopes to expand her business to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, purified water, canned goods, candies, biscuits, chips, noodles and rice for her store.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetable and spices business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell for her buy and sell vegetable and spices business.

Miguela has been in this business for 20 years. Miguela earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Jessia

texts.en:
Jessia is 38 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by selling ornamental plants in the Philippines. Jessia is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seedlings, fertilizers, plastic pots, etc for her business.

Jessia has been selling ornamental plants for 8 years and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedling, fertilizers, plastic pots, etc for her ornamental plants business

loans.name: Choeurn's Group

texts.en:
Choeurn is 45 years old and the mother of six children, living in Battambang province. Growing rice on two hectare farmland is the main source of her family’s income and selling grocery items is an addition source of income for her. 

She wants to expand her current businesses, but she has not enough money to do so. Now she is leading a group to take a new loan with VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and buy more grocery items for resale. 

She hopes through this loan her business will be expanded and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice fields.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in the village of Norashen in the Gegharkunik region with her husband, two school-aged sons, and her mother-in-law, who is retired.

Anna never worked as an employee, but she is already a skilled farmer and owner of a nice, good-sized farm. Now she takes care of cows, bulls, heifers, a horse and a lot of pigs and piglets, specializing in swine breeding.

Anna, with her husband, sells a great amount of meat to their regular customers and a butcher from the city. They also sell milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese and curd to their neighbors. She also finds potato cultivation profitable for her family, and several re-sellers regularly buy potatoes from her farm.

Anna will be happy if Kiva lenders support her with a loan amount, which she is planning to use on the purchase of four more calves for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase four more calves for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Voeurn's Group

texts.en:
Voeurn, 34, is a mother of three children who are all in school and living in Battambang province. The sources of her family’s income are from growing cassava and rice, and working for other farms for fees. She has been involved in these businesses for more than five years, and she earns about 63,000 KHR per day. 

She is now lacking funds to do farming, so she decided to lead a group of three to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund. She will spend her loan portion to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees. She hopes she will gain more income and ability to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Sarorm's Group

texts.en:
Sarorm is the married mother of seven children, living in Battambang province.  Nowadays, her family’s living is dependent on rice and potato farming, which she has been doing for twelve years. Working for other farms is an additional source of her family’s income. 

Now she is leading a group to apply for this loan with her portion to be used to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to support her current business. She hopes to have a better living condition through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for the plowing fees on her farm.

loans.name: Medardo Ruben

texts.es: Medardo de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, su esposa le ayuda en las siembras, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad,  con las ventas que realiza de sus productos es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumo para su cultivo como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas,pesticidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea iniciar sus siembras que es el que muestra la fotografía y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Medardo is 58 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two daughters. He works growing corn and sorghum. His wife helps him with his crops. He has more than 20 years working in this business and with the sales of his product he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, pesticides, etc. to improve the land where he wants to plant which is shown in the photograph. Doing this he can obtain greater income for a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, pesticides, etc. to improve the land.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is a 59-year-old hard working woman from Villaba, Leyte. She is engaged in selling fresh fish in her place to earn a living. This livelihood started when her two children were still young and now they are adults. 

She is asking a loan to buy more fish to sell. With more fish to offer, she will not run out of supplies and this will pave the way to a better revenue. Her profit will be used for a healthy diet, food and savings for future investment.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment and pay employee salaries for her cafe

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 40-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education.

Nasreen is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors, to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors and to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Sochea is 41 and living in Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of five children who are all still depending on her to look after them. Rice farming and grocery selling are the sources of her family’s income. She has been involved in these businesses for 23 years. 

This is the second loan for her with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Now she has decided to take this loan in order to buy more grocery items to sell. She wants to expand her current business through this loan and hopes to earn more money to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Kimheang

texts.en:
Kimheang is 42 years old, and a married mother of two children who are all in school and living in Kampong Cham province. Rice farming and selling fish have been the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund in order to buy more kinds of fish to sell and to make a fishpond for feeding fish. She hopes her business will be expanded through this loan.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of fish to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Shelah

texts.en:
Shelah is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children, one of whom is in school.

She runs a direct selling of Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of Avon products to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store.

Shelah dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of Avon products for re-sale.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy, 50, is a mother of two dependent children, living in Battambang province. The sources of her family’s income are from cassava farming, and growing rice and corn. Channy has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 79,000 KHR per day to support her family’s living expenses. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for a new Kiva loan via VisionFund in order to buy seeds and to pay plowing fees. She hopes to earn more money and be able to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make a down payment on the vehicle

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan lives with wife and child in the Fuzuli region for over 22 years. But he is an IDP( Internally Displaced Person) from an occupied zone. Elshan is 31 years old. His son goes to kindergarten. 

Elshan has a little store and has been selling different goods like slippers, powder etc. A while ago he has applied to Komak for a loan in the amount of 700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more goods for selling. 

He says thanks for loan to the Kiva organization and its lenders. In the future he wants to repair his store.

loans.use: to buy more goods and increase business in his store.  In the future, he wants to repair his store.

loans.name: Jerito

texts.en:
Jerito is 58 years old. He lives in Villaba, Leyte. Jerito relies on his welding services to earn an income. This business has been his source of income for four years now. He earns 6,000 PHP per month through this business.

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy a grinder, a tank and a hose that will help make his work easier. His income will be used for food and for business expansion. Jerito dreams of having a better location for his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a tank, a hose and a grinder

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman is 56 years old and he is a farmer. He is married and has a son, who helps on the farm. They raise crops and sell them at the local bazaar. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of the house.

Mehman has been working in this area for 21 years and has good experience. He teaches his son everything he knows. His monthly salary is 185AZN and it doesn't cover family needs. 

Mehman needs to install a master valve and a new irrigation system. He applied for 1000AZN loan in order to install it.

loans.use: to install a master valve and a new irrigation system

loans.name: Breana

texts.en:
Breana began selling Mary Kay in February. She decided to sell Mary Kay because she has a passion for making women feel beautiful. She has been interested in the beauty industry for many years and decided this was her chance to enter into it. Breana feels that the core values aspired by Mary Kay fit her philosophy on life and lifestyle, with emphasis on faith, family, and career. 

She has been working hard to market her business and is looking to make a bulk purchase of inventory to launch the business.
