She is focusing on marketing her business through various forms of social media, word of mouth referrals, and the posting of promotional materials in coffee shops and community boards. 

Breana has suffered some health issues, and she desires to feel beautiful on the outside as well as the inside. She hopes to provide this to her customers. She is passionate about providing encouragement and excellent customer service to her potential customers.

Breana will use her Kiva loan to place a bulk inventory purchase of make-up. It is more cost efficient to place a bulk inventory purchase, and better for offering through her mobile business. She will also be purchasing a computer to run her business and take orders

loans.use: to place a bulk inventory purchase

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 42, is a mother of six children, and only one of them is in school. They are living in Battambang province. Selling fish and house building have been the sources of her family’s income for 20 years. Motor driver is her husband’s additional source of income for her family. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of four to apply for a loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to buy more kinds of fish to sell. She hopes to earn more money to improve her family’s standard of living through this loan.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is a 54-year-old, married man. He lives in Zugdidi district with his wife and two children. Ramin keeps busy running his agricultural business. He owns four beehives with bee colonies, two sheep and a hectare agricultural land, where he grows corn. Ramin is a very hardworking man and does his best to insure a good harvest. He wants to purchase a tractor for cultivating the land. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,500 GEL. As the tractor is purchased, he will cultivate his land. He will be also able to rent his tractor or serve his villagers and generate additional income. Ramin awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor for cultivating agricultural land, as well as renting it out for additional income.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 33 years old and married. He lives in a small village in the Gori district with his two infant children. His wife stays home and looks after the children. Giorgi grows apricot and walnut trees on family-owned land and sells the harvest. In addition, he works at a workshop where he repairs cars and gets 400 GEL monthly. He is very experienced and has many satisfied clients. 

George decided to open a workshop and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,500 GEL.
 
With the received credit, he will purchase equipment that is needed to repair cars and he will continue his job in his newly opened workshop. Giorgi will be able to generate more income and will provide better living conditions for his infant children.

loans.use: to open an auto car workshop

loans.name: Kimyorn's Group

texts.en:
Kimyorn has been a cassava farmer for more than five years, living in Battambang province. She is 25 years old and is a married mother of a child who is now in school. 

To earn the additional income to support her family, she also works for another farm for a fee as well. Through these businesses, she can earn about 72,000 KHR per day. 

Now she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, because of her lack of funds for farming. Kimyorn is the group leader, and she will use her loan portion to buy seeds and pay plowing fees. 

She hopes to earn more money and then be able to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Faamoa

texts.en: Faamoa is a 72-year-old, mother with eight children. She is a strong mother and still fit in operating her business of selling elei printing at the market, with the help of her children. Faamoa has requested for a loan to buy rolling material, paint color, a paintbrush, a container, and printing machine to assist her business and to gain more profits. Faamoa became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling material, paint color, a paintbrush, a container, and printing machine.

loans.name: Situpe

texts.en: Situpe is 44 years old with one child. She runs a business of providing transportation by taxi. She has had this experience for more than a year. Situpe has requested a loan to buy new wheels, seat covers, and new windows, to help her maintain the good services to people. She joined SPBD in 2015. Situpe will use her profits to buy another taxi in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, seat covers, and new windows.

loans.name: Sigalu

texts.en:
Sigalu is a 45-year-old mother with 6 children. She runs a small business selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Sigalu requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, mayonnaise to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Sigalu became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, mayonnaise.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a Samoan citizen, she is 43 years old with 4 children. She runs a business selling taro and bananas at the market to earn a living. She has this experience for more than a year. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2010. Susana requested a loan to buy a chainsaw, wheelbarrow, knife, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), safety boots, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw, wheelbarrow, knife, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), safety boots.

loans.name: Repeka

texts.en:
Repeka is a 52-year-old mother with 5 children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. 

Repeka  requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Repeka became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 36-year-old mother with 4 children who has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Asia  requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her to run the business. Asia hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Talaleu

texts.en:
A loan amount of 2,500 WST will help Talaleu to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, a knife, safety boots, to help her run the business. 

alaleu became a member of SPBD in 2012. She is a Samoan citizen, she will use her profit to expand her business in the near future and provide for family needs.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, a knife, safety boots.

loans.name: Nurana

texts.en:
Nurana is a 31-year-old married woman. She has a daughter and her husband is a labourer. They live in an old house and try to cover family needs. Nurana keeps four hens and a cock. She keeps them in an old poultry house, made of old desks and iron. Her monthly income is 150AZN and doesn't cover the needs of the family. 

People have asked for chicken and eggs. Nurana knows this and tries to satisfy the demand of her clients. It is not good to to keep birds in such places. She fattens them and sells their eggs.

She applied for 1500AZN loan in order to buy three additional hens and repair the old poultry house.

loans.use: to buy three additional hens and repair the old poultry house

loans.name: Tanzila

texts.en:
Tanzila is 47 years old. She is married to a farmer and they are both farmers. Their daughter is married and lives in a neigbouring house.

Tanzila has land and raises seasonal vegetables there. She keeps them in a handmade greenhouse. She has been working in this area for 20 years and she is well experienced. Her husband helps in her small business. Together they sell the harvest at a local bazaar. Their monthly income is 160AZN and it doesn't cover the family needs. 

Tanzila wants to expand her small business. She applied for 1000AZN loan in order to buy new seeds and raise them too. She also wants to supply good fertilizers for the greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy good seeds and fertilizers for her greenhouse

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 48 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Milagros has been farming rice  for six years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María de 68 años de edad, no tiene ningún nivel de estudio, se crió con sus padres y con 10 hermanos trabajando en la agricultura como lo es siembra de maíz y de frijol, luego se casó y tuvo tres hijos y ahora tiene a cargo a dos nietos quienes viven con ella.

María trabaja en la agricultura como lo es la siembra de maíz y de frijol, trabaja también con ganado desde que se casó, pues su esposo ha trabajado en la misma actividad y ella siguió también con el negocio pues necesitan los ingresos económicos suficientes para sobrevivir. Además por un buen tiempo trabajó con una pequeña tienda en la comunidad que luego dejó debido a que se enfermó y paso un tiempo bastante mal pero tiene la experiencia en dicho trabajo.

Ella está solicitando un crédito a CREDICAMPO para comprar una vaca y productos de la canasta básica para abrir otra vez la tienda.

María sueña con apoyar a sus nietos para que terminen sus estudios y puedan superarse en la vida, además desea irse superando poco a poco en el negocio de la ganadería para poder vivir de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
María is 68 years old, has no education and grew up with her parents and 10 siblings. They farmed, raising corn and beans. Then she married and had three children and now has two grandchildren who live with her and who are her responsibility.

María farms, raising corn and beans and has also worked with livestock since she married, as her husband has worked in the same activity and she also continued with her  business as they need sufficient income to survive.

In addition, for some time she had a small store in the community. She later closed it due to the fact she got sick and was ill for some time, but she has experience in this type of work. 

She is requesting a loan from Credicampo in order to buy a cow and basic household products needed to reopen her store. Maria dreams of helping her grandchildren to finish their education so that they can succeed in life. In addition she wishes to succeed little by little in her livestock-raising business so that she can live better.

loans.use: To buy a cow and basic household products for reopening her store

loans.name: Asiga

texts.en:
Asiga is a 42-year-old mother with 7 children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year to earn a living. 

Asiga requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en: A loan amount of 1,000 WST will help Melania to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and a backpack sprayer to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015 to seek finances for her business. Melania will use her profits to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, chainsaw, backpack sprayer,

loans.name: Leauta

texts.en:
Leauta is a Samoan citizen and she is a 49-year-old mother with 8 children. She operates a business of selling taro and banana at the market to earn a living.

Leauta hopes to gain more profit from the business, but in order to do this, Leauta requested for a loan to buy a chainsaw, wheelbarrow, backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro roots(seedling), banana roots(seedling), to help her run the business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy chainsaw, wheelbarrow, backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro roots(seedling), banana roots(seedling),

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a Samoan citizen, she is 22 years old with one child, and runs a business selling taro and banana at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Sandra requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, a knife, to help her run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, a knife.

loans.name: Puafiti

texts.en:
Puafiti is a 32-year-old mother with three children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Puafiti requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and gloves to help her run the business. 

Puafiti hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and gloves

loans.name: Aflore

texts.en: Aflore is a social enterprise in Colombia, founded by Ana (pictured) that provides underbanked people with access to credit and financial skills (Check out their video here ). Aflore’s model builds on informal savings clubs that thrive in many Latin American countries, where money is borrowed and lent between family and friends. With Aflore’s model, the financially savvy members of the community become Aflore’s financial advisors. Afloreg empowers them with the training, tools and resources they need to help others around them. The result is positive change not only for the borrowers, but also for the financial advisors who act as leaders and role models within their own communities. This loan will be used to support Aflore’s informal financial advisors by providing access to credit to their close networks. One such advisor is Yaneth. She’s seen as a financial role model by her peers because she’s done well personally despite coming from a place without much opportunity. Members of the community frequently go to her for advice on personal finances. As a member of Aflore’s team of informal advisors, she is able to help the people in her social network understand their financial situation and, where possible, support their loan application and refer them to Aflore for a credit assessment. If Aflore approves the loan, Yaneth earns commissions as her referrals make repayments. She also participates in Aflore’s growth program, where she receives financial and personal development training. After one year with Aflore, Yaneth has helped 14 people to access loans. Her first referral was Shirley, one of her closest friends, who had never been able to get a loan through a bank since she only earns the minimum wage. Through Aflore, Yaneth provided her with a small loan to visit her sick mother and buy medicine. Once she repaid the loan, Shirley has continued building her credit history: she got a loan for making a home improvement and when she finished paying it, she decided to get an additional loan, together with her husband, and invest the money in growing his bike repair business. Because of the positive experience Yaneth had with Shirley’s loans, she continued to introduce other people in her trust network to Aflore. She has given loans to her brother and his partner to repair their taxi, to her friend Flor Maria to repay a loan shark, her neighbour Ricardo to stock his mini-market, to her mom who made home improvements, and to her daughter America who was able to pay her university tuition, amongst others. Yaneth’s story has the potential to be replicated in the network of over 250 Informal Advisors currently working with Aflore who have already provided around 350 loans. 65% of Latin America’s 430 million adults live without a bank account. Even when they have access to a bank, many people simply do not trust the system. In Colombia, people flock to withdraw their earnings on payday, before the bank “loses” their money. Traditional banks have earned a bad reputation, so people choose not to engage with them, despite the consequences of not establishing a credit history. For this reason, only 2 out of 10 people in Colombia have the ability to respond to a medical emergency or other unexpected expenses. Because of its work in this context, with just over a year in the market, Aflore has been widely recognised as a major innovation in financial inclusion by key leaders in the sector, including SOCAP (2014 guest entrepreneur) iNNpulsa (Colombia´s 50 most innovative startups), and BID Network (2014 Women in Business Finalist). Your contribution will help Aflore scale its impact in Colombia.

loans.use: to provide financing for home improvements, education, debt rehabilitation and small businesses working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana roots (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 24 years old with 2 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. 

Jennifer requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine, to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

She will use her profit to expand her business in the near future and provide for family needs.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine.

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Kamran is a farmer. He is 50 years old and he is married. He has a son, who helps Kamran in farming. He keeps a small cow. He raises them, fattens them and then sells the milk.  Kamran loves his job very much. 

Kamran takes care of his cow properly. He wants to build a stall for his cow and keep it there properly. He applied for a 1200AZN loan in order to repair the old cow stall and install a new water pipe. He wants to earn money for his family and provide for them, to keep them well and happy

loans.use: to repair an old cow stall and install a new water pipe

loans.name: Uaeua

texts.en:
Uaeua is a 38-year-old divorced woman with three children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Uaeua needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, butter, and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses. Uaeua has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, butter, and a large stove

loans.name: Aulafo

texts.en:
Aulafo is a 34-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Aulafo needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions, and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Aulafo has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions, and paper plates

loans.name: Lalotea

texts.en:
Lalotea is a 62-year-old mother with six children, she owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Lalotea   requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan

loans.name: Ropeta

texts.en:
For more than a year Ropeta, a 35-year-old mother of three, has had a small business sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living. A member of SPBD since 2012, she has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and measuring tape to help her in her enterprise. 

Ropeta will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and measuring tape

loans.name: Faga

texts.en: A loan amount of 2,500 WST will help Faga to buy a freezer, sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, phone credit, a box of chicken, and tinned fish. She has been doing this for more than a year. She is a Samoan citizen and became a member of SPBD in 2012. Faga is 32 years old with four children. She will use her profits to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, phone credit, a box of chicken, and tinned fish.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is a 50-year-old mother with nine children, and she has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumbers) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this over two years. Ruta has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her running the business. 

Ruta hopes to expand her business by using her profits in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
Firuz is 45 years old. He is married and has two daughters. He loves his family very much and does his best for his family. He is a small farmer and keeps a garden. He rises there seasonal vegetables and tries to sell them to local markets or at local bazaar. 

Firuz has worked in this area for 15 years and has good experience. He lives in an old house and he used to draw water from his neighbour. He applied for a 500AZN loan in order to buy pumps and install water pipes in their yard and house.

loans.use: to buy pumps and install water pipes in their yard and house

loans.name: Filoi

texts.en:
Filoi is 45 years old and divorced with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Filoi needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a spade, a crowbar, a machete, chemicals, a wheelbarrow and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Filoi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a spade, a crowbar, a machete, chemicals, a wheelbarrow and crops.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is 38 years old. He is married and his wife is a housekeeper. They have two beautiful daughters. Kamil is a farmer. He has land and raises crops in order to sell the harvest. 

Kamil has been working in this business for 18 years and earns 170AZN monthly. He knows that local restaurants and bakeries have high demand for good crops. He has good clients who buy produce from him every month. 

Now Kamil needs to repair the irrigation system on his land. He applied for 1100AZN loan in order to install a master point and renew the  system.

loans.use: to install a master point and renew the farm  water system

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is a 24-year-old unmarried woman with two children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Queen needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Queen has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, and soft drinks

loans.name: Rabietou

texts.fr: Rabietou vit à Nyékonakpoè et est âgée de 46 ans. Mariée, Rabietou est mère de trois enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Rabietou vend des pagnes en basins en se promenant dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Rabietou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des pièces de pagnes, Rabietou demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en: Rabietou lives in Nyékonakpoè and is 46 years old. Married, Rabietou is a mother of three and works energetically in order to send her children to school. Rabietou sells pagnes (traditional wrap-arounds) in damask while traveling through her neighborhood and its surroundings to earn money to live. Rabietou stocks up twice a month at the market. To order pieces of pagnes, Rabietou is seeking this loan to be able to make the purchase and earn the necessary profits.

loans.use: to buy 8 pieces of pagnes

loans.name: Akpédjé

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans, Akpédjé est une femme mariée. Akpédjé est mère de quatre enfants et habite dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Akpédjé vend des friperies dans son quartier. Akpédjé réalise un revenu grâce à son activité pour aider ses enfants. Akpédjé s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander un bal de friperie, Akpédjé demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire
texts.en: At age 45, Akpédjé is a married woman. Akpédjé is a mother of four and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood. Akpédjé sells secondhand clothing in her neighborhood. Akpédjé earns money from her business to help her children. Akpédjé stocks up three times a month at the market. To order a package of secondhand clothing, Akpédjé is seeking this loan in order to reach her objectives and to earn a good profit.

loans.use: to buy a package of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fiber, straw, and wooden sticks

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, posee 5 años de experiencia en las labores agrícolas, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder empezar a preparar sus siembras y asi tener un mejor cultivo para una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: The youth with her faced blanked out is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She works growing corn and beans and has 5 years experience doing agricultural work. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. to improve the land shown in the photograph. She wants to prepare for seeding to get better crops for a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. to improve the land.

loans.name: Mausali

texts.en: Mausali is a Samoan citizen; she is 61 years old with 7 children. She operates a business of selling clothes at the market. Mausali joined SPBD in 2015 to seek finance for her business.She requested a loan to buy rolling material, tape measurement, and a sewing machine to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs.

loans.use: to buy rolling material, tape measurement, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Taumaoe

texts.en:
Taumaoe is 55 years old and unmarried with 3 children. 
She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Taumaoe needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and a spade. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Taumaoe will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and a spade.

loans.name: Losa

texts.en: Losa is a 39-year-old widow with seven children. She makes and sells elei printed materials to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. Losa has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, carved wooden designs, and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers,  carved wooden designs, and a new cutter

loans.name: Gauta

texts.en:
Gauta is 19 years old and single with no children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year.

Gauta needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Gauta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Fuamauga

texts.en:
Fuamauga is 37 years old and unmarried with three children. She makes and sells elei printed fabrics to earn a living and has been doing this for one year.

Fuamauga has requested a loan to buy rolls of material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, and a new cutter

loans.name: Manino

texts.en:
Manino is a 48-year-old single woman with two children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business.

 Manino needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer, and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Manino has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en: Fenumiai is a 31-year-old, single woman with one child. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Fenumiai needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Fenumiai has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups.

loans.name: Nianai

texts.en:
Nianai is 47 years old with seven children, and runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this more than two years. Nianai has requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, water tank and hand gloves to help her running the business. 

She hopes to expand her business in the near future using her profits. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, water tank and hand gloves.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia is a 51-year-old woman, who is married with eight children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Litia has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material.

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman is 47 years old and he is married. He has a daughter and she is going to be married. Mehman is a small farmer. He keeps livestock and raises  three cows. He uses their milk in order to make dairy products. He has worked in this area for 27 years and has a good experience. 

By tradition the house for the newly married must be bought by the family of the bride. 

Now Mehman applied for 1200AZN loan in order to instal a water system and water tank in the new house for his daughter. He wants his daughter to be happy.

loans.use: to instal a water system and tank in the house of his newly married daughter

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 27 years old and unmarried with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year.

 Mary needs a loan to buy a sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, and boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Mary will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, and boots

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Adjovi est une femme veuve qui vit à Lomé. Mère de trois enfants, Adjovi vend des friperies dans son quartier et réaliser un bon revenu grâce à son activité pour aider ses enfants. Adjovi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des soutiens gorges et des slips, Adjovi demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: At 44 years old, Adjovi is a widow who lives in Lomé. A mother of three, Adjovi sells secondhand clothes in her neighborhood and earns a good revenue thanks to her business to help her children. Adjovi stocks up once a month at the market. To order bras and panties, Adjovi is seeking this loan in order to reach her objectives and earn a good profit in order to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy 13 pairs of panties and 41 packages of bras

loans.name: Rinda's Group

texts.en:
Rinda, 22, is a married mother of a small child. She lives in Battambang province. She has been a cassava and rice farmer for a few years, and she also works for another farm to earn additional income to support her family. She can earn about 59,000 KHR per day.

Due to lack of funds to do the farming for this season, she decided to lead a group to apply for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will spend her loan portion to buy seeds and to pay a plowing fee for her farming. She hopes to gain more yields and to be able to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Tiana

texts.en:
Tiana is an 18-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells barbecue in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Tiana needs a loan to buy a new grill, soya sauce, tongs, basins, hand towels, and plastic spoons and forks. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Tiana has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a new grill, soya sauce, tongs, basins, hand towels,  and plastic spoons and forks

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is a 20-year-old single woman with one child. She makes and sells chicken with rice in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Olive needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken leg quarters, a new oven, a bag of flour, a bag of salt, and a barrel of cooking oil. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Olive has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken leg quarters, a new oven, a bag of flour, a bag of salt, and a barrel of cooking oil

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 52 years old and married with seven children. She makes and sells elei printed fabrics to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. 

Christina has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, and a cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, and a cutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy remote controls, chargers, lightbulbs, and other items for sale.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
A loan amount of 1,000 WST will help Matalena to buy a taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a chainsaw, wheelbarrow, and backpack sprayer. She joined SPBD in 2015. Matalena is 25 years old with one child. 

She has had this experience of selling taro and banana at the market to earn a living for more than a year. She will use her profits to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a chainsaw, wheelbarrow, and backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Adriana De La Paz

texts.es:
Adriana, de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, no pudo continuar estudiando debido a los escasos recursos económicos de sus padres, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene tres hijos, de los cuales tres están en la escuela y son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Adriana, se dedica al trabajo doméstico, pero también le ayuda en la agricultura a su pareja, esto lo hacen desde hace 12 años, sus cultivos están a 15 minutos desde su casa, su suegra también les ayuda y el horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 11:00 a.m. 

El préstamo lo necesita para alquilar el terreno donde cultivará, ya que ese terreno es muy bueno para sembrar.

Los sueña con seguir cultivando y ayudarle a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Adriana, 27 years of age, studied until 4th grade. She could not continue to study, because of the limited financial resources of her parents. She lives with her partner, who makes a living by farming. She has three children. All three children are in school, and are solely dependent on her.

Adriana works as a housewife, but she also helps with her partner's farming. She has done this for 12 years. Their crops are 15 minutes from home. Her mother-in-law also helps them. The work schedule is 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The loan is needed to rent the land where she will cultivate, since this area is very good for planting.

Her dreams are to continue to farm, and to help her children to study.

loans.use: to rent the land where she will cultivate, since this area is very good for planting.

loans.name: Sobar

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Sobar. Sobar lives in South Serang, a semi-urban area located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his only son. He owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks, mobile airtime credits and provides bill payments for his community. He knew of Ruma from one of Ruma’s sales executives that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma, because he wants to learn about how to expand his business in another sector, which is technology.  

As the business grows, Sobar needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Sobar’s goal toward Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community as Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Sobar is the one who is standing in front of his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Kafui est une femme mariée et âgée de 31 ans. Kafui habite dans le quartier de Lomé avec ses deux enfants. Très entreprenante et dynamique, Kafui vend des pagnes en se déplaçant aux besoins de ses clients afin de trouver son gain. Kafui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché pour avoir ses marchandises. Pour acheter des pièces pagnes, Kafui demande ce crédit pour réaliser sa commande et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire pour favoriser l’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en: Kafui is married and 31 years old. Kafui lives in the Lomé neighborhood with her two children. Very entrepreneurial and energetic, Kafui sells pagnes (traditional wrap-arounds) while traveling around to meet her clients’ needs in order to earn her profit. Kafui stocks up three times a month at the market to get her merchandise. To buy pieces of pagne, Kafui is seeking this loan to make her order and to increase her profit margin in order to support the thriving of her children.

loans.use: to buy 6 pieces of pagne

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Ablavi  est une femme mariée vivant dans la ville de lomé avec ses quatre enfants à sa charge. Ablavi est très dynamique et vend des fruits pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Son activité lui procure un bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Ablavi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Ablavi demande ce crédit pour commander quelques paniers de bananes et des oranges pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Aged 33, Ablavi  is a married woman living in the city of Lomé with her four children in her care. Lomé is very energetic and sells fruits to favorably satisfy her customers. Her business earns her the income necessary to help meet the needs of her family. Lomé stocks up three times a month at the market. Lomé is seeking this loan to order a few baskets of bananas and oranges to sell and earn more profits and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy 3 bunches of bananas and 25 dozen oranges

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Siti. Siti lives in South Serang, a semi urban area located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her only daughter. 

As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their children education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. Right now, Siti is becoming a mobile credits provider for her community.

As the business grows, Siti needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. 

Siti’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community with  a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Siti is the one who is holding Ruma's poster. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Agalelei

texts.en:
A loan in the amount of WST 1,000 will help Agalelei to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots to assist her in running the business. 

Agalelei has the experience of selling vegetables at the market for more than a year. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. 

She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots.

loans.name: Segundo Alberto

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre en casa propia en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural del distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 2 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento a su mototaxi ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, de esta manera el espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 22 years old, he is single and he lives with his mom in a home that they own in a small community in the rural zone of the Lagunas district.  It is a community that is dedicated to agriculture and livestock, located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

Segundo works providing transportation services on his motorcycle taxi, which he has been doing for over two years. He has a lot of experience in this business, and he has great personal and professional references in the region.

He is seeking a loan to make repairs and service his motorcycle taxi as it is currently in poor shape.  With this he hopes to expand his business, increase his income and be able to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: repair and service his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Fialupe

texts.en:
Fialupe is a 26-year-old married woman with four children. 

She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Fialupe needs a loan to buy a cooler, foam cups, cordials, Chinese candy, and gloves. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. 

Fialupe has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, foam cups, cordials, Chinese candy, and gloves

loans.name: Quen

texts.en:
Quen is 20 years old. She has a small business of sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living. 

Quen requested a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, and a tape measure to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine, and a tape measure

loans.name: Viona

texts.en:
Viona is 35 years old and married with no children. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Viona needs a loan to buy a tiller, chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, a tarpaulin, and seeds. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Viona will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a tiller, chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, a tarpaulin, and seeds

loans.name: Uputaua

texts.en:
Uputaua is a Samoan citizen who is 42 years old with one child. She runs a business of selling ice cake in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this in many years. 

Uputaua requested a loan to buy an ice bag, a container, plastic bags, and a Coolio (cooler), to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an ice bag, a container, plastic bags, and a Coolio (cooler).

loans.name: Warsini

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Warsini. Warsini lives in East Bandung, located in West Java, about three hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her three children (two daughters and one son). 

Warsini owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their child’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. 

As the business grows, Warsini needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. 

Warsini’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Warsini is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 58  años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad que se encuntra estudiando, Olga comenta que sola a sabido sacar adelante a su hijo. Olga ha crecido en el campo y  comenta que ahí se vive de la agricultura, ganaderia y la crianza de animales menores. Olga paga arriendo por la casa en la que vive. Olga se dedica a sembrar pequeñas huertas de productos que se dan en el lugar donde vive y tambien obtiene sus ingresos mediante la crianza de animales menores. Olga solicita el credito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos. La aspiracion de Olga es la de mejorar su negocio y que no le falte los recursos economicos para pagar los estudio de su hijo.
texts.en:
Olga is 58 years old. She is a single mother and has a 15 year old son that is in school. Olga says that she has been able to raise her son alone. She grew up in the country and says that here one lives on agriculture and livestock and she raised animals.

Olga pays rent for the house she lives in. She makes a living planting small plots of produce that are found in the place she lives and by raising animals.

She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of pigs. Olga's aspiration is to improve her business and that she does not lack the economic resources to pay for her son's schooling.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Cándida

texts.es:
Cándida de 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos ya todos mayores de edad.


Cándida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, además cuida a dos de sus nietos a quienes ella aprecia mucho, además Cándida siempre le ayuda a su esposo en los trabajos agrícolas que él realiza.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios para empedrar la calle de acceso a su vivienda pues le dará más seguridad para poder caminar en el lugar y evitarse tanto polvo.

Ella espera seguir trabajando con esta institución pues ha sido de mucho aporte en su vida para seguir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Cándida is 60 years old. She is married, and she has 3 children, all of whom are adults. Cándida performs household chores. She also takes care of two of her grandchildren, whom she loves very much. In addition, Cándida always helps her husband with the agricultural work that he performs.

She needs this loan to buy the necessary materials to pave the street that provides access to her home. This will provide greater security, allowing her to walk around and to avoid all of the dust. She hopes to continue working with this institution because it has been a great source of support in her life, urging her to move forward and to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials to pave the street that provides access to her home.

loans.name: Momoi

texts.en:
Momoi is a 19 year old woman with 1 child. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Momoi needs a loan to buy loaves of bread, a new urn, glasses, mugs, spoons and forks. She plans to use her profits to build her family's future.

Momoi has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread, a new urn, glasses, mugs, spoons and forks

loans.name: Crystal

texts.en:
Crystal is a woman of 20-years-old with 1 child. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage,cucumber, eggplant, in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Crystal requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals

loans.name: Anasetasia

texts.en:
Anasetasia is 53 years old and divorced, with 3 children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 1 year. Anasetasia needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, kava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan designed caps. 

She hopes to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan designed caps

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 19 year old mother with 1 child. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Mercy requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine, to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

She  hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine,

loans.name: Taase

texts.en:
Taase is  25 years old with four children and operates a small business of selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Taase requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a fry pan, and a wooden spoon to assist her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a fry pan, and a wooden spoon

loans.name: Moana

texts.en:
Moana is 42 years old and unmarried with four children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Moana needs a loan to buy a machete, crowbar, a tiller, seeds, a sprayer and chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Moana will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a machete, crowbar, a tiller, seeds, a sprayer and chemicals

loans.name: Ulima

texts.en:
Ulima is 33 years old and unmarried with 3 children. 
She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Ulima needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, new boots, gloves, a tiller, a crowbar and seeds.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Ulima will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, new boots, gloves, a tiller, a crowbar and seeds

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la producción de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), posee 13 años de dedicarse a ese rubro, vende sus productos en los alrededores de donde ella reside con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plagas, pesticidas, etc. por mayor y así poder continuar con sus cultivos para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Juana, 33 years of age, lives in her own house, with her husband, and her two children. 

She makes a living in the production of basic grains (corn and beans). She has made a living in this same line of work for 13 years. She sells her products around where she lives. With these sales, she has managed to cover some household expenses

She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, manure, herbicides, pest control, pesticides, etc. wholesale, and to continue with her crops, for a better quality of life, together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, herbicides, pest control, pesticides, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.en:
Sabas, 47, is a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. He has two kids, one is in high school and the other is still in elementary school. He works hard to meet their everyday needs and supports his children's schooling.

Sabas operates a tricycle. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Cavite, the tricycle is a common means of transportation. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. He earns a minimum of PH 700 a day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan which he will use for spare parts, gas and maintenance of his tricycle. He is positive that this will boost his income as tricycle transportation is really a need in his area.

Sabas hopes to buy more tricycle units to improve his income. He wants to send both of his children to college to allow them a better future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and were he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, fuel and maintenance of his tricycle for transport service.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is 43 years old, lives in Salt, and is the mother of six children. Heyam is a conservative woman and asked her son to take her place in the photo. 
Heyam had been facing difficulties in her life. She and her husband are working hard to ensure the best life for their children. They have a large family with huge needs but they confront their obstacles head-on.
Her son, who is 22 years old, is studying business administration at university and works while going to school to cover his daily expenses. She wants to see him graduate and find good work to ease their responsibilities and help with household expenses.
Heyam will never stop helping her son. Therefore she applied for a loan to pay his university fees because he was not able to cover them this semester.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Analosa

texts.en: Analosa is a 25-year-old mother with three children. She runs and operates a small business selling pancakes, buns, and pork cake in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Analosa requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, and vegetable oil to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Sadeli

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Sadeli. Sadeli lives in Indramayu, an area in West Java located about four hours’ drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone credits and provides mobile payment services for his community. Sadeli already joined Ruma for a year. He knew Ruma from the sales executive who is coming to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business, as well as to give more contribution to his community.

As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Sadeli improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Sadeli is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who is from Irbid, is 23 years old and single.
Mohammad is studying tourism management. He is working as a waiter while going to school to cover his daily expenses.
Lately, his family has faced financial problems that prevent Mohammad from paying his university fees. He decided to apply for an education loan to help him pay the university fees. He hopes this loan will enable him to find a good job with a high salary.

loans.use: To help him pay university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish his university studies and to help pay for graduate advanced studies.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma lives in Mafraq, and she is working hard to grow, study, and become a successful lady in the future. She has six siblings, who are studying in school.
 
Basma`s goal is to finish her bachelor’s  degree which is accounting and find a good job so she can help her family in household expenses and to help her siblings in their education. 

She is requesting this loan to pay for her educational expenses because her father faced financial problems which prevent him from helping her.

loans.use: To finish paying for her bachelor's degree in accounting and achieve her dreams

loans.name: Miralyn

texts.en:
Miralyn, 39, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Erwing, a supervisor, and they have three children of which two are in high school and one is not of school age yet. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school.

Miralyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1000 a day.

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as rice, can goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda and other grocery items. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Miralyn aims to maintain and grow her business so she they could have a better life and send all her children to college. She prays to be strong and victorious in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is from Salt. She is 32 years old and married with three children. Diana has a lot of dreams she wants to achieve, the important one is to complete her higher education.

She has a bachelor degree in business administration and now she wants to get a master degree in same field, but she could not cover her education fees. Therefore she decided to apply for an education loan to help her pay the university fees and achieve her goals. She hopes that will give her a chance to have better work with better salary to improve the standard of living for her family, and help her husband in the household expenses.

loans.use: To pay for her master`s degree and achieve her dreams

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en:
Yousra is 59 years old and lives in Aqaba,. She has a big family that consists of eight members, and three of them are university students. She has a dream to see her children be successful and special. Yousra is a conservative woman and asked her son, Bader, to take her place in the photo.
He is majoring in computer information systems and is working hard to complete his education to find a good job with a good salary. That would help his parents with the household expenses and help his siblings pursue their education. 
Lately, Yousra faced financial problems that prevents her from helping Bader pay for his university fees. Therefore, she applied for an education loan to help Bader pay his semester fees and complete his education.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees and complete his education.

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet Ruma agent Asep, who lives in West Bandung, a suburban area located about a three-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He sells mobile phone credits and provides mobile payment services for his community. Asep joined Ruma a year ago. He learned about Ruma from the sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business as well as contribute more to his community.
As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. The loan will be very useful in helping Asep improve his business and his community which needs access to such services. Asep is in the photo. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Faanee

texts.en: Faanee is a 34-year-old mother with six children and has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Faanee requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her to run the business. Faanee hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Om Hashem

texts.en:
Om Hashem is 38 years old from Baniswef. She is married with three children. 

Her husband works in poultry sales and he is a TADE's client, as he previously requested 2 loans and repaid them successfully on due dates. 

Om Hashem decided to help her husband with the family income by raising cattle in a place she prepared in her house. She chose this project since she has long experience in fattening cattle in her father's house and her husband will help her in this project. So, she requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is 30 years old from Baiswef. She is married and has two children. Her husband has a grocery store and he is a client in TADE and he requested a 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates. 

Nahed wants to help her husband with the family income by starting a small flafel restaurant. She prepared the restaurant but she can't afford to buy the equipment she needs to run the restaurant. So, she requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy equipment and tools such as pans, chairs, tables and cooking tools.

loans.use: To buy equipment and tools such as pans, chairs, tables and cooking tools for a new restaurant.

loans.name: Achmad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Achmad. 

Achmad lives in Semarang, capital of Central Java, 9 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Achmad is happily married. Together with his wife, they have two children. He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits  for his community. He already joined Ruma for a year. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he is interested in Ruma’s system; the sales executive will be coming to his stall to collect the money. Moreover, his community sees him as a friendly and trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Achmad is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his communities. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Achmad improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Achmad is the one who is standing. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is 38 years old from Baniswef. She is married and has 3 daughters. 

2 years ago, Safaa started a small clothing project in her house to help her husband with the family income. She wishes to expand her project to save money for her oldest daughter's marriage. So, she requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy more clothing for her project, to increase her sales and save money for her daughters.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her project to increase her sales and save money for her daughters.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is 29 years old from Baniswef. He is a graduate of the manufacturing high school and is married with a baby boy. 

The only source of income for the family is a small café project. 

Said wishes to attract more customers so, he requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy an LCD, a cable for sport channels and some new chairs and tables.

loans.use: to buy an LCD, a cable for sport channels and some new chairs and tables for his cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare a new learning center and buy furniture and stationary.

loans.name: Asri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Asri. 

Asri lives in Semarang, a capital city of Central Java, around two hours by plane from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his children (one daughter and one son). Asri works as a security officer in a private company. He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to become an entrepreneur. His community sees him as a hard worker and friendly person.

As the business grows, Asri needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Asri’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Asri is the one who is holding Mapan's banner. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Abdelalim

texts.en:
Abdelalim is 34 years old from Baniswef. He is happily married and has two children. 

He learned floor tiling from a very early age. This floor tiling creation project helped him to save for his marriage. 

Now, Abdelalim wishes to expand his project, so he requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy more modern types of raw materials and some tile forms.

loans.use: To buy more modern types of raw materials for tile making and some new tile forms.

loans.name: Umayma

texts.en:
Umayma is a 23-year-old single lady from Gaza city. She lives with her family in a small house. She finished her study in teaching special needs kids. Umayma is a very ambitious lady. She wants to open a big learning center for these kids in the future. She wants to start her dreams step by step so she opened a small center one year ago.

Umayma took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy new desks and teaching tools for her learning center. This will help her to improve her business and expand it in the future. Umayma appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy new desks and teaching tools  for her learning center.

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Nurhayati. 

Nurhayati lives in Semarang, a capital city located in Central Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband. Nurhayati owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as kind and trusted mobile provider.  

As the business grows, Nurhayati needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Nurhayati’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Nurhayati is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water system and for land reclamation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of hair dye, makeup, and other beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Jose Feliciano

texts.es: Jose es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol,  posee 20 años de experiencia en ese rubro, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa y ya tiene clientes establecidos, gracias a esas ventas que realiza es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizante y abono para aumentar el rendimiento del cultivo y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Jose is a very hardworking and responsible man. He lives in his own home with his wife and their three children. He works growing corn and beans. He has twenty years of farming experience. He sells his products at the different markets that are near his home and already has a well-established customer base. His sales are what allow him to cover some of his household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, so that he can increase his crops' performance and achieve better financial income and, ultimately, a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of accessories, makeup, and other beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seasonal fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 34-year-old married woman from Khan Younis city. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs. In the last violence on Gaza, their home was destroyed completely. They have no place to go so they are now living in a rental apartment.

Ola took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to rebuild part of the family house. This loan will help her to pay part of the urgent expenses she has. Ola appears in the photo next to her damaged house.

loans.use: to rebuild part of the family house.

loans.name: Nafez

texts.en:
Nafez is a 21-year-old single man from a village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small house. He works in a store selling grocery products and nuts. Nafez would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the necessities.

Nafez took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will help him to provide hot water for the family house without using electricity. Nafez appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es: Luis de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad almacena sus productos en los graneros que muestra la fotografía y luego los comercializa en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Luis está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así poder tener una buena cosecha para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
