Luis is thirty years old and lives in his own home with his son. He works growing corn and sorghum, and has been doing so for the past ten years. He stores his products in the containers that are shown in this picture. He later sells them at the different markets located near his home.

Luis is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, pest-control products, weed-killers, etc. His goal is to get a good harvest in order to make a better profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pest-control products, weed-killers, etc.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Faisal. 

Faisal lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 mi) south of the national capital, Jakarta. Faisal is a young guy who has big spirit to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall that sells daily consumer products, mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand his business using technology. 

As the business grows, Faisal needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Faisal’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Faisal is the one who is standing and holding Ruma’s banner. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad is 31 years old from Baniswef. He is married and has two children. He takes care of his aging and sick father. 

He has a small café project which he started by a 2000 EGP loan from TADE and successfully repaid on due dates.

He wants to renew his project so he requested another 1000 EDP loan from TADE to buy new equipment, chairs and tables for his café to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy new equipment, chairs and tables for his café.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 51 years old from Baniswef. He is married and has 4 sons. 

He has a feed sales project. Ali wishes to sell feed to other smaller feed shops in his village. 

So, he requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy more feed to increase his sales and his monthly income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more feed to increase his wholesale sales and his monthly income for his family.

loans.name: Om Hashem

texts.en:
Om Hashem is 45 years old from Baniswef. She is a widow and has 3 children. She is a real fighter for a single mom. She insisted on giving her children a  good education because she believes that education is the most precious thing she could give to her children. 

So, she started a clothing shop to increase her income for her family, because her husband's pension is very small. She wants to expand her shop to meet the increasing demands of her customers. So, she requested a5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy new clothing for her shop.

loans.use: To buy new clothing for her store to help provide income for the family.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 25 years old, and from Baniswef. He is single and a graduate of a commercial institute.

After being unable to find a job, Hassan decided to start his own project. He started a bakery project and bought the main equipment but during the work he noticed that he needed tables, another kneader machine and more flour. So he requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy what his bakery lacks to continue his sales and save for his marriage.

loans.use: to buy some wooden tables, a kneader machine and more flour to continue working in his bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her education.  She is studying for a degree in vital sciences.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya sells second-hand clothes at the market. Since the last loan, she has expanded her retail spot. Also, Nataliya was able to pay for her daughter's education in medical school. Nataliya is a very active and hard-working person. She wants to develop her business further, so that she can help her children. 

Nataliya is asking for a loan of UAH 10,000 to increase the assortment of second-hand clothes. The loan will help her to attract new customers.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa por mayor y menor desde hace 4 años, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, la joven vive en casa propia  con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor para continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi podrá tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
This borrower's face has been pixelated because she is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has been working selling wholesale and retail clothing for the past four years. Her business is located near her home in a very busy area. She lives in her own home with her boyfriend and their son.

She is requesting a loan to buy men's and women's wholesale clothing in order to keep up her sales. This will allow her to make a better profit from her business, which is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Her name is Eden, 41, and she is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Reynold, a government employee, they have five children of which two are in college, one is in high school, and two are in the elementary level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her children to school. 

Eden operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also retails mineral water as shown in her photo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items and gallons of mineral water to sell. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are her source to meet their daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Eden hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they could have a better life and send all her children to college. She prays to grow in her relationship with God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gallons of mineral water and some grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 8 años a trabajar como jardinero en diferentes casas y ahora hasta en ranchos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a su trabajo es como ha logrado salir adelante, Manuel está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas combustible, aceite, cuchillas entre otras cosas para continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. For the past eight years, he has been working as a gardener for different houses and now also for ranches that are near his home. His work is what has allowed him to get ahead. 

Manuel is requesting a new loan to buy more fuel, oil, blades, and other items to keep working so that he can have better financial income.

loans.use: to buy more fuel, oil, blades, and other items.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 26 years old and single.  He lives in the south of Jordan, and he is studying in university in his fifth year, majoring in mining engineering.

As a result of problems that were faced by Ibrahim`s father with his work, they faced financial problems that prevented Ibrahim from paying for his university fees.

Ibrahim tried his best to find work that will help him to cover his university fees, but he didn't find anything suitable to suit with his studies.  Therefore he has applied for an education loan to cover his university fees, to be able to complete his studies and achieve his dreams, one of which is to complete higher education.

loans.use: To cover his university fees to complete his studies in mining engineering in his 5th year.

loans.name: María Amelia

texts.es:
María de 62 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, actualmente está casada y su esposo ayuda mucho en el negocio de la herrería como su hijo mayor; junto a ella vive su esposo y una hija que se encuentra enferma.

María se dedica a la elaboración de herramientas para uso agrícola (machetes) desde hace muchos años, el cual aprendió de su esposo; ella se encarga de comprar los materiales como hierro, carbón, entre otros productos que se utilizan para dicha actividad.


El presente préstamo lo utilizará para comprar materia prima para el taller de herrería (hierro y carbón) ya que de esta manera podrá aumentar la venta de machetes y generar mayores ingresos.

María sueña con que su hija se recupere pues es muy triste para ella verla en mal estado, pero confía en Dios en que sus sueños serán posibles.
texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old.   She went to school up until the second grade. She is married and her husband helps her a lot with the blacksmithing business, as does her eldest son. She lives with her husband and a daughter who is ill. 

Maria has been working at the fabrication of agricultural tools (machetes) for many years.  She learned it from her husband.  She takes care of buying materials, such as iron and carbon, among other products that are used in this occupation.

The loan will be used to buy raw materials for the blacksmith shop (iron and carbon) since in this way she will be able to increase the sale of machetes and generate a better income.

Maria dreams about her daughter recuperating.  It is very sad for her to see her daughter in such a poor state, but she has confidence in God that her dreams will be possible.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the blacksmith workshop since in this way she will be able to increase the sale of machetes

loans.name: Henry Ariel

texts.es: Henry, tiene 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos, reside en el municipio de Puerto, Cortes. Anteriormente Henry solamente estudiaba y luego aprendió a cortar cabello. y  por necesidad de obtener ingresos para su familia decidió poner su propio negocio de una barbería y presta el servicio de corte de cabello en general. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para compra de equipo como maquinas(rasuradoras, cremas de afeitar, tijeras etc.) para corte de cabello y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  Su plan es crecer con el negocio para ayudar a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en: Henry is 21-years and lives with his wife, with whom he has two children.  He lives in Puerto, Cortes.  Henry previously only went to school and later learned to cut hair.  He decided to open his own barber shop out of a need to earn an income for his family.  He offers general hair cutting services.  Henry is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras ($475 USD) to purchase equipment for his busienss.  He will buy machines (electric shavers), shaving creams, scissors etc. so he can cut hair and offer a better service to his customers.  Henry's plan is to grow his business to help out his wife and children.

loans.use: to purchase electric shavers, shaving cream, scissors and other hair-cutting supplies.

loans.name: Lussalussu (2) Group

texts.en:
Three years ago, Yves started up his own electronics store business in Brazzaville, Republic of the Congo. He is requesting a loan of 450,000 XAF to accelerate his sales of CDs, DVDs and USB keys for his boutique. 

Yves is a member of the community bank Lussalussu (2) and leads eleven other members of his group. While his business sometimes struggles due to a lack of stable electricity, Yves ensures that he welcomes customers well and has a "mastery" of his CD inventory, including the classic oldies CDs that other boutiques may not carry in stock. 

With children ranging in age from just five months to 13, Yves dreams of one day building a house for his family and contributing to the education of his four children.

loans.use: to purchase CDs, DVDs and USB keys as inventory for his electronics boutique.

loans.name: Milad

texts.en:
Milad is 46 years old from Baniswef. He is married and has 3 children. 

He has a small grocery store and he is a former client of TADE, as he previously requested a 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates.

Milad wishes to expand his project, increase his sales, and meet the demands of his customers. So he requested another 10000 EGP loans to buy products such as oil, pasta, and rice for his store.

loans.use: To buy more products such as oil, pasta, and rice for his store.

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Dede. Dede lives in Cianjur, located about three hour’s drive from Jakarta. He lives there with his wife and son. He owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone credits to his community. Dede  joined Ruma a year ago. He found out about Ruma from a sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business, as well as contribute more to his community.

As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Dede improve his business and accordingly, his community who need access to such services. Dede is shown in the picture together with his wife and his son. They are very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Nea's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Nea is 28 years old and a mother of three dependent children. Two of her children are in school, and another one is too young to attend school. 

She grows cassava and rice as her main source of income. To supplement her income, she sometimes works on another farm for a fee. She has been involved in her job for 10 years, and she can earn about 32,800 KHR per day. 

For Nea, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers for her cassava. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Salam

texts.en: Salam is a 20 year old Lebanese single man. He has worked as a private teacher since 2013. He chooses this profession because he feels that he is helping students to get the necessary education. He has arranged a special room in his house where he receives his students and has equipped it with the required materials and supplies. Today, Salam is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new laptop which will help him in his work and improve his teaching skills. He is very optimistic about his future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop

loans.name: Gilber Esau

texts.es:
Gilber, es un joven muy trabajador y de firmes principios religiosos, está casado y tiene un niño, el cual es la razón por la que él y su esposa se esfuerzan día a día para darles las condiciones básicas de vida.- Gilber, esta construyendo una vivienda digna para ellos, solo le falta el techo de su humilde vivienda.

Gilber, trabaja en una cooperativa de ganaderos de la zona, él trabaja procesando la leche desde hace 8 años y aún continua trabajando en lo mismo porque tiene muchos conocimientos en esta área, sus jefes le tienen mucha confianza y es considerado uno de los mejores empleados de la cooperativa. 

Gilber, necesita el crédito para colocar el techo de su humilde vivienda, ya que el invierno se acerca y debe terminar la obra lo más pronto posible. 

Gilber, está muy contento con la forma de trabajar de la CREDICAMPO y por ello que desea seguir mejorando su vivienda, con la ayuda de ellos.
texts.en:
Gilber is a very hardworking young man who has strong religious beliefs. He is married and has a little boy. He and his wife strive every day to cover their son's basic needs. Gilber is building a humble but decent home for his family and the only thing missing now is the roof. 

Gilber works for a local cattle-ranchers' co-op. For the past eight years he has worked there processing milk. He still works there because he has a lot of knowledge about his job and his employers have a lot of faith in him and consider him one of the best employees that they have.

Gilber needs this loan in order to install a roof over his humble home. Winter is coming and he needs to finish the job as soon as possible. 

Gilber is very happy with the way CREDICAMPO operates. That is why he wants to continue improving his home with their help.

loans.use: to install a roof on his humble home.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Ahmad. Ahmad lives in Kudus, located east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, a 9-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He learned of Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he was interested in Ruma’s system; the sales executive will be coming to his stall to collect the money. Moreover, his community sees him as a trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Ahmad is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits to his communities. As seen in the photo, Ahmad is the one who is sitting in front of his stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Ainur

texts.en:
Ainur, a 21-year-old young man, lives in a village called  Karataklia. He has an unemployed wife and pensioner grandmother, who helps Ainur to earn a living.

Ainur has a small garden, where he cultivates vegetables and his grandmother sells the harvested products in the capital. This is the only source of income for the family, but it is really hardly enough to satisfy all the family needs. 

Ainur wants to make another source of income and start trading with sheep. He will purchase sheep at low prices, breed them and after fattening, will sell at good prices at the local market. 

He looked for credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The start up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 

His application was approved under the framework of this program to receive a loan of 3000 GEL for purchasing sheep.
 
Ainur and his family members will be very thankful for the financial support, as their living conditions will significantly increase thanks to Kiva lenders. Ainur needs your help.

loans.use: To start selling sheep to make income for his family and expand his trading business

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the new Ruma agents, Tabitha. Tabitha lives in Yogyakarta, a city located about 15 hour’s drive from Jakarta, or only 1 hour by airplane. She lives there with her husband and her three children (two daughters and one son). She owns a small stall where she sells consumer products daily and provides mobile payment services for her community. Tabitha is a cheerful and hardworking woman and her customers see her as a trusted mobile provider.

Tabitha knew Ruma from her friend who was already an agent. She decided to join Ruma because she wanted to learn how to expand her business. With support from Ruma’s staff, Dewi sees some improvement in her business. As the business grows, Dewi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends, so her community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart.

As seen in the photo, Tabitha is the one who is holding Ruma's banner in her stall. She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credits to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Gamal

texts.en:
Gamal is 53 years old from Baniswef. He is married and has 4 sons and a daughter. His wife helps him in his household cleaning and kitchen tools shop. This project is the only source of income for the family.

Gamal wants to develop his project, so he requested a 5,000 EGP from TADE to purchase more household and kitchen tools such as sweepers, dishes and plastic bowls to meet the demands of his customers and increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase more household and kitchen tools such as sweepers, dishes and plastic bowls.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: jorge de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijas, el se dedica la cultivo de yuca desde hace mas de 10 años el cual inicio con capital propio vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados con las ventas que realiza es como logra salir adelante con su familia, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, controles de plagas y pago de mano para dos personas que le ayudaran en la siembra y así poder tener mejores cosechas para una buena ganancias económica.
texts.en:
Jorge is 40 years old.  He lives in his own home with his wife and three daughters.  He has worked farming yucca for more than 10 years.  He started with his own capital selling his products in the different markets.  The sales that he makes is how he succeeds in moving forward with his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure, fertilizers, pest controls and to pay for the labour of two people who will help him at sowing time and thus be able to have better harvests for a good income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, pest controls and to pay for the labour of two people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, iron, and paid labor.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita took out an earlier loan of PHP 10,000. She was grateful indeed that you have helped her through the financial assistance that you lent. With her loan, she was able to purchase spare parts and other materials needed in her welding shop. It provided an opportunity for her to increase her salary and profits, which she used to sustain her family.  In addition, aside from the welding shop, she is also operating a sari-sari store (variety store). Her income from this field of business also helps cover their family necessities and supports their daily expenses. So, to further help her in continuing the operations of her store, she would like to apply  for a loan of PHP 12,000. She will use this to buy additional supplies of groceries and other merchandise to sell. She truly hopes that people like you will help her realize her goals.  Today, she is diligent and purpose-driven in her present inventories. Filled with optimism, she believes that in due time, she'll be able to expand her business and that she'll make her children finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of groceries and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Savun

texts.en: Savun, 35, lives in a small community in Tboung Khmum Province, Cambodia. She is the mother of one child, who is currently in school. She sells groceries. On average, she is able to earn $2 a day. She has been in this career for more than ten years. She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. She is borrowing from KIVA to be able to build the latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her family.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is very appreciative and grateful for her earlier loan of PHP 10,000, which she used to make a good profit out of her business. Having faithfully paid back her loan, she is asking for another PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy for additional supplies of products to be displayed in her store. Typically, customers get attracted to buy when they see a store with lot of supplies at low cost. Economically speaking, the cheaper the price, the higher the demand. But of course, more profit will come if there's high demand and large quantity of supply. To have a better life is her only dream. That is why she is really pursuing to expand her business and save enough for future investments if possible. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of products to be displayed in her store.

loans.name: Fahmeya

texts.en:
Fahmeya lives in one of the refugee camps. She is 40-years-old, married without children, and as she is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Fahmeya decided to open her business after the cost of living has increased, and her husband became unable to cover the household expenses. And  because she believes that the marriage is participation in all aspects, she started to sell blankets in her home to help her husband.

Fahmeya is running her project, and the problem that she is facing is low liquidity. Therefore she applied for a loan to buy more blankets and to start commerce in a new field, which is clothes. 

Fahmeya future plan is to expand the project to become a shop and improve her life

loans.use: To buy more blankets and clothes to sell to improve her family conditions.

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en: Phea is a 36-year-old mother of three children who are all in school and she lives in Kampong Cham province. Growing cassava and working for other farms for a fee have been the sources of her family’s income for more than ten years. These businesses could earn her about 75,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group to apply for a new loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seeds and pay a plowing fee. She hopes to gain more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay a plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Nicky

texts.en: Nicky is 19 years old and single with no child. He runs a small business selling cakes, sandwiches, pork buns  etc in his community and has been doing this for 3 years. Nicky has requested a loan to buy an oven, a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, and pans for the bakery. He joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With his earnings, Nicky hopes to build a small house for his business.

loans.use: to buy an oven, a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, and pans for the bakery.

loans.name: Qarib

texts.en:
Qarib is 24 years old. He is a farmer and lives with parents. He keeps land and grows seasonal fruits there. He uses a handmade greenhouse in order to keep the harvest safe. 

People have a high demand for fresh fruits and vegetables. They know that Qarib sells tasty and fresh harvest. He learned about agriculture by helping his father and now sells his harvest at a local bazaar and earns 190AZN monthly. He applied for a 600 AZN loan in order to repair a broken water pump.

loans.use: to repair a water pump

loans.name: Husrav

texts.en:
Khusrav is a clever boy. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1994. He is living in small town where people strive to be more educated and intelligent.

Khusrav is a student. He studies at university and is well known among friends and students. He is single and lives with his parents. His family did not have money for the education of their son, but they wanted to educate him. Khusrav asked for advice from IMON, and they offered him some suggestions. He decided to use the service of IMON; it is almost the third year he is supported by IMON.

Now he is asking for a loan to pay his tuition fee for university. He awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness. Khusrav is going to finish his education and find a good job to help his family live better.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee for university.

loans.name: Roberto Isrrael

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 64 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto el espera brindar mejores servicios y asi poder incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto a 64 years old man in a common law marriage who lives in his own home in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, a farming and animal husbandry community in the province on Chiclayo, of the Lambayeque region in the north coast of Perú.

He works providing urban transport services, which he’s been doing for 10 years and therefore has experience in this business, as well as good personal and work references in the area.

He is requesting this loan to repair and maintain his vehicle, which is presently in poor shape. With these repairs, he hopes to provide better service which will increase his income and thus improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: repair and maintain his vehicle, which is presently in poor shape

loans.name: Heri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet Heri, who lives in Cianjur, located about three hour’s drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone credits and mobile phone accessories for his community. Heri joined Ruma a year ago. He found out about Ruma from a sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business, as well as contribute more to his community. Heri is a young guy who is a hardworker. His community sees him as a trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Heri improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Heri is shown in the photo, standing in his own stall. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married. He has his own business.

He has been selling electrical goods in the villages for 11 years. He also installs air conditioners. Alexander is a responsible and active person. He is a patriot of Ukraine. Alexander donates money to the Ukrainian military.

Alexander is asking for a loan of 10 000 UAH to buy spare parts to install air conditioners.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to install air conditioners

loans.name: Favian

texts.es:
Favian tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de arroz, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de arroz, con esto el espera brindar un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Favian is 48 years old, lives with his spouse in the Colasay district, a farming and animal husbandry community in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region in the north Perú range.

He cultivates rice, has 10 years of experience in the business and good personal and work references from the people of his district.

He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and fertilizing products to provide maintenance to his rice crop. In this way, he hopes to provide better product quality to his clients, which will generate more income and allow him to enhance his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and fertilizing products to provide maintenance to his rice crop

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Sari-sari stores are seen everywhere in the Philippines. Sari-sari means "variety". They provide people with products mostly needed for everyday survival -- from products for personal hygiene such as shampoo, toothpaste, and powder, to condiments, food, canned goods, and other stuff at low prices. This is why many of those who want to go into business often start with being Sari-sari vendors because with just a bit of capital, one can automatically operate a store and earn income. 

It's just like Lorna, 41 years old from Caloocan City, Metro Manila. She began getting involved with this kind of business years ago. What she does is basically buy stuff in a large quantity, display them at her store, and sell them in retail, often at prices that are very affordable for people but higher than the original cost so that she can take a profit. 

However, you cannot expect a regular and stable income from this since sales vary from time to time. For this reason, Lorna wants to ask you for a PHP 10,000 loan that she can buy more supplies of products to display in her store. Certainly, this will really help her improve her business and attract more customers. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories from her life and business every week -- this is also where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of products to display in her store.

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Asep lives in Cianjur, located about three hour’s drive from Jakarta. He lives there with his wife and his two daughters. He owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone credits and provides mobile payment services to his community. Asep learned about Ruma from the sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business, as well as contribute more to his community. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Asep improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 
Asep is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc.) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Las Rosas 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is the coordinator of the Las Rosas (Flowers) 1, 2, 3 Group. This group has 15 female members, who sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other products. Some make their sales as street vendors and others have their businesses in their homes. This group is located in a poor community in the north of Santo Domingo, the capital city of the Dominican Republic. 

Lourdes's family consists of her four children and her partner. She lives with her children and her long-term partner. She tells us that she likes to attend church and her most difficult challenge is to have a successful store. She is very excited to be receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional. She will invest the money in her secondhand clothing store, which she started with a friend many years ago.

Lourdes's profits will be reinvested in her businesses, and she will also use some to cover household needs. One of her dreams is to see her children become professionals with stable lives and safe homes. She also dreams of having a general store. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the hundredweight and lime.

loans.name: Anite

texts.fr: Dans sa petite boutique, Anite vend des boissons gazeuses depuis dix ans. Elle a 43 ans, divorcée et mère de 3 enfants qui sont régulièrement scolarisés. Elle a besoin d'un microcrédit pour ajouter des boissons gazeuses dans son épicerie. Elle achètera des caisses de cola.
texts.en:
In this small shop, Anite has been selling soft drinks for 10 years. 

She is 43 years old, divorced, and a mother of three children, who regularly go to school.

She needs a micro-loan in order to increase the number of sodas in her store. She will buy cola cases.

loans.use: to buy cases of cola

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena, 41 years old, lives in the small village of Chuneshi where she works hard to support her beloved husband in making their precious family's living. Shorena realizes the family's main income from selling nuts cultivated on their land and breeding pigs and sheep. 

The couple finds it hard to achieve financial stability, so Shorena wants to expand her agribusiness. A loan of 4000 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase three milking cows in order to start dairy farming. Shorena will sell the milk products at the local market and also use them to help nourish the family. 

Shorena and her husband rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To expand her agribusiness and start dairy farming

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Dede lives in Cianjur, located about three hour’s drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone credits to his community. Dede is a young guy with a big spirit, hoping to become an entrepreneur. He learned about Ruma from the sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business, as well as contribute more to his community. His community sees him as a friendly and informative mobile provider

As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Dede improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Dede is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Sumedi

texts.en:
Sumedi lives in Cianjur, located about three hour’s drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells daily consumer products and mobile phone credits for his community. Sumedi lives in Cianjur with his wife and his only daughter. He found out about Ruma from the sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business, as well contribute more to his community. His community sees him as a friendly and informative mobile provider

As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Sumedi improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Sumedi is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Judith Esmeralda

texts.es:
Judith, de 27 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en una gasolinera, no tiene hijos pero es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora.

Judith, trabaja en una agencia telefónica desde hace varios años, el ambiente laboral es muy agradable y le gusta mucho su trabajo.

Judith, necesita el crédito para poder terminar construir su casa, porque actualmente viven alquilando y los gastos de alquiler son altos, es por eso que desean vivir en su casa propia.

Judith, sueña con tener un hijo, pero que crezca en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Judith, aged 27, is in a relationship but doesn't have children. She is a hard-working and tenacious woman. Her partner works at a gas station.

Judith has been working for a telephone company for a number of years now. The work environment is very pleasant, and she loves her job very much.  

Judith needs a loan to be able to finish building their house. Currently, they live in a rented place, and the rent is high. This is why they want to live in their own home.

Judith dreams of having a child, but she wants him to grow up in his own home.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer se formó en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, con amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, todas son muy sacrificadas y ponen todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante. Están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder seguir con sus emprendimientos.
La Sra. Nieves solicita de este préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta de comestibles y en la compra de los productos varios que utiliza para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser tomates, locotes, carne, cebolla, pollos y otros insumos. La señora se destaca por ser una persona muy trabajadora que siempre es activa dentro del grupo y pone todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que tiene de poder mejorar cada día sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
The Renacer Group [Rebirth Group] was formed by women friends and neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  They are all very self-sacrificing, and they put forth all of their efforts in order to be able to grow and get ahead.  In addition, they are in the Elimination of Poverty Program, which enables each one to understand her living conditions, and continue with her business ventures accordingly.

Señora Nieves is requesting this loan in order to invest in her business, and in the purchase of the various products that she uses there to make meals like tomatoes, peppers, meat, onion, chicken, and other supplies.  She is well known for being a very hard working person, who is always active in the group, and who puts all her efforts into growing and improving every day. 

She is thankful to have this opportunity to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family every day.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, meat, onion, chicken and other supplies to make meals

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganando bovino y a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 15 años el cual inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado para continuar con la crianza y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Digna is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She has made a living breeding cattle and pigs for the past 15 years, which she started with her own funds. She markets her products in neighboring communities and with her earnings is able to cover some of the household expenses. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase livestock to continue breeding so that she is able to increase her income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Claire Antonette

texts.en:
Claire Antonette is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Claire Antonette is 25 years old now.

Claire Antonette has a buy and sell of frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy frozen foods to sell in her business.

Claire Antonette has been in this business for two years. In the future, Claire Antonette would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods to sell in her business

loans.name: La Cosecha Del Señor Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal la cosecha del señor está conformada por nueve integrante ocho mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres de familia, responsables de veinte hijos, todos menores de edad, los cuales están estudiando. Están personas de conocen entre si pertenecen a la misma comunidad todos tiene diferentes actividades económicas, son originarios de Malpaisillo,  en  la actualidad lucha día a día para sacar adelante a sus hijos y hacer crecer sus negocios y de dicha forma tener mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.
Gracias a sus ganas de Salir adelante la coordinadora es Concepción y tiene por actividad económica la venta marisco  negocio que lo desempeña de forma ambulante, en su comunidad y fuera de la comunidad, la rutina de trabajo de esta mujer es de una ocho horas diarias, ofreciendo sus productos, de a clientes fijos y eventuales, ella todos los día acarrea un carretón con hielos para mantener el productos por un tiempo ya que es un productos perecedero. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que el sostén de su familia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en el negocio en la compra de camarón de calidad y ofrecerles a sus clientes fijos, y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Concepción agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal association "La Cosecha del Señor" is formed by 9 members, 8 women and 1 man, mothers and father of families, responsible for 20 children, all of whom are minors and in school. They are people who are known to each other. They belong to the same community. All have different economic activities. They are natives of Malpaisillo. They now strive day after day to raise their children and grow their businesses and in this way have better living conditions for their families.

Thanks to her will to get ahead, Concepción is the coordinator. Her economic activity is selling shellfish, a business that she carries out as a street vendor within and outside of her community. This woman's work routine is some eight hours a day, offering her products to regular and occasional customers. Every day she hauls a cart with ice to preserve the products for a while, since they are perishable products. It is an activity that she performs with great pleasure, since it is the sustenance of her family.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in the business by buying quality shrimp and offering them to her regular customers, and in the not-too-distant future she can obtain better income. Concepción is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp of high quality and sell them to regular and occasional customers.

loans.name: Faalilo

texts.en: Faalilo is a 46-year-old mother with four children. She has been running a small business selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Faalilo requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, and butter to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Faalilo became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, and butter

loans.name: Mrs. Vin’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Vin was selected to be group leader for a loan that has been requested from Maxima. There are two members in the group and they are in a village in Meanchey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Vin (pictured in the middle) is 47 years old. She had been married since 1989, has two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and the last one is a student at university. Vin is a farmer who plants vegetables. She has 24 years of experience. She is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizer for her farming.

The other group member is Chenda, a tailor .

Note: The man and child are vin's family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farming.

loans.name: Richard Denis

texts.es:
Richard tiene 24 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se ubica en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café de variedad catimore, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de su cultivo de café, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Richard is 24 years old.  He lives in his own house made of rustic material with his wife and his child in the district of Callayuc, in a community dedicated to agriculture and ranching, that is located in the region of Cajamarca in the northern sierras of Peru. 

He works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of the “catimore” variety of coffee.  He has 10 years experience in this line of work.  He has good personal and work references in his district.

He will use the loan provided him on farm tasks, applying and implementing phytosanitary products, fertilizers and to pay for labour to weed the coffee.  This will help him so much to improve the physiology, morphology and productivity of his crop, as well as to have a timely harvest.  Consequently, he will have increased production, a better quality product and therefore he will not have any problems selling his product.  This will generate greater income and will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to do farm work, apply and implement phytosanitary products, fertilizer and pay for labour for his cultivation of coffee

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn earns a living by operating a tricycle transportation service. Aside from that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities such as eggs, cooking oil, sugar, soap, canned goods, and condiments. She is a 38-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 17, and the youngest is 5.  

She has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy tires and fuel, and stock for the store such as soft drinks, canned goods, and noodles. These will help Ailyn continue to operate her transportation service. It will also improve the stock of her store. Thus, these will attract more consumers to make purchases.

With these, she would now be able to provide her children with nutritious diets and better living conditions. She hopes that she can continue to send all her children to school for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy tires and fuel, and stock for the store such as soft drinks, canned goods, and noodles.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
In the Philippines, sari-sari stores are everywhere. Sari-sari (a term used for variety) store sells different kinds of products from biscuits, candies, can goods, noodles, products used for personal hygiene and the like which are involved in every individual’s daily living. This is considered as one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people since it provides commodity for people. 

With this fact, Joanna was enticed to get in touch with this kind of business for eight years now. She is working with determination to pursue the needs of their family. The income she get from the store helps them with their daily expenditures. 

However, what profits she get from the business is sometimes insufficient. It is because at times, she finds it hard to maintain supplies of various products due to financial incapability. This is why she is requesting PHP 21,000 loan that she will utilize to buy additional products for her inventory. With more products displayed in her store, she can ably have a greater increase in her income. 

In due time, she hopes that she grow in progress and that her business will boost in sales. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en: Saren is 27 years old, a married mother of three dependent children, and one of them is in school while the others are too young to go to school. Growing cassava and rice farming have been the sources of her family’s income for three years and they earn her about 76,000 KHR per day. Due to the cassava not growing well, her income has decreased. This case caused her to not have enough funds to do farming for this season. Now she is leading a group of three members to take this loan with her portion used to pay a plowing fee to do farming. She hopes her crops will grow well and she can gain more yields than last year.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home system, so that his children may play in safety

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
Sokchea is 24 years old and a single interpreter. He resides in Phom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. He has been working as an interpreter since 2013, earning around $7 per day. 

He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in literature, at the university in the city. Due to the fact that he is short of finances to pay his tuition fees for the fourth year, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree. 

After graduation, he dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary, therefore he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for the fourth year, majoring in literature.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline has enthusiasm for managing her farming activities in Oroquieta City in the Philippines. Aside from her hobby, she earns an income as well. 

Evangeline hopes to provide her family with safe and comfortable living quarters, so she has requested a loan to purchase marine plywood, nails and plain sheeting for house roofing. 

Evangeline wishes to earn more from her business to continuously benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood, nails and plain sheeting for house roofing

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Thanks to your kindness and the generosity of lenders, Amelita has previously been able to put a larger quantity of grocery items in her store through the PHP 25,000 loan that you let her borrow. The loan has really helped her gain a bigger profit that she used for her family's daily necessities. 

This time, she would like to have another PHP 50,000 loan. If you would allow, she will spend the said amount for purchasing more supplies of a variety of products for her business. She is confident that this amount is enough for improving her sales, which is a big help for her family and a good head start for her business expansion. 

Anyhow, Amelita just simply hopes for the good of her family and of her grandchildren. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of a variety of products for her business.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use as her part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Jennelyn dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children the best education possible to allow them a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

loans.use: To pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Every entrepreneur wants to broaden their business and be successful just like Florinda. But of course, before reaching the top, you still need to go under. 

Florinda is in a direct selling business now. She sells diverse products from popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk and others. In addition, she also sells snacks and food for another source of income. She gets enough profit from these, and the income from both trades is what she uses in sustaining her family's costs of living, with the support of her husband, Jerry. 

To further improve sales, she would like to have a loan of PHP 11,000. If she will have enough funds to acquire more supplies of personal product sales, it would be better for higher income at hand. She hopes that your kind hearts will lend her this loan assistance. Thank you beforehand for your generosity and goodness.

Florinda meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to acquire more supplies of personal product sales for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina is 38 years old and single.

Cerelina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Cerelina has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cerelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mango 3 Group

texts.en:
Rosa began working with her father at the age of 6 years, she worked in the fields using machete. Rosa worked harvesting cardamom and coffee, the work was too hard. She was one of 11 siblings, 6 boys and 5 girls, she said she does not remember her father.
Rosa has been using the credit from Kiva Partner Asociación Chajulense de Mujeres - Unidas por la Vida for two years, and is getting now her third credit. She used her first credit to initiate a store for selling vegetables, she invested also in pigs and fatten them.
With her second credit she began selling other products in her store and continued buying and fattening pigs. Now, with her third one, she will use her credit to expand her store, and part of the credit will be used to continue fattening and selling pigs.
Rosa considers that the financial help that she obtains from Kiva and the Association of Women United for Life is given her the opportunity to contribute with her husband to achieve better health, feeding and education for their children
Rosa is the leader of Mango Group 3 (Mango Fruit), the group is formed by 9 women, average age is 38 years, in average they have 4 children, and the average amount of the group loan is Q 3,289. The group will invest their credit in expand their stores that sells vegetables, staple goods, or chicken meat.

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Mango 2 Group

texts.en:
Magdalena, is the leader of Mango Group 3 (Mango Fruit), the group is integrated by 8 women, their average age is 37 years, the average number of children they have is 5, and the group will invest their credits mainly in expanding their stores that sell staples.
Magdalena is twin sister of her only brother, she worked for ten years in different farms. When they were twelve years old her parents got sick and died, at the age of 17 she got married. She has 3 children, 2 boys and 3 girls.
This year she is receiving her third credit from Kiva Partner Asociación Chajulense de Mujeres - Unidas por la Vida, since the first one she feels that contributes in a better way to support her family. She has a shoe store that has been growing with the financial assistance and the effort she is making. She will use her credit in expanding her shoe store.

loans.use: To expand her shoe store

loans.name: Mango 1 Group

texts.en:
Ana, is the youngest of six sisters, when she was a child she worked in a farm harvesting coffee, she did not liked the work because it was too hard. She married at the age of 16 and now is mother of 6 children, 3 boys and 3 girls. Two of her boys are studying secondary education, one is in eighth grade and the other in seventh grade, and the youngest child has 5 years and has not begun his studies. Her three daughters did not studied. 

Because of the family needs she began selling corn, sodas, and other products in the street, when she got her first credit from Kiva Partner Asociación Chajulense de Mujeres - Unidas por la Vida she began her store, now she has her third credit and is planning to expand her business. The business has helped her to give a better life for her family.

Ana is the leather of Mango Group 1, the group is composed by 8 women, their average age is 41 years, and on average have 3 children. The group invest their credits in expanding their selling staples businesses, the average amount of their credit is Q 2,900.

loans.use: To expand her store for selling products of first necessity

loans.name: Amanecer Chuacruz Group

texts.en:
Ismelda lives in a rural area above beautiful Lake Atitlan in Sololá,
Guatemala. She is a 21-year-old woman, who is thrilled to be participating for the very first time in the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Amanecer Chuacruz”. 

Ismelda has an animal husbandry business and with her anticipated loan, she plans to purchase two pigs, as well as their feed.  In addition, she would like to buy beads and supplies for her jewelry business. She makes colorful beaded pins, earrings, rings, bracelets and coin purses that she delivers to her clients, so that they can sell them to tourists who visit the nearby areas. 

Ismelda is motivated to raise her standard of living and in the future plans to buy more pigs and increase her jewelry business.

The ladies of “Amanecer Chuacruz” benefit from their monthly educational training with a Friendship Bridge Facilitator, who shares timely information with the women about a variety of relevant subjects. They gain valuable business tools, learn about health, hygiene and how to get their children ready for school. They learn how to dream and set goals for themselves. 

Friendship Bridge calls the combination of small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”. It is very successful!

The Trust Bank greatly appreciates the kindness and generosity of Kiva lenders from around the world. Armed with their new tools, Ismelda and her friends in the Trust Bank are poised to step into a brighter tomorrow, not only improving their own lives but those of their families and community. Thank you, Kiva !

loans.use: to purchase two pigs, as well as their feed. Also to make traditional jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Hesham

texts.en:
Hesham is a 30-years-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and six kids; four sons and two daughters. Hesham works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs. He decided to find an additional job which is distributing goods using a rickshaw.

Hesham took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for work. This will increase his income and also improve his family's living conditions. 

Hesham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Amanecer está en su ciclo número 2º  Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que quieren superarse.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estelvina, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora que está saliendo adelante por medio de su sacrificio y esfuerzo. Estelvina es una persona que quiere ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que pone todo lo mejor de sí.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The “Amanecer” (Dawn) group, is in its second cycle of the Women Committee Program, in which members are part of the poverty elimination program. They are very hardworking and enterprising women who want to improve themselves.

One of the members is Mrs. Estelvina, who sells clothing of all types. She is very enterprising and hardworking and is getting ahead through sacrifice and effort. Estelvina is the type of person who wants to be somebody in life, this being the reason why she puts the best of herself into everything she does.

She is requesting this loan to purchase a variety of clothing items to sell, such as T-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants and other clothing items, so that she may able to continue working as she has so far. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: purchase T-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants and other clothing items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy restaurant ingredients

loans.name: Antenor

texts.es:
Antenor tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos en la provincia de Cutervo que se encuentra ubicada en la región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila, la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros en su mototaxi, tiene 5 años de experiencia en esta actividad y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo lo utilizará para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Antenor espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Antenor is 41 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and their 3 children in the province of Cutervo, which is located in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. He lives in a community where life is calm. The population works in agriculture, business, and livestock.

He makes a living by providing urban transport services to passengers in his motortaxi. He has five years of experience in this work, and he has regular customers who offer him very good personal and professional references.

The loan will be used to make repairs and to maintain his vehicle, since it is currently in bad shape. With this, Antenor hopes to offer better service to his clients, which will then be reflected in his level of income. This will allow him to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle because it is currently in bad shape

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-years-old single man from Dier El-Balah city. He lives with his family in a small house. His sister works as an employee in the public sector where she earns a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. Ahmad decided to find a job which is distributing goods using a rickshaw.

Ahmad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to work with. This will increase the family's income and improve their living conditions. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-years-old married man from Dier El balah city. He lives with his wife and one small son. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. He decided to find an additional job which is distributing goods using a rickshaw.

Mohammad took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for work. This will increase his income and therefore improve his family's living conditions. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 37-year-old married woman with two children. She has been running a business purchasing and selling goats for many years with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). Currently, she has taken a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats to grow her business. She dreams of providing a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to grow her business.

loans.name: Ith's Group

texts.en: Ith’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Ith makes a living by cultivating to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time on collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Suglo Nbori Buni - Kakpagyili Group

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 32-year-old hardworking woman from Kakpagyili in the Northern region of Ghana. Fouzia is married and has two children. Fouzia is the individual pictured sitting second from the left among members sitting.

Fouzia is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for five years. The name of the group is "Suglo Nbori Buni - Kakpagyili." She earns a good profit from the business because the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high-quality parboiled rice for the Ghanaian.

Fouzia and Suglo Nbori Buni - Kakpagyili group have asked for a loan of GHS 5,400. Fouzia’s share of the loan is GHS 400, which would be used to buy paddy rice from local rice farmers for processing. Fouzia has planned to produce parboiled rice in large quantities so as to earn more income and repay this loan, feed her family and support her children's educations.

Fouzia thanks Kiva lenders for the great support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from local rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Suglo Nye Bobu  - Zoggu Group

texts.en:
Zina is a 30-year-old hard working woman from Zoggu in the northern region of Ghana. Zina is married and has four children. Zina is the individual pictured with the raised hand among members sitting.
	
Zina is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for about 10 years. The name of the group is ‘Suglo Nye Bobu  - Zoggu’. Zina earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and export markets.

Zina and ‘Suglo Nye Bobu  - Zoggu’ have asked for a loan of GHS 3,200.  Zina’s share of the loan is GHS 300, which would help her to buy shea nuts for processing. Zina wants to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her children with clothing and food.

Zina thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Giraldo Eduardo

texts.es:
El socio Giraldo pertenece al banco comunal EL TEMPLO DEL INCA, él  socio continua dedicándose  a brindar el  servicio de odontología, el socio Giraldo está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica la cual le da los ingresos para mejorar en su atención y profesión, y porque esta ayuda le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de materiales como amalgamas entre otros.
texts.en:
Giraldo is a member of the Communal Bank “El Templo del Inca” (The Incan Temple). He continues to provide dental services.

Giraldo greatly appreciates Kiva for helping him with his business. He can continue to earn income by improving his service and getting better at his profession. The loan will allow him to provide better service to his clients. He is a responsible and industrious person who works in this manner so that his family can get ahead.

Giraldo is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies, such as amalgams and other items.

loans.use: to buy amalgams and other supplies.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, de es un hombre trabajador y luchador, es agricultor de profesión, está casado y tiene 6 hijos, todos ya tienen sus propias familias, con él solo vive un nieto de 12 años, pues su esposa está fuera del país trabajando, para mejor sus condiciones de vida.

Juan, trabaja la tierra desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en la labranza de la tierra, a él le gusta mucho el campo y es por eso que todos los años prepara la tierra para cosechar los frutos de su laborioso trabajo.

Juan, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, para preparar la tierra antes que comience el invierno.

Juan, sueña con volver a ver a su hijo y a su esposa.
texts.en:
Juan is a hardworking and persevering man.  He's a farmer by trade.  He's married and has six children, all of whom already have their own families.  Only a 12-year-old grandson lives with him because his wife is working abroad for better living conditions.

Juan has been a farmer for a long time, so he has a lot of experience working the land.  He loves the countryside and that's why every year he prepares the land to harvest the fruit of his back-breaking work.

Juan needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs to prepare the land before winter.

Juan dreams of seeing his son and wife again.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to prepare the land before the beginning of winter

loans.name: José Abel

texts.es:
José Abel es un productor joven de 33 años de edad, de la zona norte de Nicaragua, donde uno de los principales rubros de producción es el café, al cual se dedica desde hace unos 14 años.
