Para garantizar una atención adecuada a su cafetal en este año, este pequeño productor está solicitando un crédito para garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento de 5 manzanas de café, y asegurar una buena cosecha en este ciclo y con ello mayores ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de este pequeño productor es hacer cada vez más rentable su pequeña finca, e inculcar en sus dos hijos el amor al trabajo y valores, que les permitan tener un mejor futuro, lo cual está seguro logrará con su dedicación a su familia y a su finca.
texts.en:
José Abel is 33 years old and lives in the northern part of Nicaragua, where one of the main crops is coffee.  He has grown coffee for 14 years.  

To guarantee adequate attention for his crops this year, this small producer is requesting a loan to guarantee his maintenance activities on five manzanas of coffee and assure he has a good harvest this crop cycle.  This will improve his family's income.

José Abel's dream is to make his small farm more profitable and instill in his two children a love of work and values that will allow them to have a better future.  He is sure that he will achieve this with his dedication to his family and his farm.

loans.use: to purchase supplies that will allow him to have a good coffee crop.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Her name is Zenaida, 54, a widow and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines.  She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to support herself and assist in her family's daily personal, household needs.

Zenaida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also has a tricycle unit for transport service which her husband drives as added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 700 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting an Php 11000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits,  soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expense. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Zenaida hopes grow her business to better support herself and her family's needs. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
In the Philippines, sari-sari stores are everywhere. Sari-sari (a term used for variety) store sells different kinds of products from biscuits, candies, can goods, noodles, products used for personal hygiene and the like which are involved in every individual’s daily living. This is considered as one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people since it provides commodity for people. 

With this fact, Margie was enticed to get in touch with this kind of craft. She is 34 years old, married to Allan and a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. By now, they are working with determination to pursue the needs of their family. The income they get from the store helps them for their daily expenditures.

However, what profits they get from the business is sometimes insufficient. It is because at times, she finds it hard to maintain supplies of various products due to financial incapability. This is why, she is requesting PHP 50,000 loan that she will utilize to buy additional products for her inventory. With more products displayed in her store, she can ably have greater increase in her income. 

In due time, she hopes that she grow in progress and that her business will boost in sales. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her sari-sari store inventory.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre innovador y con mucha disposición al trabajo. Vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua, donde la principal actividad económica es la producción de café, el cual también cultiva en 5 manzanas de su pequeña finca que ha logrado certificar con comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices.

En los últimos tres años, este pequeño emprendedor, ha venido mejorando las condiciones de su cafetal, lo cual le ha permitir incrementar en 40% los rendimientos de su café, y para este año su meta es continuar aumentando la productividad de su finca, por lo cual está solicitando un crédito para comprar los insumos que garanticen la fertilidad del suelo y con ello obtener un mayor rendimiento y calidad para la generación de más ingresos, con los cuales continuará apoyando la educación de sus tres hijos.

Su sueño es heredar a sus hijos una finca productiva, para que ellos optimicen los recursos con que cuentan, aplicando los conocimientos que ellos adquieran en su educación.
texts.en: Jairo is an innovating man, with a lot of disposition for work. He lives in a rural community in the north of Nicaragua, where the main financial activity is coffee production, which he also cultivates in 5 manzanas (1,740 acres = 1 manzana) of his small farm that has obtained the fair trade certification (UTZ and C.A.F.E. Practices). In the last three years, this small businessman has been improving the conditions of his coffee plots, which has allowed him to increase in 40% the profits from his coffee, and for this year his goal is to continue increasing his farm's productivity. For this he is requesting a loan to buy the inputs that will warrant soil fertility, and with it to obtain a better yield and quality in order to have more income to keep supporting his three children's education. His dream is to leave his children a productive farm in bequest, so that they can optimize the resources they have, applying the knowledge they will get with their education.

loans.use: to buy inputs that he will apply to his coffee plots to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN JOVEN DE 25 AÑOS Y PADECE DE UNA ENFERMEDAD PERIODONTAL LA CUAL LE CAUSA MAL ALIENTO LO QUE PROVOCA QUE SU AUTOESTIMA SEA MUY BAJA, EVITANDO RELACIONARSE CON LA GENTE. ANTERIORMENTE YA HABIA RECIBIDO TRATAMIENTO PERO TUVO MUY MALA EXPERIENCIA AL GRADO DE TENER TEMOR A PERDER SUS DIENTES.
texts.en:
This young man is 25 years of age and suffers from periodontal disease, which causes bad breath and can lead to very low self-esteem. As a result, he has been avoiding interaction with other people.

He received treatment previously, but it was a very bad experience for him. However, he is still fearful of losing his teeth.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home system, so they may live safely and their children can study at night.

loans.name: Nea's Group

texts.en: Nea’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Nea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time on collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mob

texts.en:
Mob, a farmer with three children, lives in Chuo Chry Village. Her home is far from the power grid. 

As a farmer, Mob wants to expand her farming with five hectares of land and allow her family to live in comfortable conditions. However, her house is in a remote area and her current home energy is not reliable. Moreover, she needs to charge her battery three or four times every week for daily usage. The car battery she has is a time and money consuming energy source. Sometimes, due to busyness, she doesn’t have time to charge the battery and the whole family is in pitch black conditions for the whole day. 

As a result, Mob has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a high quality solar home system. After using solar home energy, she believes her family's conditions will be better and safer. She can also save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Chuo Chry Village, Da Commune, Chetr Borei Distric

loans.name: Koemthean

texts.en:
Koemthean and her husband live with their three children in Buk Toek Village. They earn a living by farming on 10 hectares of land. Working hard day and night raising her three children, she wants to have a comfortable life for her family. 

Currently she is still keeping the farming with her husband. Koemthean has difficulty in using batteries for home energy. She needs to recharge her battery every week. It is a time-consuming activity. Seeing the difficulty in using the car battery, she has decided to apply for Kiva to buy a solar home system. Koemthean believes that solar home energy can enhance her lifestyle to live in comfortable conditions, and also save on utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Buk Toek Village, Preaek Brasab Commune, Preaek Br

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis trabaja en un Estudio Jurídico, está estudiando la carrera de derecho, comenta que sus metas futuras son la de independizarse, montar su propia oficina y seguir estudiando para obtener el título de Doctor y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de sus útiles de universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Luis works at a law firm and is also studying for a law degree. He says that his future goals are to become independent, establish his own practice, continue studying for a doctorate degree, and help his family.

Luis is requesting this loan so that he can cover the cost of his supplies for university. This will help him to continue his studies just as before.

loans.use: to cover the cost of his supplies for university.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Oñondivepa, está en su ciclo 14 dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas realizan actividades y mantienen un buen trabajo en equipo con el cual todas asumen su responsabilidad solidaria.
La. Sra. Aurelia es una persona que a gracias a su constancia y apoyo de sus compañeras ha logrado salir adelante, y mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia. Aurelia se dedica a la venta de gallinas que ella misma cría y que luego vende o faena.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar gallinas para la cría y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Ella quiere poder seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos y es por ello que quiere crecer y luchar por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Oñondivepa Group is in its fourteenth loan cycle in the women's bank program, in which all the members have jobs.  They work well as a team and each one is responsible for being supportive.

Aurelia's someone who, thanks to her determination and the support of her colleagues, has managed to get ahead and improve her income and her family's income.  She earns a living selling chickens that she raises herself then sells or butchers.

She's requesting this loan so she can buy chickens to raise.  That way she'll be able to keep on making sales as she has been doing.

Aurelia wants to be able to keep helping her loved ones, so she wants to grow and strive to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Claudia Yamileth

texts.es: Claudia vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de: harina, azúcar, jalea, moldes etc. para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in her house with her family. She has had a bakery located in her home for 3 years. With the sales she makes, she succeeds in covering some household expenses. The young woman lives in her own house with her husband, who is a farmer. 

She is requesting a new loan to buy flour, sugar, gelatin, molds, etc. Thus, she will improve her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, gelatin, molds, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta hails from the town of Loon, Bohol. She engages in a food vending business. She sells home-cooked meals and snack foods like banana cue (fried banana with caramelized sugar). She is a 63-year-old married woman with six grown children. She has been engaged in food vending for more than ten years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as bananas, flour, cooking oil, and other ingredients needed. These ingredients will be used in preparing a variety of food to sell. Thus, it could help Violeta augment her income and be able to cater to the needs of her customers. In this way, her daily income will improve and she will be able to handle her finances.

She dreams of expanding her business to become successful and productive, as well as to have a sustainable living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as bananas, flour, cooking oil, and other ingredients needed.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1976. She is living in Rasulov district Dehmoy village, a small village where nature is pretty good each season. She is married and has two children. She has ten years of practice doing business in agriculture. She is an agrarian woman. She keeps livestock and plants agricultural products. She loves to do business in agriculture and plant vegetables and seeds.

Gulchehra asks for a loan to buy fertilizers, natural chemicals, and seeds in order to have a good harvest. She hopes to gain a profit from her business and feed her family. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, natural chemicals, and seeds in order to have a good harvest

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Her name is Felicitas, 51, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Antonio, a caretaker, and they have five children. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their  income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children.

Felicitas has a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, school bags, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon. Dealers buy the products at a lower price shown on the catalogue of the customers and sell them at a profit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a Php 15000 loan which she will use to buy merchandise items and orders of beauty products, school bags, clothing, shoes, sandals for her customers.  Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality.  She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given her.   

Felicitas aims to grow her business so she could send her children to the best school. She dreams that all of them will finish college and that they live a quiet life.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for cosmetics, shoes, school bags, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home system, to improve their daily life.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios, 54, and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Valentin, a security guard, together they have five children of which two are in college, one is not of school age, and two stay home. Remedios manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs, and to send her children to school. 

Remedios operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 700 PHP per day. 

To help her continue the operations of her general store business, Remedios is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda and other grocery stuffs. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are the main source to meet the family's daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Remedios hopes to maintain and grow her business to better provide for her family. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible, and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. Here, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Luchadoras, está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. 
 La Sra. Basilia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y a sus seres queridos, está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de comidas que ella misma hace, y que después sale a vender por las zonas alrededor de su barrio.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, pollo, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida y poder mejorar su nivel de pobreza.
texts.en:
The group called “Las Luchadores” is on their second loan cycle. The members are all women and they are all striving to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

Basilia is one of the members of the group. She is very devoted to her family and her loved ones. She is doing everything she can to improve her family’s living conditions. She makes a living by preparing and selling food in the areas neighbouring the place where she lives.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy vegetables, meat, seasoning, chicken, and other ingredients so she can continue with her work. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving, which will enable her to become somebody in life and improve her level of poverty.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, seasoning, chicken, and other supplies

loans.name: Fenix Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fénix  está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde  una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirtha quien en su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que ha mejorado por medo de las capacitaciones que ha tenido.
A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de las manualidades que viene haciendo, va mejorando poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Mirtha pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, agujas y otros insumos para poder seguir con su producción. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante y con su trabajo poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Fénix Group is in its tenth loan cycle in the women's bank program.  One of the members is Mirtha, who had a level of three on her last poverty elimination survey.  In other words, she has improved because of the training she has had.  Through her effort and ongoing work, and through the handmade crafts she makes, she continues to improve her living conditions little by little for herself and her family.

Mirtha's requesting this loan to be able to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies to keep up her production.

She's grateful for this opportunity to be able to grow, get ahead with her work, and help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies for handmade crafts

loans.name: Habiza

texts.en:
Habiza is a bright woman. She was born into a family of workers. She is living in the northern part of the country in a small city. She is married and has four children. 

She has 18 years of experience doing business. She is a baker. She bakes national homemade bread. She has a place (a small store) nearby her house where she does business with her husband. She bakes 500 breads a day and sells it at 1.10 TJS. She has permanent clients and is well-known among bakers and friends. 

Habiza is thankful for IMON and Kiva lenders for the service and support. She wants to get a loan to buy coal and flour to bake more bread and earn money. She wishes to live better and feed her big family, and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy coal and flour to bake more bread and earn money

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This is Maricel, 36, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jerry, a car AC technician, and has one child. The couple works hard to meet their daily personal household needs and to send their child to a good school.

Maricel has a car air conditioning repair shop, which offers repair, check-ups, and maintenance of all kinds of car air conditioning. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to pay for equipment used in her repair service. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely improve the shop service and thus increase her income to fund their everyday needs and the educational needs of their child.

Maricel hopes to improve her service and attract more clients. She dreams for her family to be always happy and healthy. She meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for equipment used in her car air conditioning repair business.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito is a 40-year-old fisherman living in Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has three children, ages 13, 12, and 9. He catches and sells fish for a living.He has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years.  He is in need of capital to sustain his livelihood.

He has requested a loan to buy materials to repair his pump boat, such as plywood, nails, epoxy, and other items. These supplies are very essential to increase his catch and his income. He will be able to provide his children with nutritious food.  

In the future, he dreams of expanding his fishing business to make it sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his pump boat

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita engages in buying and selling frozen goods like sausages, hot dogs, ham and other meat products. She is a 47-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 24 and the youngest is 4 years old, respectively. She resides in Talibon, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of frozen goods like longniza (sausage) and other frozen meat. These will help Isabelita deliver her order on time. She would be able to sell more frozen products and it will generate higher earnings. 

In the future, Isabelita dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of frozen goods like longniza (sausage) and other frozen meat

loans.name: Masis

texts.en: Masis is 52 years old and he lives with his wife in Kapan city of the Syunik region. They have three children; their elder daughter is already married and lives with her family, and their younger daughter and son live and work in Yerevan city. Masis, with his beloved wife, takes care of his not small farm, where he has a lot of bee families and also a lot of rabbits. He mentions that both the sale of honey and rabbits for meat is rather profitable. Besides that, he also has new plans. He rented a greenhouse where he plans to start flower production of different types and sorts. He will sell the flowers wholesale at the city flower market. Masis is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as he needs to buy different flower seedlings and start his planting activities with great hope that his new idea will really work and bring more income with it.

loans.use: to buy different flower seedlings and start his planting activities.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida, aged 52, has been involved in an embroidered clothes-selling business for about fifteen years. She buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothing from the main city market, and then sells to the people of the local community. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. The summer season is going to be starting, and she wants to buy clothes for the summer season.

Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales.

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good-quality living standard to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. Zahida thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase summer season clothing for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for orthodontic treatment.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth engages in making and selling native baskets, and serve as her main source of income.  She is 29 years old and married a with seven-year old daughter. She has been engaged in basket weaving for  8 years now. Her husband is a farmer. Currently, she has very limited capital to continue operating her business.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like nito (dried  rope-like  twisted palm), oway (woody vine) and buli (a kind of palm). These materials will enables Janeth to  produce more baskets that would cater to her customers needs. With this, she will now able to have increased income. She will also be able to provide nutritious diets and better shelter for her family. 

Janeth hopes that she will be successful in handling her business for the improved welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like nito (dried  rope-like  twisted palm), oway (woody vine) and and buli (a kind of palm) to make baskets and other woven items.

loans.name: Las Rivereñas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de 17 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, llamado Las Rivereñas está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están luchando por poder mejorar.
La Sra. Anita quien se dedica al negocio de venta de comidas y en la compra de los productos varios, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante, y con su trabajo poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Cabe destacar que las integrantes de este grupo han trabajado y logrado unirse más entre ellas. Anita pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, hortalizas, pollo y otros insumos, de manera a poder seguir haciendo sus comidas.
texts.en:
This group of 17 women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso, is called “Las Rivereñas” (The riverine women) and is in cycle number 4 of the women committee program, where all members work to help each other get ahead. They are performing a poverty elimination survey, where all of them are endeavoring to improve. It should be noted that the members of this group have worked together and achieved more unity among them.

Mrs. Anita, who is in the business of selling prepared food and buying various products, is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and be able to help her family and loved ones with her work. Anita requests this loan to purchase supplies for the meals she sells, such as vegetables, meats, herbs, chicken and other food supplies in order to be able to continue preparing meals.

loans.use: buy vegetables, meats, herbs, chicken and other food supplies to prepare meals

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 35-year-old married man from Dier El-balah city. He is the father for two sons and two daughters. 

Ibrahim works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also has a store for selling cleaning products. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income. 

Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more cleaning products for his store to resell. This will increase his sales and also his income.
 
Ibrahim appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more cleaning products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Winnie Jane

texts.en:
Winnie Jane is thankful that she was granted a PHP 10,000 loan, which she used to buy sacks of rice and soda needed in her business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan to buy additional sacks of rice to sell at either wholesale or retail price, and to pay for cases of soft drinks to sell. Her earnings from selling rice help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her and for the good return on her investment, for it will surely provide for their daily sustenance and fund their child's school needs.

Winnie Jane aims to sustain her rice and soft drinks business to progress in life. She aims to give her child a college education to allow her better opportunities in the future. She faithfully meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and cases of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 21 years old. He lives in the Batumi district with his parents and sister. The only source of income for the family is his father's monthly salary, working as a security guard. 

Giorgi wants to start his own business and needs credit. The Start Up, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2500 USD. With the received loan, Giorgi plans to open a cement workshop in which he can make cement blocks. He will purchase all the needed materials such as cement and start making blocks, which will be sold among the resellers. 

He will use the profits for reinvesting, in order to improve the business and increase its profitability. The new business will give Giorgi a chance to grow the family's income and enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase cement and other materials so he can start making cement blocks for his new start-up business

loans.name: Fahed

texts.en:
Fahed is a 23-years-old single man from Dier El-balah city. He lives with his family in a small house. Fahed works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Fahed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity.
 
Fahed appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 33-years-old married man from Dier El-balah city. He lives with his wife and kids in a small house. Ibrahim works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covering all the family needs.
 
Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity.
 
Ibrahim appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 41 year old married man, with a child. His child goes to school and his wife is a nurse at the local polyclinic. Samir’s family is living at Fuzuli region but already for 23 years they are an IDP(Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city.

Samir has been in the animal breeding business. At present he needs a loan in amount of 1000(Azerbaijan New Manat). For this reason, Samir has applied to the Komak company. With this loan, he wants to build a small stall for his cows. He gives great thanks to the Kiva organization and its lenders for their  help. 

In the future Samir wants to give a good education to his child.

loans.use: to build a stall for his cows and increase business. In the  future he wants to give a good education to his child.

loans.name: Ally

texts.en:
The borrower who is in his early 40s, is single with one child, who is still at school. He has been running a retail shop business for four years now.  He works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be the borrower's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase the shop inventory and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciate Kiva for their support. He used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase on the shop inventory and serve more people.  He dreams of opening a wholesale business.  

He will make sure he pays back the loan at the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase on the shop inventory and serve more people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 31-years-old single man from Dier El-balah city. He lives with his family in a small house. Ashraf works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covering all the family needs.
 
Ashraf took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity. 

Ashraf appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Valerian

texts.en:
Valerian is 39 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 2 children in the small village of Sagarejo district. 

Valerian has a bakery and bakes Georgian bread to sell. He has a commercial space near his bakery and wants to open a small market. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 3000 USD. 

With the received credit, he will purchase products such as sugar, salt, and other items and also will purchase inventory, where he will place these products. As the market is opened, his wife will work there as a sales lady and the family will be able to increase their family income.

loans.use: to open a market and increase the family income

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El  joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  se dedica a la compra-venta de ganado vacuno y al cultivo de granos básicos, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esa actividad su padre fue quien le ayudo para que iniciara con ese trabajo, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, el joven vive con su grupo familiar en casa de sus padres, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 2 vacas horras para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que le genera buenas ganancias y asi podrá seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos.
texts.en: The young man in the picture has had his face blurred because he is only 24 years old and he lives in a high-risk area. He makes a living by buying and selling cattle and growing staple grains. He has six years of experience in this line of work. It was his father who helped him to start this work. He sells his products in the neighbouring villages. The young man lives with his family in his parents’ house. He is requesting this loan in order to buy two dry cows so he can continue with his work, which generates good profits, and thereby continue helping out with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy two dry cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow, so as to increase the milk supplied to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, glue, screws, tacks, and other materials for making furniture

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and six children. 

Her son owns a small gemstones shop, in which he sells precious gemstones for making rings, earrings, and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display case to attract customers.  

He has only one source of income.  He has to pay the expenses of utility bills, school fees of his sibling, and household expenses alone. The condition of their house is not up to the mark for living.

Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so her son can increase his inventory and ultimately his earnings as well.

She hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members can pass their lives comfortably.  She is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to help her son in purchasing gemstones used in jewelry making.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Pedro está en su ciclo número 2º  Del programa de comités, tiene 23 integrantes, todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Angelina, quien en su última encuesta mostro que ha ido mejorando y creciendo.
Angelina se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compra de ellas los productos que vende. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha cada día por poder crecer.
La Sra. Angelina pide este préstamo para la compra de frutas, como manzana, piñas, melones, naranjas, y otras frutas, de manera a poder seguir con su lucha. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar y ayudar a su familia y todos los seres queridos que tiene.
texts.en:
The “San Pedro” group is in its second cycle of the committee program. It has 23 members, all of which are part of the elimination of poverty program, in which one of the members is Mrs. Angelina, who in her last survey showed she’s been improving and growing.

Angelina sells fresh fruit and mentions that she’s doing very well. She now has a lot of clients who always purchase the products she sells. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman, who fights to improve every day in order to grow.

Mrs. Angelina is requesting this loan to purchase fruits, such as apples, pineapples, melons, oranges and other fruit in order to continue her struggle. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve and help her family and all her loved ones.

loans.use: purchase fruit, such as: apples, pineapples, melons, oranges and other fruit

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
La Victoria  está en su ciclo número 4, se encuentran trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas y cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Estela, una de las integrantes, tiene una despensa quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que esta en una pobreza extrema, pero ella pone todo de si para poder mejorar cada día.
La Sra. Estela solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos como carne, huevo, aceite, bebidas, panificados y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más ingreso.
texts.en:
La Victoria is in its fourth cycle.  They are working with the elimination of poverty program.  All of them are putting forth their best effort in order to be able to grow and to get ahead.

Estela is one of the members, and she has a grocery store.  On the last survey she was shown to be at a level one level of poverty.  This means that she is in extreme poverty.  Therefore, she puts all of herself into being able to improve each day.

Estela is requesting this loan to buy supplies like meat, eggs, cooking oil, drinks, baked goods, and others.  This will help her to get more earnings.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, cooking oil, drinks, baked goods, and others.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado KUÑA ATY se formó en la ciudad de Asunción, son 20 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y por medio de su trabajo ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Alicia, quien se dedica a la venta de lencerías, comenta que poco a poco se ha abierto camino para poder tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Comenta que está creciendo y  con su trabajo quiere seguir luchando por una vida mejor y digna sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar lencerías varias para la venta, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty group was formed in the city of Asunción.  They are 20 women, all friends and neighbors from this city.  They are putting forth their best effort in order to be able to grow and to help their families through their work.

Alicia is one of the members.  She sells lingerie.  She says that, little by little, she has opened the path to being able to have the means to be able to help her family.  She says that it is growing, and with her work she wants to continue struggling for a better life that is decent and without deprivations.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy varied lingerie to sell.  With this she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.  

She is grateful for this opportunity that she is getting to be able to improve each day and to be able to help her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy varied lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 36 years old and married. She lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of two sons and a daughter.

She dues embroidery work by her hands at home to financially support her family.

She belongs to a poor family.  Her husband’s income is very poor, so she decided to start embroidery work at home. She has been learning these arts since her childhood.  Now she has adopted them for her occupation.  She has made herself independent and is earning sufficient income. 

Shahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of threads, silk, fancy, sequins, and pearls of various colors. 

She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her embroidery work

loans.name: Diaa

texts.en:
Diaa is 30 years old and married, from Rafah city.  He lives with his wife and three kids in a small house. 

He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs. 

Diaa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  They will be able to provide hot water without using electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 41 years old and married.  She is the mother of two sons and six daughters.  Her husband is government employee.

Samina has started a business selling clothes. She wants to support her family through her business. She purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sell them at a profitable price in the main market. 

Presently she needs to purchase some clothes to sell. However, due to lack of finances, she is facing problem. For that reason, she has requested for loan from Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan. 

She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to assist with all the family needs. 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity to save money.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Elena tiene 18 integrantes, cada una de ellas está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Se destacan entre las integrantes la Sra. Marta, quien  es costurera cuyo nivel de pobreza es el  de nivel de 1, lo que quiere decir que está en una pobreza extrema.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante, y es por ello que está luchando para poder crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en: The "Santa Elena" group has 18 members. Each one of them puts their best effort into helping their loved ones. One of the outstanding members is Marta who is a seamstress. She has a poverty level of 1  which is to say extreme poverty. She is a very hard-working person who wants to get ahead and so she is fighting to be able to grow. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and others. In this way she can continue with her sewing as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving to be able to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and others.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 52-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of eight children and equally responsible for all of them. 
She belongs to an ultra-poor family and that is why she cannot afford their educational expenses, so that most of her children are doing jobs as laborers in daily wages. 

One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his business. Her son owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides services of welding. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to the increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding material. Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son so that he would be able to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

Nasreen is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps Nasreen's son in purchasing welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Mujeres Unidas, es un grupo ya antiguo, se formó con la unión de 19 mujeres, todas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Son de una zona rural, aun en crecimiento.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Nilsa quien trabaja en la cría de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, ovejas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales para la cría, y con ello poder seguir luchando por ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Mujeres Unidas” [“United Women”].  It is already an old group.  It was formed by uniting 19 women, all very hard-working and enterprising, who joined together to be able to improve their living conditions.  They are from a rural zone that is growing.

One of the members is Nilsa, who works raising farmyard animals, such as chickens, pigs, sheep, and others.  In this way, she has been able to continue with her work like she has been doing it.  She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who wants to be someone in life.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy animals to raise, and thus be able to continue fighting to help her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise, such as chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 34-years-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and one child  in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 
Raed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity to save money.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El joven Jorge, es estudiante de la carrera de técnico en óptica, cursa actualmente el último año, es un joven muy sacrificado que lucha para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Comenta que este préstamo lo pide para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
Su sueño es poder tener su propia óptica, y con ello poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Jorge is studying a technical Optics course and is in his last year. He is young very determined to fight to become somebody in life. He comments that he is requesting this loan to pay the tuition for his courses so he can continue to work as he has been doing. His dream is to have his own Optical clinic and with it help his family and his loved ones.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his courses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bean seedlings and fertilizers for his small farm.,

loans.name: Honesto

texts.en:
Honesto is thankful that he was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which he used to purchase various over-the-counter medicines needed in his small drug store. Through his earnings, he is able to meet their daily living expenses.

He would now like to apply for a 60,000 PHP loan, which he will use to buy more quantities of over-the-counter medicine products that he sells at retail. He is positive he will serve a bigger market as he expands his drug store. His earnings are a stable source to sustain his family's basic needs. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.

Honest dreams of having a bigger drug store and helping his less fortunate relatives. He prays that someday he'll be able to travel around the world. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy medicines, groceries, and other products to sell at his small drug store.

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en: Khouloud is a 36-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. Despite the bad circumstances, Khouloud is working hard, in cooperation with her husband who works as a taxi driver, to satisfy their family’s demands. She has owned a grocery store since 2005 near her house. And today, she is asking to borrow from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase food provisions and a refrigerator to increase her business sales as well as her income. She is an optimistic person always aiming for the best and plans to receive more Kiva loans in the coming years to keep on improving her family’s standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase food items to sell and a refrigerator for her shop

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 24 year old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. She is the main income provider in her family. She cooperates with her brothers in order to supplement the family’s income and fulfilling their daily needs. 

In 2009, she decided to start her own work as a farmer. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l for land reclamation. She states that the loan will surely help her increase her business productivity by a fair percentage which will give her higher profits.

In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop her business.

loans.use: for land reclamation for farming

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish to earn for a living. She is 27 year old, a married woman with five children ages 1 -14 year old respectively.  Together with her family, she lives in Talibon, Bohol. 

Aside from fishing, she also raises and sells hogs. She is need of capital to continue operate her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing nets and pig feed.  These tools are very helpful in augmenting her business.  She could now be able to balance her finances and pay her obligations. 

 Evelyn hopes that she will be productive in handling her business well, for her to finance the schooling of her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets and also pig  feed

loans.name: Mushfig

texts.en:
Mushfig is 49 years old. He has been married for 22 years and has three children. 

He opened a small store, where he sells daily food products. His wife is a hairdresser. His elder daughter studies at the third course of a medical college.  His other daughter goes to tenth class Also she plays the piano well. And Mushfig’s son is preparing for university. 

They are an IDP(Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in Fuzuli region. 

This is Mushfig's second loan.  His first loan was repaid on time. 

Today Mushfig wants to increase his business and therefore he has applied to the Komak company for a loan in the amount of 1100 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy a fridge. He says he is thankful to Kiva for its aid. 

In the future Mushfig wants to help to his children with their education.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, increase business. In the future, he wants help his children with  education.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama MUJERES TRIUNFADORAS están en el 4to. ciclo donde todas  han demostrado laboriosidad y capacidad para trabajar en equipo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Leandra, se dedica a alquileres de sillas y mesas, se contrata sus servicios para todos los acontecimientos de la zona. Con su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. El grupo es antiguo y bastante unido.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de sillas y mesas, para poder seguir con el alquiler de los mismos, ya que es el único medio de trabajo con el que ella cuenta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The committee called “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Successful Women) is in its 4th cycle, where all members have shown industriousness and the ability to work as a team. This is a veteran and very united group.

One of the members is Mrs. Leandra, who works renting out chairs and tables; she is hired to service all the events taking place in the area. With this job, she has the means to be able to help her family and loved ones. She is a very hard working and tenacious woman.

She is asking for this loan to purchase chairs and tables to be able to continue leasing them, since it is the only job she has. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: purchase chairs and tables to rent out

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, comenta que se encuentra estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y comenta que su sueño es poder salir adelante y abrirse al campo laboral.
Benito quiere poder ayudar a su familia y poder abrirse camino. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Benito is from the city of San Ignacio. He comments that he is studying the career of Business Administration, and he comments that his dream is to move ahead and succeed in the working field. Benito wants to help his family and succeed. He is requesting this loan to pay for his college fees, and in this way to keep on working as he has been doing so far.

loans.use: to pay for college fees.

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en:
Awatef is a 45 year old Lebanese widow, who lives with her eight children. Four of them are still attending school. After she lost her husband, she became the main income provider in the family. 

So she decided to start her own business in the agriculture field in 2008, in order to earn extra income and be able to support her family financially. 

She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds and seedlings for planting for her business, with the aim to increase her productivity and therefore increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 45-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three daughters and two sons. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last few years. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. Therefore Fozia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Fozia is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 38 year old married woman. She lives with her husband and one child who is still attending school. 

She has worked from her house as hairdresser since 2014 and has five years of experience working in the same occupation. In addition, her husband works in a company outside Lebanon and they cooperate together to be able to pay the high costs of living. 

Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase hairdressing equipment and beauty products. She is very sure that this loan will help her to satisfy her customers' demands. In the future, she hopes to open her own beauty salon where she will receive her customers properly.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing equipment and beauty products

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 32-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and a little daughter. Ahmed works in the public sector, where he gets low-income, which is not enough for all the family expenses. 

Ahmad took USD Murabaha loan from FATEN, to buy a solar system, and thus will be able to get hot water without any cost.

Ahmad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar power system

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y con sus estudios quiere abrirse camino para poder ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Ella quiere salir adelante, y poder servir a la sociedad. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser una buena profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad y así seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Maria is from the city of Villarrica, She is studying the career of Nursing, and with her studies she wants to make her way to become a professional useful to society. She wants to move ahead, and be able to serve society. She is grateful for the given opportunity to be a good professional. She is requesting this loan to pay for college fees, and in this way to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for college fees.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 29-year-old lady, living with her spouse and two sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to provide better living facilities for her children, but it seems impossible, in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a motorized rickshaw for several years. His income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient capital to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to enable her husband to buy a body for the motorized rickshaw.

She thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: 's husband in purchasing a rickshaw body.

loans.name: Andrea Veronica

texts.es: Veronica esta casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 años y 9 años de edad y asisten a la escuela,  Veronica esta pasando por sus 29 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y tambien trabaja al jornal. El esposo de Veronica se dedica al jornal de trabajos de agricultura. Veronica solicita el dinero del credito para comprar chanchos y asi mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos. Veronica ama mucho a sus hijos y comenta que por ellos es que trabaja junto a su esposo para sacarlos adelante.
texts.en: Veronica is married and has two children, who are 5 and 9 years old and who attend school. Veronica is 29 years old. She works raising small animals, and she also works on day jobs. Veronica's husband works on a daily basis in agriculture jobs. Veronica is requesting a loan to buy pigs, and in this way to improve her business and income. Veronica loves her children very much, and she comments that it is because of them that she works together with her husband to move them forward.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
Los miembros del grupo Esfuerzo habitan en una pequeña comunidad del Estado de México. A pesar de que el lugar es muy apartado y no cuenta con todos los servicios, especialmente de transporte, los habitantes continúan haciendo un gran esfuerzo día a día para realizar sus actividades. Otra peculiaridad de las personas de este pequeño poblado es que la mayoría, a diferencia de las comunidades vecinas, son de tez un poco más clara y tienen un acento distinto. Entre ellos se encuentran Gustavo y Arturo quienes se dedican a dar servicio en tiendas escolares; Yolanda, a la venta de abarrotes y Karina a la venta de zapatos y papas.

Gustavo es un joven emprendedor, padre de una pequeña de 1 año por quien trabaja para ofrecerle mejores oportunidades. Hace tiempo, Gustavo trabajaba en un banco en su municipio, sus jornadas laborales eran de domingo a domingo y la mayoría de los días salía hasta la media noche para regresar a casa. "Después de vivir eso, mi meta fue ser mi propio jefe".

Después de notar que en las escuelas de su comunidad vendían dulces y frituras, nada saludables para los niños, Gustavo decidió crear una propuesta y presentarla al Director de una de las instituciones. Pronto Gustavo se vio atendiendo a más de 350 niños en tan solo 20 minutos "la hora del terror" como le llama él, pues debe atender con velocidad a todos los pequeños quienes ahora pueden comer tortas y tacos mejor preparados, frutas y verduras con "chamoy", entre otras opciones más saludables y atractivas. Gustavo compartió con alegría que un día un niño le dijo muy seriamente "Preparas cosas muy sanas", pero afortunadamente los niños las compran. 

Es así que todos los días Gustavo se levanta a las 3 o 4 am para comenzar a preparar toda la comida, llega a las 10 am a la escuela para comenzar a acomodar y recibir la estampida de niños una vez más. Finalmente, sus actividades en la escuela terminan a las 2 pm y está listo para comprar los ingredientes para el siguiente día e ir a casa con su pequeña. En esta ocasión Gustavo necesita un préstamo para comprar aceite, azúcar, jícama, zanahorias y pan.

*La fotografia fue tomada la calle justo afuera de la casa de la tia de Gustavo, él es quien tiene la playera negra y el pantalón café*
texts.en:
The members of the Esfuerzo (Effort) group live in a small community of the State of Mexico. Even though it is a very remote place and does not have all services specially transportation, its inhabitants keep on working hard day by day to carry out their activities. Another unique feature of the people from this town is that most of them, unlike the neighboring communities, are of lighter skin color and have a distinct accent. Among them are Gustavo and Arturo, who work providing services in school stores; Yolanda, who has a grocery store, and Karina who sells shoes and potatoes. Gustavo is an enterprising young man, father of a young daughter who is 1 year old, and for whom he works to give her more opportunities. Some time ago, Gustavo used to work at a bank in his municipality. His workdays were from Sunday to Sunday, and most of the days he would leave at midnight to go back home. "After living that, my goal was to be my own boss". After noticing that at the schools of his community they sold sweets and fried foods, not healthy for children, Gustavo decided to create a proposal to present to the Director of one of the institutions. Soon, Gustavo was serving more than 350 children in only 20 minutes at the "terror time" as he calls it, because he must service very quickly all the small children, who now can eat better prepared sandwiches and tacos, fruits and vegetables with "chamoy"(condiment), among other healthier and more attractive options. Gustavo shared with happiness what a child told him very seriously: "You prepare very healthy things", but fortunately the children buy them. This is why Gustavo gets up at 3 or 4 a.m. to start to prepare all the food. He arrives at school at 10 a.m. to start setting up and receive the stampede of children once more. Finally, his school activities finish at 2 p.m. and he is ready to buy the ingredients for the following day and go home to his small daughter. This time, Gustavo needs a loan to buy oil, sugar, jicama, carrots and bread.
*The photograph was taken on the street outside Gustavo's aunt. He is wearing the black t-shirt and brown pants.*

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, jicama, carrots and bread.

location.town: Rioyos Buenavista, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es una mujer honesta y esforzada, de cincuenta y nueve años de edad, ella inicio en el negocio de hacer pan, tortillas, nacatamales y rosquillas, desde pequeña, junto a su madre, de la cual aprendió a trabajar arduamente para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Ahora Susana cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas, juntas se esfuerzan por hacer crecer el negocio familiar.
Esta luchadora mujer ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le brinde un préstamo que le permita comprar su materia prima, como lo es, el maíz, harina, cebolla, chiltoma, carne, azúcar, queso, entre otros  y también darle mantenimiento a su horno artesanal. En un futuro planea hacer de su negocio una panadería, además de poder ofrecer sus productos por todo su departamento.
texts.en:
Susana, 59, is a hardworking and honest woman. She started her trade - making bread, tortillas, tamales and rosquillas - at a young age alongside her mother who taught her to work hard to improve her quality of life. Now Susana's two daughters work with her to grow their family business.

This persistent woman has come back to Kiva with MiCredito to ask for a loan to buy her ingredients including corn, flour, onion, sweet pepper, beef, sugar, cheese, etc, and also to perform maintenance on her artisanal oven. In the future the plans to turn her business into a bakery, and hopes to offer products throughout the state where she lives.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like corn, flour, onion, sweet pepper, beef, sugar, cheese, etc and also to perform maintenance on her artisanal oven.

loans.name: Cattleyas Group

texts.es:
Ruthi es una mujer de 48 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos de 27, 23  y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de gaseosas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, respetuosa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ que se caracteriza por los orígenes de sus pobladores; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, donde se asentaron y formaron un gran comercio, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Ruthi es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabellos negros corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el español y habla quechua por herencia familiar (delante de cuclillas, viste solera a rayas horizontales amarilla y naranja). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus dos hijos menores, el mayor ya es independiente, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus ganas de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de videos, venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería, venta de productos cosméticos, taller de soldadura, venta de vajilla, venta de fruta y venta de desayunos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de gaseosas, actividad que realiza en un puesto fijo de venta de lunes a sábado en horario del día. Debido al clima del lugar las bebidas tienen gran demanda; ella se ocupa de comprar hielo diariamente para refrigerar sus gaseosas en una conservadora a la vista de sus clientes, “el hielo se derrite rápidamente y los clientes exigen que la bebida este refrigerada, los gastos en la compra de hielo son constantes...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que debido al clima cálido del lugar la venta es constante durante todo el día, la desventaja son los gastos en hielo que debe realizar para poder vender. Su sueño es abrir una agencia distribuidora de gaseosas para vender por mayor y menor. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un refrigerador, donde pueda almacenar sus productos para que estos se conserven fríos para satisfacción del cliente y ahorraría en la compra de hielo, tiempo y dinero. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en cuatro años de experiencia en el negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Ruthi solicita un préstamo para comprar una congeladora para dejar de comprar hielo y reducir sus gastos.
texts.en:
Ruthi is a 48-year-old woman, lives with her partner, and has three children of 27, 23, and 14 years of age. Her business is the sale of soft drinks. She is a good mother, enterprising, respectful, patient, responsible, and very hardworking. She develops her business in the "Plan 3000" area that is characterized by the origins of its inhabitants: Aymaras, Quechuas, and Guaraní, where they settled and formed a great commerce; it is of a warm, tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade. 

Ruthi is dark-skinned, brown-eyed, with short, black hair, and of small stature and medium body shape. Her mother tongue is Spanish and she speaks Quechua because of her family's heritage (she is in front, dressed in a tank top with yellow and orange horizontal lines). She makes her life with her partner, who is in construction, and her two younger sons; the oldest is already independent. They live in a rented home, built of brick, with potable water, electricity, and sewage.

Her will to improve brought her to form a communal bank of people with businesses such as video store, sandwiches sale, plaster artworks, soft drinks sale, library, cosmetics sale, welding workshop, and china, fruit, and breakfast sales so that they could request loans and improve their occupations. Her business is the sale of soft drinks, an occupation she does in a fixed sale stall Monday thru Saturday during the day. Due to the climate of the place, the drinks are in great demand. She buys ice daily to refrigerate her soft drinks in a cooler at her customers' full view. "The ice melts fast and the customers demand the drink to be cold. The expenses in the purchase of ice are constant...", she says. Her business's advantage is that, because of the warm climate of the place, sale is continuous all day; the disadvantage is the ice expenses that she must pay to be able to sell. 

Her dream is to open a soft drink distribution agency to sell at wholesale and retail. She wishes to expand her business by the purchase of a freezer where she could store her products so that they remain cold for the customer's satisfaction. She would save in ice purchase, time, and money. This is the 4th sequence of loans with the institution in 4 years of experience in this business.

It is by these reasons that Ruthi is requesting a loan to buy a freezer to stop buying ice and reduce her expenses.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to stop buying ice and reduce her expenses.

loans.name: Marde

texts.en:
Marde engages in a mineral water vending business. She buys and at the same time sells mineral water in her place.  She is a 38-year-old married woman with five children from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 12 and the youngest is 3.

She is asking for a loan to buy pigs and as additional capital for her mineral water business. This will help Marde and her family to raise and sell healthy hogs. She will now be able to purchase more supplies of mineral water. Thus, she will now be able to provide her family with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

Marde would be grateful if both her businesses could be sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy pigs and as additional capital for her mineral water business

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Amanecer está integrado por 15 mujeres, todas ellas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que están poniendo todo de sí para una mejor calidad de vida. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están luchando y esforzándose cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silvia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando poco a poco a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y  por medio de la venta ambulante que hace, tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Silvia pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas, artículos de bazar, y calzados, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar y ayudar a sus seres queridos con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Amanecer Group is made up of 15 very hardworking and enterprising women who are giving their all for a better quality of life.  They're in the "Poverty Stoplight" program, in which they all strive and work hard every day.

One of the members is Silvia, who had a poverty level of two in her last survey.  This means she has improved little by little through her effort, constant work, and sales as a street vendor.  She has the means to be able to help her loved ones.

Silvia's requesting this loan so she can buy garments, household items, and footwear.  That way she'll be able to keep working and making sales.

She's grateful for this opportunity to improve and help her loved ones with her job.

loans.use: to buy garments, household items, and footwear to sell

loans.name: José Simón

texts.es:
José, de 67 años de edad, es agricultor en pequeño, anteriormente estuvo acompañado pero por motivos personales se separó de su compañera de vida, actualmente está soltero y tiene cinco hijos.
