José, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace cinco años, esto lo aprendió de su padre, porque se dedica a la agricultura desde siempre, también se dedica a realizar trabajos extras como por ejemplo ir a cortar leña cuando alguien lo ocupa.- El terreno donde va a cultivar está a 15 minutos de su casa, sus hijos mayores le ayudan.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar abono, semilla, pesticidas y herbicidas, porque se acerca la época de sembrar y tienen que preparar la tierra con mucho tiempo de anticipación.

José, sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 67, is a small farmer. He was married before but separated from his wife. Now he is single and has five children.

Jose has been a farmer since he was 5 years old, when he learned it from his father. Although he has always been a farmer, he also does side jobs like cutting firewood when someone hires him. The land where he farms is 15 minutes from his home, and his older children help him out.

He asks for this loan to buy manure, seeds, pesticides and herbicides because planting season is coming and they need to prepare the land ahead of time.

Jose dreams of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: José Feliciano

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, estudio 4° grado, es casado y padre de 2 hijos los cuales son independientes y viven a parte, en su casa solo vive él con su esposa.

José se dedica a la agricultura  desde hace 35 años, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y luego él se independizó, trabaja en una parcela cerca de su casa y su esposa le ayuda con los oficios del hogar.

Él  necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de granos básicos y para pagar mano de obra para la siembra.

Sus sueños son obtener un crédito más grande para comprar y ampliar su parcela para mejorar sus cultivos y así también sus ganancias, y darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, 54, studied until the 4th grade. He is married and a father of two children who are grown and live on their own. Only he and his wife live in their home.

Jose has been a farmer for 35 years, a skill he learned from his parents and later began to practice independently. He works on a parcel of land near his home, and his wife takes care of their home.

He needs a loan to buy fertilizers and pay laborers to plant his crop of basic grains. His dreams are to get a bigger loan so that he can buy more land and improve his crops and therefore his profits, and to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay laborers to plant his crop of basic grains.

loans.name: Juana Alicia

texts.es:
A sus sesenta y nueve años de edad, Juana, es una mujer llena de energía para los negocios, hace un par de años, ella tuvo la iniciativa de crear una pequeña pulpería, que le ayudase a generar ingresos extras para su hogar. Con el apoyo de su hija y de su esposo ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio, el cual se ha vuelto más rentable y estable con el pasar del tiempo. 
Ahora ella está decidida a crecer y ofrecer más productos, es por eso que ha solicitado un préstamo a Kiva y MiCrédito, con el cual podra comprar granos básicos, comida enlatada, detergente, jabón, shampoo, entre otros. Juana tiene un gran espíritu emprendedor, su meta es poder convertir su pulpería en un minisúper, que logre abastecer a toda su comunidad.
texts.en:
At sixty-nine years old, Juana is full of energy.  A few years ago, she took the initiative to create a small grocery store to generate extra income to cover the household expenses. She was able to launch her business with the support of her daughter and her husband. It became more profitable and stable over time.

She is determined to grow and offer more products. She requests a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito to buy basic grains, canned food, detergent, soap, shampoo etc. Juana has a great entrepreneurial spirit. Her goal is to turn her grocery store into a convenience store that serves the entire community.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, canned food, detergent, soap, shampoo etc.

loans.name: Nancy Inés

texts.es: Nancy de 40 años de edad, es una mujer dedica al comercio hace 15 años, ella ofrece prendas de vestir y calzado, alterno a esta actividad tiene servicio de fotocopiadora, minutos a celular, refrescos y golosinas.  Pese a las adversidades esta luchadora mujer en compañía de sus tres hijas de 12, 13 y 17 años y su hijo varón de 6 años edad, quienes fueron desplazados por el conflicto armado en nuestro país, se trasladaron al municipio de Soledad en el Atlántico. Hoy en día Nancy trabaja desde su vivienda en un barrio de éste municipio para solventar económicamente a su familia, negocio que inició con sus ahorros, sin embargo su gran desafío ha sido el escaso capital con el que cuenta, razón por la que sus compras las genera una parte de contado y otra a crédito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con la finalidad de invertir en ropa y calzado, así mismo comprará dulces y golosinas para surtir el negocio.  Nancy considera que esta inversión le ofrecerá mejores ganancias y con ello mejorará su flujo de caja.  Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo, por eso dedica gran parte del día a atender en su  negocio, ella desea a largo plazo tener un local acondicionado y su meta familiar es continuar educando a sus hijos y ofrecerles bienestar.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 40 year old woman who has been engaged in trade for 15 years. She offers clothing and footwear. Additionally, she has a photocopy service, and sells cellular minutes, soft drinks, and candy.

Despite adversity, this tenacious woman has three daughters of ages 12, 13, and 17 years and a 6 year old son. They were displaced by the armed conflict in their country and moved to the town of Soledad on the Atlantic.

Today, Nancy works from her home in a suburb of this city to solve financial needs of the family. She started her business with her savings, however her biggest challenge has been the limited capital she is working with. Some store purchases are paid with cash and others with credit.

Currently she is applying for a loan through Kiva, her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in clothing and footwear. Additionally, she will buy sweets and treats to stock up her business.

Nancy believes that this investment will provide better returns and thus improve her cash flow. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her work, therefore she spends much of the day attending to the business. Long term, she wants to have an air conditioned establishment and her family goal is to continue educating her children and offer them well being.

loans.use: to invest in clothing and footwear, and also buy sweets and treats to stock up the business.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 28-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. 

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw). This rickshaw is driven over local roads and for short distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not enough strong to bear the jarring from the roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles during driving. This is the reason her husband wants to buy a new body for his moto rickshaw.

Nasira has requested a loan so that her husband can buy the rickshaw body and drive smoothly. Nasira thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
A warm gratitude to you who have generously lent a loan to Milagros recently!  The loan of 8,000 PHP was truly a great help for her business and for her daily living expenses. To further pursue her business, she is requesting another 8,000 PHP to purchase more merchandise products for her inventory. Through this, she can have a chance to improve her earnings. 

She is always praying that her family will be in good condition and that they will experience someday a more affordable kind of living. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise products for her inventory.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is a 36-year-old married man from Deir Albalah city. He lives with his wife in a simple house. He works in the public sector, where he earns a low income, which is not enough to meet all of his family expenses. Muhammad requested a 1,400 USD loan from FATEN, to buy a solar system which will allow him to get hot water without any cost, and reduce his electricity expenses. Muhammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, un señor de 47 años de edad, muestra mucha capacidad de trabajo y ánimos para superar diferentes problemas que le surjan en su familia, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar,  en su hogar todos dependen de él.


Efraín es jornalero desde toda su vida, ese siempre ha sido su oficio que aprendió por iniciativa propia y por la necesidad que había, también trabaja de auxiliar de albañil, los recorridos que hace desde su casa hasta donde le surgen los trabajos no los puede describir ya que es una distancia bastante considerable y sus hijos son quienes se involucran a ayudarle.

Él solicita este crédito para pagar el arrendamiento de la tierra donde cultivará y pagar mano de obra.

Su sueño es tener su propio terreno para poder trabajar en las actividades agrícolas, ampliar su casa y darles lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Efraín is 47 years old and shows great work skills and drive to overcome any problem that arises in his family. His partner takes care of the household chores and his family depends on him.

Efraín has been a laborer all his life. He learned the trade proactively on his own. He also works on bricklayer reinforcement. The route from his house to the work is considerably far and his children are helping him.

He requested a loan to pay the lease on the farm land and to pay for the manual labor. He hopes to have his own farm land, expand his house and provide for his family

loans.use: to pay the lease on the farm land and to pay for the manual labor.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José, de 42 años de edad, es agricultor, solo estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 4 hijos, todos están estudiando.

José, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad, este trabajo lo aprendió de su papá; pero también se dedica a la albañilería, cuando lo buscan para trabajar como albañil, busca otras personas que le trabajen en la agricultura mientras él trabaja de albañil, ya que ese trabajo le genera más ingresos, su lugar de trabajo está a una distancia de 20 minutos y viaja en una bicicleta para llegar más rápido; su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 11:00 a.m. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno para sembrar, ya que la persona que se los alquila necesita el dinero y él quiere quedarse con ese terreno, para continuar cultivándolo, porque es una tierra muy fértil.

José, tiene mucha fe en Dios y espera que está cosecha sea muy buena.
texts.en: José is 42 years old. He is a farmer and only studied through second grade. He is accompanied by his partner who works at home as a housewife. He has 4 children, all of them are studying. Jose works in agriculture since he was 15 years old. He learned this trade fro his father, but he also works  as a mason. When they look for him to work as a mason, he then looks for people to work in the farm while he is working as a mason, because masonry generates more income. His work site is approximately 20 minutes away and he rides a bicycle to get there quicker. His work schedule is 6:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m. The loan he is requesting is to purchase 14,000 m2 of land to sow, because the person that currently rents this land needs the funds and he wants to keep the field to continue working it. It is a very fertile piece of land. Jose has a lot of faith in God, and he hopes that the harvest will be a very good one.

loans.use: To purchase 14,000 m2 of land to sow.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa vit à attiégou et est âgée de 25 ans. Mariée, Adjowa est mère de deux enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser son éducation. Adjowa vend des nattes dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu nécessaire pour leur subsistance. Adjowa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des tas de nattes, Adjowa demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité.
texts.en:
Adjowa lives in Attiegou and is 25 years old. She is the married mother of two children and endeavors to support their education with dynamism.

Adjowa sells mats in her neighborhood and the surrounding area to generate the income needed for their subsistence. She stocks up once a month at the market.

Adjowa is requesting this loan to so she can order and purchase a large quantity of mats and thereby ensure profitability.

loans.use: buy seven piles of mats

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is 35 years old and lives in Zarqa, Jordan.  She is married with four children, and is a conservative woman and asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Muna wants to meet the needs of her children, and be able to cover the education that will allow them to be successful people in the future.  All of this depends on the financial situation for her family, so Muna has started selling items from her home, including blankets to her neighbors and her family.  Lately her husband has been facing financial problems because of the increase in the standard of living, therefore she decided to expand her work to increase her income.

Muna needs your support and has requested a loan to help her buy more products and blankets to sell.  This will allow her to help her husband.

loans.use: to help her buy more products and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Anicette

texts.fr: Agée de 49 ans, Anicette est une femme veuve qui vit à Lomé. Mère de trois enfants, Anicette vend des friperies dans son quartier et réaliser un bon revenu grâce à son activité pour aider ses enfants. Anicette s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des habits et des slips, Anicette demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
49-year-old Anicette is a widow who lives in Lome. Mother of three children, she sells used clothes in her neighborhood and generates enough income through her activity to help her children.

Anicette stocks up twice a month at the market. To order dresses and slips, she is requesting this loan so she can meet her goal of generating good profit margins, and thereby ensure her children's education.

loans.use: buy 220 dresses and 160 slips

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 29-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income which is barely enough to cover all the family needs.
 
Osama has taken out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house, and to provide hot water without using electricity.
 
Osama appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel de 34 años de edad, estudió 5° grado, se casó pero luego de un tiempo siendo padre de un niño decidieron separarse, el niño tiene 3 años de edad y se quedó con él, Fidel vive en casa de su madre con su hijo y la apoya con los gastos del hogar.

Fidel trabaja de motorista desde hace 2 años en un pickup transportando gente desde un cantón a la ciudad, también se dedica a la venta de lácteos negocio que tiene su hermano cerca de su casa, y su madre cuida de su hijo mientras él sale a trabajar.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y pagar mano de obra para mejorar su vivienda.

Su sueño es tener un crédito más grande y así levantar su propio negocio ya que por el momento está asociado con su hermano y así obtener mejores ganancias y darles a su madre y su hijo mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Fidel is 34 years old, studied up to the 5th grade, got married, but a while after having a son, they decided to separate. The son is 3 years old and he stayed with him. Fidel lives in his mother's house with his son and he helps her with the household expenses.

Fidel has worked for the last two years as a pickup truck driver transporting people from a canton to the city. He also makes a living selling dairy in his brother's business near his house. And his mother takes care of his son while he goes out to work.

He needs the loan to buy construction materials and to pay for labor to improve his home.

His dream is to have more credit and use it to boost his own business since he currently is associated with his brother and in that way obtain better earnings and give  his mother and his son better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor to improve his home.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Thirty-eight year old Rebecca engages in selling ube (purple yam).  Aside from that, she also raises hogs. She is a 38-year-old married woman with three dependents who are 16, 14 and 12 years old, respectively. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. During planting season, Rebecca also toils the land and grows rice.

She is asking for a loan to buy farm materials like a sprayer, supplies for ube (purple yam) and an additional pig. With these, Rebecca's livelihood will increase and she will be able to improve her income, thus, providing her family with good food and a better shelter for living.

With the additional capital, Rebecca would like to expand her business and to become more productive and successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy farm materials like a sprayer, supplies for ube (purple yam) and an  additional pig

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 29 ans et mère de trois enfants. Kossiwa vit à Lomé pour entreprendre son activité. Kossiwa vend des produits d’alimentations générales pour gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Kossiwa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Kossiwa demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de riz et des cartons de détergents afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants
texts.en:
Kossiwa is a 29-year-old married mother of three children. She lives in Lome where she runs her business.

Kossiwa sells general supply products to earn a living and support her family. She stocks up three times a month at the market.

Kossiwa is requesting this loan to buy sacks of rice and cartons of detergent to make a profit, so she can support her husband with family expenses and ensure a good education for her children

loans.use: buy two bags of rice and five cartons of detergent

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Bunthoeun is a 25-year-old single rice farmer and blacksmith, and he resides in Kandal Province in Cambodia. He has been cultivating rice since 1999, making approximately $7 per day. 

Bunthoeun lacks the money to buy fish for his sister to sell at the market, and therefore he needs a loan. With this loan, he will have enough money to help his sister to buy fish to sell. In the future, he will be able to help her to sell the fish in the city.

loans.use: to buy fish for his sister to sell at the market

loans.name: Joudi

texts.en:
Joudi is a 25-year-old married woman living with her husband and one child, who is school-aged.  

Joudi decided in 2009 to open her own communication shop where she puts up for sale cellular phones, related accessories and rechargeable cards.

With her requested youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., she will increase her merchandise selection of new mobile phones and accessories with the intention of increasing her sales, and therefore her income.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise selection of new mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 56 ans, Afi est une femme veuve qui vit à Lomé avec cinq enfants à sa charge. Dans son quartier, Afi vend des céréales à ses clients et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Afi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Afi demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs et de farine de manioc afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour soutenir  les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
56-year-old Afi is a widow who lives in Lome with five dependent children. Afi sells grain to customers from her neighborhood and generates her income through this activity.

To effectively meet her needs, Afi stocks up once a month at the market. She is requesting this loan to order bags of maize and cassava flour, so she can achieve even more income in support of the family's daily expenditures.

loans.use: buy two bags of maize and two bags of cassava flour

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 26-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children, who are still attending school. In 2013, she opened a small minimarket in her town with the aim to pay her everyday expenses with the income that she earns from her business. Her husband is the main income provider in the family and they cooperate together in order to secure a good lifestyle for her children. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy a refrigerator. Her goal is to increase her sales and her income by a good percentage.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Tayaba

texts.en:
Tayaba is the age of 32, living with her four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a mobile shop for many years and generating income for his family. He troubleshoots the mobiles; he sells the mobile accessories such as charger, body, data cable, etc. and provide recharge facilities for different networks. 
 
Nowadays, there is a lot of demand for accessories and for recharging. Sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into the business because he has spent his all income on household expenses. 

Therefore, Tayaba requested a loan for her husband so that he can be empowered to buy additional accessories and extra credit for recharge facility. 

Tayaba thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's mobile shop

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar, 33 years old, is from Baniswef. She is married with two children and her husband is a part-time farmer and has no constant income. Due to the increase in prices and the family's monthly expenses, Sahar decided to help her husband with the family income by fattening cattle in a place in her house and use its milk to make cheese and to sell. Her small project became very successful and she requested another 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy another head of cattle to expand her project and increase her income for her family.

loans.use: To buy another head of cattle.

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en:
Zulfiyya is 49 years old. She is a widow and has a child who is an 18-year-old boy. They are living in the Fuzuli region but the family members are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. 

This store was opened by Zulfiyya and her sister. Today Zulfiyya wants to support the business and for that she needs a loan in the amount of 1,700 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this amount, she wants to buy more goods to sell (shampoo, socks, perfume, etc.) in order to develop her business and increase her monthly income. 

Zulfiyya wishes for the best for her child and she works hard. Ilaha says, “Thanks, dear Kiva lenders, for your support. I’m greatly thankful to you.”

loans.use: to buy more goods and increase monthly income, so that in the future she can repair her store.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
José, de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tienen 2 hijos, de los cuales uno vive con él y el otro está estudiando. 

José, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad, este trabajo lo aprendió de su papá ya que desde pequeño le enseño, para que en el futuro pudiera tener una fuente de ingresos, para llegar hasta donde tiene sus cultivos camina 25 minutos y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a  11:00 p.m. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y pagar mano de obra, para preparar la tierra donde sembrará; quiere aprovechar a comprar los insumos porque ha encontrado un lugar en donde los están vendiendo más baratos, además les dará trabajo a 4 personas para que le ayuden a cortar la maleza, para terminar más rápido y ahorra tiempo.

Los sueños que tiene José, son seguir trabajando en la tierra, obtener mejores cosechas y aumentar la producción de granos básicos.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old, he was in school until second grade. He is married and his partner dedicates herself to the household chores. They have two children, of which one lives with him and the other is studying. 

José has made a living in agriculture since he was 15 years old. He learned this work from his father since he taught him from a young age so that he would have a source of income in the future. To get to where he has his plants, he walks 25 minutes and his work schedule is from 6am to 11pm.

The loan that he is asking for from CREDICAMPO is to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for labor to prepare the land where he will plant. He wants to capitalize on buying the inputs because he found a place where they are selling them for cheaper. In addition, he will give work to four people so that they can help him to cut down the weeds to finish more quickly and save time.

José's dreams are to continue working the land, obtain better harvest, and increase his production of basic grains.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for labor to prepare the land where he will plant.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, 42, is divorced with five children. She makes shoes and knits traditional fabric. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fabric for her designs and to buy leather soles for her traditional shoes. 

She aspires to own a shop in a busy area of the town rather than sell from her house as she currently does.

loans.use: to buy fabric and leather soles.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 27-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife and one kid in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.
 
Khaled took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity.
 
Khaled appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is living in Tafileh and he is a single, young, and ambitious guy. After he graduated from university, he searched for a job, but he could not find a good job. Mohammad started his own business after he did not find a job: a shop to roast coffee and sell it in the center of his town.

After that, he was able to buy a car and to build a small house. He said, “I love my business, now I am 28 years old and I have my own house from my income.” Then he expanded his shop to add a new field to his business: food supplies.

Mohammad is thinking about developing his business; therefore, he decided to apply for a loan to buy more kinds of products and supplies to raise the quality of his work and to produce new kinds of coffee. Mohammad`s plans is to open a new branch of his business to increase his income even more.

loans.use: to buy more products and supplies and to produce new kinds of coffee.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto es un joven emprendedor de 21 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, está soltero y vive con su madre y dos hermanas.

Roberto se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde hace 10 años, también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y la parcela donde trabaja está cerca de su casa.

Roberto necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para la siembra de granos básicos ya que estamos en la temporada de siembra.

Su sueño es obtener un crédito más grande y así  poder mejorar el negocio del ganado e incrementar sus ganancias para darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto is a young, 21-year old entrepreneur. He studied until the 9th grade. He is single and lives with his mother and two sisters.

Roberto has made a living working in agriculture for 10 years. He also makes a living buying and selling livestock, and the plot where he works is close to his house.

Roberto needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs to plant basic grains now that we are in the planting season.

His dream is to have more credit and use it to improve the livestock business and increase his earnings to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to plant basic grains now that it is planting season.

loans.name: Sépopo

texts.fr: Sépopo est âgée de 28 ans et vit à Lomé. Mariée, Sépopo a quatre enfants à sa charge et travaille dynamiquement pour leur permettre une bonne condition de vie. Sépopo vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans sa boutique afin de réaliser une bonne marge de bénéfice. Sépopo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Pour commander des cartons de spaghettis et de tomates, Sépopo demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et gagner un profit pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Sepopo is 28 years old and lives in Lome. She is married with four dependent children and works dynamically to ensure they have good living conditions.

Sepopo sells general supply products in her shop to achieve good profit margins. Sépopo stocks up twice a month at the market in Lome.

Sepopo is requesting this loan to order boxes of spaghetti and tomatoes, so she can meet her target of making enough profit to promote her children's education.

loans.use: buy seven boxes of spaghetti and five cartons of tomatoes

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée qui vit à Lomé avec trois enfants. Abla est âgée de 40 ans  et œuvre activement pour apporter sa contribution à l’épanouissement de sa famille. Abla vend des pagnes dans sa localité et grâce à son petit commerce, elle trouve une épargne pour favoriser son mari à subvenir aux charges de la famille. Abla s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Dans le but de réaliser plus de bénéfice, Abla veut commander des pagnes et demande ce crédit pour atteindre ses objectifs
texts.en:
Abla is a married woman who lives in Lome with three children. She is 40 years old and works actively so she can contribute to her family's development.

Abla sells pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) in her district, and thanks to her business is able to save enough to help her husband deal with family expenses. She stocks up twice a month at the market.

To make more profit, Abla wants to order pagnes and is requesting this loan to achieve her objectives.

loans.use: buy six lengths of pagne (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Silvia Susana

texts.es:
Silvia de 37 años de edad, no tuvo muchas oportunidades para  estudiar y superarse, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en una funeraria, tiene 6 hijos y es por ellos que se esfuerza día a día para ayudarles a superarse pues 4 de ellos están en la escuela.

Para solventar las necesidades familiares, desde muy pequeña Silvia se dedica a diferentes actividades productivas como lavar y planchar ajeno y eso  le genera aunque sea un poco de ingresos económicos. Desde muy temprano se levanta para preparar a sus hijos y darles un pequeño desayuno para después luego comenzar con otras labores cotidianas.

Ella utilizará su crédito para comprar doscientos pollos, cinco quintales de concentrado y vitaminas ya que iniciará su negocio de avicultura.

Silvia espera que su negocio funcione y le permita obtener buenas ganancias para contribuir al desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia, 37, did not have many opportunities to study and improve her situation.  She is married and her husband works at a funeral home.  They have six children and Silvia works hard day after day to help them, since four are still in school.

In order to cover the family needs Silvia has worked from a very young age in different jobs, such as doing laundry and ironing for others.  This generates some income, but only a little.  She gets up very early in the morning to prepare breakfast for her children and then she starts her daily routine.

She will use the loan to buy 200 chickens, five quintals of animal feed and vitamins to start a poultry business.  Silvia hopes the business works out so she can earn a good profit and contribute to her family's development.

loans.use: To buy 200 chickens, five quintals of animal feed and vitamins to start her poultry business.

loans.name: Laïna

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans, Laïna est une femme mariée et vit à Tokoin avec ses quatre enfants. Laïna vend des poissons frits en se promenant dans le quartier et avoir un revenu pour leur survie. Laïna s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Laïna demande ce crédit pour acheter des cartons de poissons et des bidons d’huile pour faire ses frits afin de satisfaire ses clients. Laïna compte tirer du profit et venir en aide aux enfants dans les charges quotidiennes.
texts.en:
31-year-old Laina is married and lives in Tokoin with her four children.

Laina sells fried fish while walking through the neighborhood so she can generate income for her subsistence. Laïna stocks up twice a month at the market.

Laina is requesting this loan so she can buy cartons of fish and cans of culinary oil to fry them, to satisfy her customers.

Laina hopes to make enough profit to help her children deal with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy two cartons of fish and two containers of culinary oil

loans.name: Mario Alexander

texts.es:
Mario es un joven muy trabajador de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, pero él nunca descarta la posibilidad de seguir estudiando en la universidad y terminar una carrera, pues sus sueños no los ha logrado debido  a la falta de recursos económicos, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos en una casa, ellos son padres de 1 hija de 2 años de edad y en su vivienda solo viven su esposa, su hija y son las únicas personas que dependen de él.

Mario se dedica a la albañilería, su jornada empieza muy temprano a las 5:00 de la mañana, luego sale en bicicleta a su trabajo que le toma media hora para llegar, termina sus labores a las 3 de la tarde, además se dedica a la agricultura como lo es siembra de maíz y frijol, pues es otra fuente de ingresos para él.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes, 6 sacos de abono, y pagará mano de obra, gracias al financiamiento obtendrá mejores cultivos y esto le permitirá estar abastecido de alimentos.

Él desea seguir estudiando y terminar una carrera universitaria para optar  por mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Mario, 23, is a very hard-working young man who has a high school education.  He never abandoned the idea of going on to college and getting a university degree but could not realize his dreams due to a lack of resources.  His partner cares for the home and they have a 2-year-old daughter.  The three of them live alone, so his wife and daughter are his only dependents.

Mario works as a bricklayer and starts his day at 5:00 a.m.  He takes a bicycle to work and travels half an hour to get there.  He finishes at 3:00 p.m.  He also works in agriculture growing corn and beans to earn extra income.

This loan is to buy fertilizers, six sacks of manure and to pay labor costs.  Thanks to the loan he will grow better crops and have an abundant food supply.

He wants to continue his education and get a degree in order to seek better opportunities in life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, six sacks of manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: A 38 ans, Yvette est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Yvette vit dans le quartier de Tokoin. Yvette est une marchande ambulante qui des papiers d’hygiène et des couches pour enfant dans son quartier. Yvette s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché local du quartier. Yvette nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des papiers d’hygiène pour gagner plus de bénéfice et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
38-year-old Yvette is a married woman and the mother of three children. She lives in the Tokoin neighborhood.

Yvette is a street vendor who sells toilet paper and diapers in her neighborhood. She stocks up five times a month at the local neighborhood market.

Yvette is requesting this loan to buy toilet paper so she can make more profit and help with her children's education.

loans.use: buy three dozen rolls of toilet paper and three dozen diapers

loans.name: Frederman

texts.es:
Frederman en un pequeño productor de café en el departamento de Jinotega, Nicaragua. Su finca es de 23.1 hectáreas de las cuales 3.15 son de café. En los últimos años Frederman ha logrado cosechar un promedio de 150 quintales de café pergamino. 

Para este año, está solicitando un financiamiento para garantizar la mano de obra y la compra de insumos y materiales que le permita tener bajo control las plagas y enfermedades en las áreas de café cosechero que tiene actualmente. Con la implementación de estas actividades, logrará garantizar y mejorar la producción en este ciclo, y hacer frente a la inestabilidad en el mercado de café, lo cual también ha enfrentado al estar certificado bajo el sello comercio justo.

La visión de este emprendedor, es duplicar el área de café en su finca de manera gradual, a fin de incrementar los ingresos y por ende las condiciones económicas de su familia, aprovechando las condiciones favorables que tiene su finca para la producción de este rubro.
texts.en:
Frederman is a small coffee producer in the department of Jinotega, Nicaragua.  He has a 23.1 hectare farm, of which 3.15 hectares are coffee.  In the last few years Frederman has been able to produce an average 150 quintals of "pergamino" coffee.

This year he is requesting a loan to guarantee labor and the purchase of supplies and materials to manage pest control and disease in his coffee crop.  By doing this he will guarantee a better production cycle and be able to take on the challenge of instability in the coffee market, since he is certified with the FAIRTRADE seal.

This entrepreneur's vision is to double his coffee plantation gradually in order to increase his income and improve his family's economic conditions.  He wants to take advantage of the favorable conditions of his farm for production in this sector.

loans.use: To guarantee supplies and labor for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 97 ans, Afi est une femme veuve qui vit à Lomé cinq de ses enfants à sa charge. Dans son quartier, Afi vend du miel à ses clients et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Afi demande ce crédit pour commander un bidon de miel afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour soutenir  les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
97-year-old Afi is a widow who lives in Lome with five of her children under her care.

Afi sells honey to customers in her neighborhood and generates her income through this business. To effectively meet customers' needs, she stocks up twice a month at the market.

Afi is requesting this loan to order a container of honey so she can generate even more income in support of the family's daily expenditures.

loans.use: buy one container of honey

loans.name: Deyanira Lizeth

texts.es: Deyanira de 25 años de edad, domiciliada en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad donde funciona su negocio de venta de gaseosas, cervezas y refrigerios,  es una joven que gracias a su carisma, dedicación y empeño, logró que su madre le dejara a cargo éste negocio familiar, el cual ha logrado mantener por ofrecer un excelente servicio.  Sus ventas las genera de contado, lo que beneficia el flujo de caja, su horario de atención es muy amplio de lunes a domingo de 10 a.m. a 10 p.m., sus compras las realiza de contado, sin embargo sus proveedores le ofrece otras alternativas de pago.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual invertirá en canastas de cervezas y gaseosas. Esta inversión promete mejorar los inventarios y tener a disposición para su venta. Deyanira desea mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una casa, así mismo mejorar la imagen del negocio y tener mayores fuentes de financiación.
texts.en:
Deyanira, 25, lives in a neighborhood of the town of Soledad where she runs a business selling soda, beer and refreshments.  She is a young woman who, thanks to her charisma, dedication and drive, has allowed her mother to retire from the family business which is still running because of the excellent service it provides.

Sales are conducted in cash which benefits cash flow.  Opening hours are from 10:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  Purchases are made in cash but some suppliers give her alternative payment terms.  She is currently applying for a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy crates of beer and soda.  This investment will allow her to improve inventory and have more goods on hand.  

Deyanira wishes to improve her quality of life and have a house.  She also wants to improve her company image and have more financial sources.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr: Abiba est une femme veuve qui est âgée de 43 ans. Mère de deux enfants, Abiba habite à Nyékonakpoè pour exercer ses activités. Abiba est très dynamique et pour aider sa famille, elle vend de l’huile et du riz dans son quartier afin de trouver son bénéfice. Abiba s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile, Abiba sollicite ce prêt pour financer son achat et trouver assez de profits et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants et permettre leur éducation.
texts.en:
Abiba is 43 years old, widowed and mother to two children.  She lives and works in Nyékonakpoè.  Abiba is a very dynamic woman who sells oil and rice in order to make a living.  

She buys new supplies six times a month from the market.  This loan will pay for her supplies and help her make enough profit to provide for her children and ensure their education.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of rice and 2 drums of oil for resale.

loans.name: Souzane

texts.fr: Souzane vit dans la ville de Lomé et est âgée de 58 ans. Mariée, Souzane est mère de quatre enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Souzane vend des tubercules dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu nécessaire pour leur subsistance. Souzane s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des calebasses d’ignames, Souzane demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité.
texts.en:
Souzane is 58 years old, married and mother to four children.  She lives in the town of Lomé and works hard to provide for the education of her children.

Souzane sells root vegetables in her local area to earn her living.  She buys new supplies twice a month from the market.  She has requested this loan to order more yams and improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy 2 quantities of yams for resale.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou vit à Lomé et est âgée de 54 ans. Mariée, Akou est mère de quatre enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Akou vend des friperies dans son quartier pour avoir son revenu nécessaire pour leur subsistance. Akou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des habits, des soutiens et des draps, Akou demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité afin de permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akou lives in Lomé and is 54 years old. She is the married mother of four children and with dynamism endeavours to support their education.

Akou sells used clothing in her neighborhood to generate the income needed for their subsistence. She stocks up twice a month at the market.

Akou is requesting this loan to order and buy dresses, bras and bedsheets, so that the profits will ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: buy 50 dresses, 60 bras and 40 bedsheets

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 15.4 hectáreas de las cuales 5.6 son de café. En los últimos años ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 250 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales produce bajo los procesos de certificación de comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices.

Uno de los mayores retos que enfrenta este productor en su finca es el control de las plagas y enfermedades del café, tales como la antracnosis la cual provoca manchas en las hojas y frutos.  

Para garantizar un plan de manejo integrado de plagas y enfermedades en sus plantaciones, este pequeño productor está solicitando para este ciclo un financiamiento que le permita la adquisición de insumos y fertilizantes para el manejo agronómico del café, lo cual le permitirá además incrementar la producción en un 20%. Todo esto derivará en mejores ingresos para alcanzar la sostenibilidad y reinversión en su finca.
texts.en:
Julio is a producer in the northern part of Nicaragua.  He has a 15.4 hectare farm, of which 5.6 hectares are coffee.  Over the last few years he has been able to harvest around 250 quintals of "pergamino" coffee which he produces under processes certified by FAIRTRADE, UTZ and C.A.F.E. PRACTICES.

One of the greatest challenges of this producer is plague control and plant disease, like antracnosis which causes spots on the leaves and beans.

To guarantee a management plan for disease and pest control on his plantations, this small producer is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crop.  This will allow him to increase production by 20%, which will improve income to put toward sustainability and reinvestment in his farm.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers for his coffee crop to produce a good harvest.

loans.name: Bendictor

texts.en:
Speaking with Bendictor, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Nandihills, along with a handsome husband and their one angelic looking child. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. 

She has been doing agriculture for 14 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity. 

Bendictor is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. 

This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Bendictor and her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, to improve soil fertility and thus for better yield.

loans.name: Rodina

texts.en:
Rodina is 37 years old. She is from Coron, Palawan- a very far place from the capital of the archipelago. She is married to Jose, a farmer and they have five children. Life where they live is not that easy but they strive to survive every day through farming and through a sari-sari store, which Rodina operates. 

Variety stores in the Philippines are commonly known as Sari-sari stores. Stores like these are smaller versions of convenience stores and are usually seen in nearby houses. People buy here toiletries, beverages, packed foods and other grocery items at lower prices at retail. 

Rodina wants to broaden her business and you can be a part of putting what she dreams into realization. With a loan worth PHP 30,000, she can already buy goods and larger quantity of grocery items for her store. Through this, she can generate a bigger amount of income which will surely help her family for their expenses and needs. 

Sooner or later, she aspires of growing her business to be able to give her family a successful life.
Today, your small help can be a life to her. 

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy goods and a larger quantity of grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 45 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of four children. Her husband owns a shop for chicken sales in the market. He has been running his chicken shop for the last seven years. He buys chicken from the wholesaler and sells in his shop to his costumers. 

His number of clients increases due to his good attitude towards his clients. Moreover, he is the sole earner of his family. So he wants to increase his income. In this way he would be able to meet his family requirements. He is a very honest shop keeper. He behaves politely to people. He wants to buy broilers to sell in his chicken shop to improve his standard of living. 

For the development of his business, he needs a loan. So his wife, Khalida, contacted BRAC Pakistan who issued her a loan for her husband's shop.

 Khalida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens for her husband to sell in his chicken shop in the market.

loans.name: Hamdy

texts.en:
Hamdy is 36 years old from Baniswef. He is married and has 3 children. 

He previously requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on schedule . 

Now Hamdy wants to expand his café project to attract more customers.  He requested another 5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy a refrigerator and a large electric water kettle.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and a large electric water kettle for his cafe

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome has previously accessed a PHP 30,000 loan and it was a great help indeed in her business. She likes you to know the thankfulness in her heart as she was able to use the loan to purchase more products for her store.

This time, she would like again to take a loan worth PHP 35,000. With this, she can buy a greater quantity of grocery items for selling. 

Salome is hoping that through your kindness and generosity, she can expand her business and then gradually succeed in her chosen trade. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed to expand her business.

loans.name: ٌreem

texts.en:
Reem is 32 years old, lives in Irbid, and she is divorced, with one son.

After she divorced, she wanted to begin a new life and started thinking of her future and how she will be a successful woman and secure a good life for her child.

Reem started by buying a small quantity of clothes to sell from her home. She wants to depend on herself, without help from anybody. Actually she is very ambitious and will empower women.

Now Reem has requested this loan, so that she can buy more products to sell and that will help her to increase her income and ensure the best education for her only child. She needs your help to start her new life.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell and that will help to increase her income and pay for her child's education.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled could not complete his studies because of the financial situation of his family.  So he opened his business, which is a small restaurant.

He is a married man with four children and he is working hard to provide the best education and living for them. 

Khaled's family is getting bigger and thus his needs are increased.  As the income from his restaurant is not enough for his family, he decided to open another business, which is a shop to sell used furniture.

Now he is asking for a loan to buy supplies and products for his project.  That will help him to get more income and improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies and products for his new furniture shop, that will help him to have more income and improve the standard of living of his family

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon is a 46-year-old, married rice farmer, with three children.  She resides in a village in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over 14 years. Her husband is a factory worker, two of her children attend school and one of them is a factory worker. Together they can make approximately USD 11 per day. 

Sokhon would like to request a loan, because she needs finances to buy more groceries to sell. With this loan, she will be able to buy groceries to sell and improve her family’s income. 

In the future, she wants to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house and support her children to go to high school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, in order to improve her family's income.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than five years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her six children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide her children with a better education. 

To improve sales,Juditha would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 50,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future,Juditha hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 28-years-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Yousef took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity. 

Yousef appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water in the family house.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is 46 years old from the Khashuri district. He owns 1.1 hectare agricultural land, where he grows different kinds of vegetables. 

Paata wants to start a trading business and has requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 1500 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables to resell. He hopes that the trading business will significantly increase his income and will be able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to begin trading in fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 32-year-old married man, from a small village near Jenin city. He lives with his wife. He is the father of two sons and one daughter. 

He is a farmer, where he makes a small and unstable income. He has a problem in the provision of hot water for his family and also the electricity expenses. 

Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN, to buy a solar system, and thus will be able to get hot water without any cost.

Muhammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system, for the benefit of his family

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 29-year-old married man from Dier El-Balah city. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely cover all the family needs.
 
Khaled took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity. 

Khaled appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 31 years old from Minia. He is married and has two children.  He is financially responsible for his younger brother 

His blacksmith business is the only source of income for his family. 

Ahmad dreams of expanding his business, so he requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy equipment and tools for his work, such as hammers, anvils and a gas forge.

loans.use: To buy some equipment for his blacksmith work, such as hammers, anvils and a gas forge.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée et âgée 30 ans, Akossiwa vit à Soviépé. Mère de deux enfants, Akossiwa vend des assiettes en se promenant de quartier en quartier afin de gagner sa vie. Grâce à ce commerce, Akossiwa réalise un revenu et s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des assiettes, Akossiwa demande ce microcrédit pour financer son achat et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir favorablement aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: A 30-year-old married woman, Akossiwa lives in Soviépé. The mother of two children, Akossiwa is a street seller who sells plates by going district to district to earn her living. Thanks to this business, Akossiwa gets an income and she gets her supplies once a month at the market. Akossiwa is requesting this microloan in order to be able to finance an order for some plates, so that she can increase her profit margin and successfully meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy 6 dozen plates.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos de  44 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado en la escuela, no quiso continuar con sus estudios pues decidió dedicarse a trabajar para poder aportar ayuda económica a su casa, él está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen una niña de 10 años de edad la cual estudia en la escuela, y son dos personas las que dependen de él.

Carlos trabaja de albañil, es un trabajo que aprendió gracias a su padre que se dedica a lo mismo, él no tiene un trabajo fijo debido a que cuando termina la construcción en un lugar se va a otros lugares a trabajar, su horario de trabajo es de 6 de la mañana a  2 de la tarde y solo puede llegar a su casa los fines de semana. 

Carlos necesita este crédito para comprar 5 sacos de abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes y algunas herramientas que necesita para la siembra y pagará mano de obra.

Él sueña con superarse y seguir estudiando, le gustaría la carrera de arquitectura y además espera sacar adelante a su hija.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 years old. He went to school until eight grade and did not want to continue with school, because he decided to work to contribute to financially support his family. He is married and his wife is taking care of the household. They have a 10-year old daughter, who is in school. The two people depend on him.

Carlos works as a bricklayer. He learned this trade from his father, who made a living the same way. He does not have a permanent job. When he is finished with the construction in one place, he goes to the next place to work. His daily work schedule is from 6 a.m. until 2 p.m. and he is only able to come home on weekends.

Carlos needs this loan to buy five bags of manure, insecticides, fertilizer and some tools for sowing and to pay for labor.

He dreams of improving and continuing to study, he would like to be an architect and also hopes to give his daughter a better life.

loans.use: to buy five bags of manure, insecticides, fertilizer and some tools for sowing and to pay for labor

loans.name: Las Corazoncitos Group

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 23 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de almuerzo.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, de buena actitud, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Curubamba baja’ , a 14 kilómetros de la ciudad, donde tienen sus viviendas los agricultores que cultivan la tierra en el trópico y son usadas cuando sacan sus cosechas del trópico a comercializarlos en la ciudad. De clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-25 grados centígrados.
Lidia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la tercera de la derecha, viste mandil blanco/celeste y una blusa celeste). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. Sus deseos de superación para llevar una vida más satisfactoria la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; taller de costura, tejidos, venta de pescado, servicio de construcción, elaboración de colchones, venta de empanadas, venta de desayunos y comercio de cosméticos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de almuerzo, actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado a la hora del medio día en su puesto de venta fijo al aire libre. La venta de almuerzo consiste en 2 platos que son; la sopa que puede ser chairo (a base de chuño), lagua de choclo (choclo molido), de quinua, y otras, para continuar con el segundo plato que puede ser; aji de fideo (carne molida, fideo y ají rojo), revuelto de carne (trozos de carne, arroz, papa frita), lenteja (lenteja arroz y carne) y otros. Este negocio tiene mucha demanda por los trabajadores que no retornan a almorzar a sus hogares y que no tienen la costumbre de llevarse alimentos preparados al trabajo, “inicié mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar, mis clientes vienen todos los días a almorzar y otros traen sus envases para llevarse la comida y almorzar en sus casas… ” Comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que existe la demanda y necesidad la desventaja es la falta de capital para invertir en mejorar las condiciones. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina como; aceite, arroz, fideo huevo, carne, papa, chuño, etc., para atender a más clientes y mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que lleva desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Valentina solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor para la venta de almuerzo y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 23 year old woman. She lives with her spouse. She has a 12 year old son and her business is selling lunches. She is a good mother who is optimist, has a good attitude, is generous, kind, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the town of ‘Curubamba Baja’, 14 kilometers from the city, where the farmers who cultivate the land in the tropics have houses that the use when they get their harvests and bring them to the city to sell. It has a temperate climate with a temperature that varies between 18-25 degrees celsius during the day. 

Lidia has dark skin, brown eyes, long, black hair that she wears in a braid, short stature and a medium build. Her mother tongue is Quechua, which she speaks in her family, and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and for her business. She is the third from the right, wearing a white and light blue apron. She lives her life with her spouse, who works as a builder, and with her son, who is in school. They live in their own home, built of adobe, bricks, and cement with a metal sheeting roof. It has electricity and a well that is operated with a pump. Her wish to get ahead to have a more satisfactory life led to her leading a bank or people with businesses such as a sewing shop, weaving, selling fish, construction services, making mattresses, making empanadas, selling breakfasts and selling cosmetics. This was done to ask for a loan and improve their activities. Her business is selling lunches, an activity she does Monday through Saturday at midday in her permanent open air sales stall. The lunch she sells has two courses. The first is soup, which can be chairo (with a chuño base), lagua de choclo (ground corn), quinua soup, and more. The second course can be aji de fideo (ground meat, noodles and red peppers), revuelto de carne (pieces of meat, rice, fried potatoes), lentils (lentils, rice and meat), and more. The business has a lot of demand among the workers who don't go home for lunch and who don't have the custom of bringing lunch to work. “I started my business out a need to work. My customers come to eat lunch every day, and others bring their containers to take the food home and eat there.… ” she remarks. The advantage the business has is that there is demand and need, The disadvantage is a lack of capital to invest in improving conditions. Her dream is to open a restaurant. She wants to expand the business by buying ingredients such as oil, rice, egg noodles. meat, potatoes, chuño, etc. This way, she can serve more customers and improve her sales. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the 8 years she has been doing this activity.   

These are the reasons that Valentina is asking for a loan to buy cooking ingredients wholesale to sell lunches and open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients wholesale to sell lunches and open a restaurant.

loans.name: Bakila

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 32 ans, Bakila est une femme qui habite à Hanoukopé. Bakila vend des produits de beauté dans le quartier et gagne son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour arriver à ses fins, Bakila s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Pour commander des parfums, des poudre et détergents de beauté, Bakila demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’une marge bénéficiaire afin de subvenir favorablement aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Bakila is 32 years old, married and lives in Hanoukopé. Bakila sells beauty products locally and earns a living thanks to this business. To fulfill her business objectives, Bakila gets her products twice a month. Bakila is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy perfumes, powders and beauty cleansers, so that she can achieve a profit margin and successfully meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy 3 dozen bottles of perfume, 4 dozen boxes of powder and 4 boxes of soap.

loans.name: Jose Ines

texts.es:
José, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, se casó a los 22 años de edad, 12 años después quedo viudo y desde ese momento ha sido padre y madre para sus dos hijos, quienes se siente muy orgulloso de su padre, su primer hijo ya es mayor de edad y su hija menor acaba de cumplir 15 años de edad, ninguno estudia pues tienen que trabajar junto a su padre.

José, su principal fuente de ingresos es la venta de ropa, emprendió este negocio después de que murió su esposa y lo a prendió debido a la presión que tenia de suplir las necesidades de sus hijos, antes solo se dedicaba a la agricultura, ahora trabaja tres días por semana en la venta de ropa, para poder dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una novilla, con el objetivo de que en el futuro sea una vaca, su hijo será quien se encargará del cuidado de ella, pues tiene donde tenerla y quiere aprovechar este recurso. 
  
José, sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos y apoyarlos para que logren sus metas.
texts.en:
José, 51, studied up to the second grade. He got married when he was 22 and became a widower twelve years later. Since then, he has been both a father and a mother to his two children, who feel very proud of him. His oldest son is an adult and his daughter just became 15. None of them studies because they have to work together with their father.

José’s main source of income is his clothing sales business. He started this business after his wife died and learned empirically, aware of the need to fulfill his children’s need. He used to work in agriculture. He now works three days a week selling clothes, so that he can spend time with his children.

He needs a loan to buy a heifer. It will become a cow in the future and his son will be in charge of taking care of it. José wants to use some space he has to raise the cow.

José dreams of getting ahead with his children and supporting them so that they can achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Cansuelo Fabiola

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 61 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos vive en Guaranda en la parroquia Salinas provincia de Bolivar. Pertenece a la ventanilla rural Asoreicom que se dedican al comercio, manufactura, agricultura y ganaderia.
 Ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la compra de ganado, solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca ya que quiere incrementar su negocio, realiza las compras en Guaranda y en salinas cada 8 días, su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su ganado para asi obtener mejores ganancias, en su tiempo libre le gusta tejer y salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 61 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in Guaranda, in a village called Salinas, in the Bolivar province. She is a member of the communal bank Asoreicom. Other members work in manufacturing, agriculture and animal farming.

Consuelo works in agriculture and buying livestock. She is requesting a loan to buy a cow, since she wants to expand her business. She goes to Guaranda and Salinas to buy livestock every week. Her dream is to improve her business and the quality of the animals she buys in order to make more profits. She likes to take walks and knit during her free time.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Akole

texts.fr: Akolé est une femme mariée âgée de 38 ans et mère d’un enfant. Akolé vit à Hanoukopé pour entreprendre son activité. Akolé vend des produits d’alimentations générales pour gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Akolé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Akolé demande ce crédit pour acheter des cartons de spaghettis, de tomates de sardines afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants
texts.en: Akolé is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. Akolé lives in Hanoukopé for her business. Akolé sells groceries in order to earn a living and support her family. Akolé gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Akolé is requesting this loan in order to buy some boxes of spaghetti, of tomatoes and of sardines, so that she can earn a profit and support her husband with the family expenses, and ensure that her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of spaghetti, 6 boxes of tomatoes and 6 boxes of sardines.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio de 64 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado, es casado y padre de 3 hijos, dos de ellos son independientes y viven aparte y el otro vive con él en casa.

Emilio se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 40 años, lo aprendió de sus padres y hermanos ya que todos se dedicaban al mismo trabajo, él trabaja en una parcela que tiene cerca de su casa, mientras que su esposa le ayuda con los oficios del hogar y al cuidado de su familia.

Emilio necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para la siembra de granos básicos y así obtener una buena cosecha y mejores ganancias.

Su sueño para un futuro es obtener un crédito más grande en esta institución, y así seguir trabajando en la agricultura, desea obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Emilio is 64 years old. He went to school up to the 6th grade. He is married and is the father of 3 children. Two of them are independent and live on their own, and the other lives with him in his house. 

Emilio has worked in agriculture for 40 years. He learned it from his parents and siblings who all did the same kind of work. He works on a land parcel that he has close to his house, while his wife does the housework and cares for the family. 

Emilio needs the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to plant basic grains and thus have a good harvest and better earnings. 

His dream for the future is to obtain a larger loan in the future in this institution. That way, he can continue working in agriculture. He wants to obtain better income and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Rosa Bercelia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 67 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad pequeña dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café de variedad catimore, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 20 años y buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes y mano de obra para su cultivo de café, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 67 years old. She lives in her own home, made from rustic materials, with her spouse and their children in the district of Callayuc. It is a small community dedicated to agriculture and livestock. It is located in the Cajamarca region, northern sierra of Peru.

She works in agriculture, specifically, in growing catimor coffee. She has 20 years' experience in the business and good references from the residents of the district. The loan she will be given will be used for agricultural work, such as applying plant products and fertilizer, as well as labor costs for her coffee crop. This will help her improve her coffee crop physiologically, morphologically, and productively. She will also have a timely crop and therefore a better yield and a better product quality. This way, she will have no problem selling her product, which will generate more income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to do agricultural work such as applying plant products and fertilizer, as well as pay for labor for her crop.

loans.name: Elmer Alexander

texts.es:
Elmer, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tienen 2 hijos. 

Elmer, trabaja como albañil y se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, esto le ha servido para sacar adelante a sus hijos, antes era agricultor, recorre 9 kilómetros para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo y su horario es de 6 horas al día.

Elmer, necesita el crédito para comprar cemento, arena, hierro, bloque y pagar mano de obra, para mejorar su casa, porque hay una parte que está en mal estado y necesita repararla para tener un lugar más seguro para vivir. 

Los sueños de Elmer, son seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta, apoyar a sus hijos y a su esposa para que salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Elmer, 26 years old, studied up until ninth grade. He is married and his spouse is dedicated to domestic work and they have two children.

Elmer works as a mason and he has been dedicated to this work for ten years. This has helped him get his children ahead. Previously he was a farmer. He walks 9km to get to work and his schedule is six hours per day.

Elmer needs the loan to buy cement, sand, iron, blocks and to pay laborers to improve his home because there is a section that is in bad condition and he needs to repair it to have a safer place to live.

Elmer's dreams are to keep working at what he likes and support his children and his wife to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, blocks and to pay laborers to improve his house.

loans.name: Isidro Armando

texts.es:
Isidro es un pequeño productor en una comunidad rural de Jinotega, dedicado a la caficultura desde hace más de 8 años. Su finca es de 28 hectáreas, de las cuales 8.4 son de café. Su producción anual promedio en los últimos tres años ha sido de 250 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales maneja los criterios de certificación de comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices.

Para este año, él requiere un financiamiento para comprar los insumos y fertilizantes que aseguren la nutrición y mantenimiento de su plantación de café, a fin de poder garantizar una buena cosecha y con ello mayores ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
